abstract: RECTIFICATIE (uit nr.4, p271):In de bijdrage van Karl Bednarik op p. 155 van deze jaargang is een regel weggevallen; de auteur maakt ons op dit verzuim attent. De verminkte zin,die op regel 8 begint, moet luiden: „Täuschen wir uns nicht: auch in unserer demokratischen Welt drängen die meisten intellektuellen Bemühungen zu totalitären Ideologien hin, wenn sie nicht gerade zur totalen Verneinung neigen wie der pessimistisch eingestellte Existenzialismus. Meine Theorie ist fern vom Pessimismus, aber auch vom kramphaft idealisierenden Optimismus

title: Sociale gevolgen van de technologische ontwikkeling. Een terreinverkenning
De organisatie van het onderzoek in de sociologie
Sociale bindingen in een nieuwe stadswijk van Hilversum
Sociale aspecten van het wonen. Impressies van een UNO-congres
Kanttekeningen bij een jaarverslag van de Stichting tot ontwikkeling van de N.W. Veluwe

De Oneidagemeenschap in de staat New York
Bijdragen van het Isonevo. Overzicht van tijdschriften
Sociologische facetten der internationale samenwerking
abstract: Sociological aspects of international relations. A systematic and orientating survey of the sociological contribution to the knowledge of international relations. Many studies are strongly focused on practical application. And yet studies of national mentality in particular have had little influence; this factor is likely to be of minor importance and the intricacy of the problem must have disheartened the sociologist until now. The author points out the democratization inside and out many a nation and the discrepancy between ideal and reality. An important cultural lag appears to be noted here: in a democratic society, especially among the attitudes and opinions with regard to the international relations, still many aristocratic structural elements are to be perceived, notably among the average citizens.

title: Het  verenigingsleven in sociologisch perspectief. Enkele voorlopige verkenningen
abstract: Corporate life in a sociological perspective. In spite of the commonness of this phenomenon, the needs of authorities of social and cultural work and stimuli in foreign literature, a sociology of associations is as good as absent. Generally, associations are considered useful and looked upon as things stimulating integration, which should be advanced in all circumstances. The author checks a few categories first and discusses, in short, the possibilities of association as a social technique, as a group, as a situation, as an aspect of society in wider connection, as ideology and as an aspect of a historical phase. After a number of definitions the article is concluded with an attempt to a theory with respect to the concept ’mass-apathy of members of associations’. It is supposed that this is to be explained as well by the increasing organizational density of society, which Is attended by a shifting to newer and more adequate social techniques (organization, mass-control, formation of publics,  a.o.), a shifting of the associations to the self-expression type (Rose), a centralization and cluster formation, a segmentation of society according to socio-economic or ideological principles and other factors.

title: Aspecten van de selectie en sociale mobiliteit der Nederlandse burgemeesters in de grote steden
abstract: Aspects of the selection and social mobility of the Dutch burgomasters in the bigger municipalities. After a discussion of the functions of a Dutch burgomaster, data are given about selection and career. These office-bearers are predominantly over fifty years of age; mostly they are university-trained or of equal education, and have risen to their present posts via official or professional careers. Data about provenance are still lacking.

title: Problemen rondom een dorpsuitbreiding
abstract: Problems round the expansion of a village. A critical review of a report concerning the question if a certain village centre, which is situated near a big city (Eindhoven), should be extended or not and if such an extension should bear either an urban or a rural character.

title: Gerretson als socioloog
abstract: Gerretson as a sociologist. A condensed review of the sociological works of the historian, politician and poet Gerretson, who died recently. In 1911 there appeared an introduction to sociology by his hand, in which among other things he introduced the concept of sociography (even before Steinmetz), and, next to sociology, intended a task for sociosophy, a philosophical sociology. Gerretson also saw the unity of sociology and cultural anthropology.

title: De begrippen structuur en relatie in de sociologie: een inleidende beschouwing
abstract: The concepts of structure and relation, in sociology. An inquiry into the idea of structure in sociology tells us that this concept is applied in two meanings, which are to be clearly distinguished: 1st In the sense of a statistical idea of structure (differential frequency); 2nd as a definition for various stratifications. This second idea of structure was practically exclusively based upon a linear relation of order. The one-sided application of this term and the intricacy of society make us look out for other forms of relations. The equivalential relation, the total linear relation of order, the total cyclical relation of order, and the partial relation of order are reviewed here. Over and above this the possibility of tracing the forms of relations, present in society, in an empirical way, with the aid of the matrix method, is given serious consideration.

title: De planners en het publiek: uiteenlopende visies op een nieuwe woonwijk
abstract: Planners and the public. The problematical aspects of new neighbourhood units have been under discussion many times now. In this article the planner’s view is compared to what the inhabitant of such a quarter experiences as his area of living. Thus the problem is dealth with from ’above’ as well as up 'from below’. It appears that both ways exhibit great mutual differences. Data about this are given with regard to an inquiry in Moerwijk, a new quarter of The Hague. The author concludes that the drafting of neighbourhoods as surveyable units or living is utterly unfounded, and that more attention should be paid to the dwelling and to the housing differentiation.

title: De sociologie en de technisch-wetenschappelijke planning. Een voorbeeld van samenwerking in de praktijk
abstract: Sociology and techno-scientific planning. Contains a critical and praising review of a study about the social consequences of a re-allotment in the isle of Ameland, during which a successful realization of good co-operation between technicians and sociologist was attained. The population of the isle too had an active part in the inquiry.

title: Van onwillekeurige monsters en aselecte steekproeven. De enquête van Vrij Nederland
abstract: On chunks and random samples. A critical discussion of a study, by the socialistic weekly ’Vrij Nederland’, of attitudes and opinions of the Dutch youth on many topics of modern life and of their own situations. Problems of bias and non-response threaten the reliability of this study.

title: Bijdragen van het Isonevo. Overzicht van tijdschriften
Summaries of articles, published in nrs. 1 and 2, 1959
De joden van Amsterdam. III. Sociologisch-psychologische aspecten
Stadsbewoners over 'de boer'. Een Nederlands onderzoek naar groepsattitudes
Aspecten van maatschappelijke opbouw
abstract: Richtlijnen voor het territoriaal plan. Een plan van Ir. S. Maso en European Seminar on Community Development and Social Welfare in urban areas

title: De zeekant van Lamu: een maritieme variant op het thema 'peasant culture'
abstract: The seaside of Lamu. An attempt is made to explain certain characteristics of an East African sea shore society in terms of the duality peasant culture—great civilization as was done by Robert Redfield and others in Latin America and elsewhere. The Swahili speaking people with whom this paper is concerned occupy the Lamu archipelago off the coast of Northern Kenya, but roam the western coasts of the Indian Ocean in their sailing coasters or tiny fishing boats. Hence the sailors themselves, who form the peasant half of the dual society (immigrant Arabs and Indians make up for the towns component) cannot be called peasants in a narrow sense, although they share many characteristics with rustic landlubbers. Nevertheless, since they reveal a number of social traits peculiarly connected with their maritime habitat, the author suggests a new grouping of maritime peasants, thus accepting an extension of the term where Redfield refused to include e.g. the nomads of the Near East in the category, hesitating to speak of pastoral peasants. The present contribution is thought to be meaningful first on a limited scale, because of doing away with the explanatory concept of ’tribe’ for a community that cannot be comprehended or analysed on ’tribal’ lines; and further because it may open up new avenues of thought in dealing with maritime communities on the whole, whether primitive or not.

title: Groepspsychologie en huwelijksinstabiliteit
abstract: Group psychology and marital instability. From the point of view of group psychology the data about divorces in the Netherlands are highlighted. The higher divorce rates of religiously mixed marriages receive special attention. It was hypothesized that differences in opinions, ’beliefs’ , between group members will hinder the growth of group cohesiveness and facilitate the dissolving of such groups. Empirically it was fould that the main religious denominations cling from more to less to their own denomination as follows: Roman Catholic — Calvinistic — Dutch Reformed — no affiliation. It was striking, that consistently there is a higher divorce rate in the cases when the husband belonged to a more ’exclusive’ denomination than that of the wife. The author points at the cumulation of dominance (religious and social) in those cases. In the above mentioned series the divorce rates are smaller if one compares the rates of the combinations between adjacent denominations with those in which one or two positions are skipped. Finally some types of adjustment are described.

title: Sociologie van het protestantisme. Europees colloquium te Straatsburg
Het politieke handelen opnieuw beschouwd
abstract: The study of political behavior In a new view. When, applying Max Weber's distinction between Gesinnungspolitik and Verantwortungspolitik, we see that there has been a shifting towards the latter. The author pleads for a renewed study of the present political situation, especially of the operative political ideals, against this background.

title: Hoofdtrekken van het politiek proces
abstract: Main characteristics of the political process. In schematic form this article presents a theory of political sociology. It starts from Theodor Geiger’s distinction between power relations of an intercursive and an integral type, and from some of Max Weber’s insights. The author tries to show, that on this basis the political process may be analysed in sociologically meaningful terms. Discussed are the differentiation of political roles, the types and functions of politically relevant groups, the origin and functions of leaders and the types of political strategy which they tend to develop. Some of the important societal boundaries to the political; process are also mentioned. Dutch research in this field seems very rare.

title: Het kiesrecht van thans
abstract: Voting today. The introduction of universal suffrage in the 19th and 20th century meant a triumph of individualism and rationalism. Now that the extension of the franchise has ceased to be a problem, is is the equality of voters and the directness of the ballot that are being threatened by the activity of party machines, trade unions, pressure groups, etc.Examples from majority and P. R. systems are given. The problem is whether one vote should have one value or occupational groups should have an extra weight as such in parliamentary assemblies. There seems to be some hesitation to introduce functional representation in legislation, though members of occupational groups may indeed,by their influence on parties, have that extra weight which is denied to ordinary voters. In modern society this unequality in electoral matters coincides with a growing power of economic associations and may therefore, in a certain sense, be justified. Universal, equal and direct suffrage seems to have been only a short episode in Western history.

title: Sociologie der verkiezingen in Frankrijk en de V.S.
abstract: Electoral sociology in France and the United States. The article gives a critical review of two major trends in electoral sociology: the 'sociologie électorale’ as has been developped in France under the aegis of Siegfried and Goguel, and the ’voting behavior research’ , inaugurated by the works of Lazarsfeld, Berelson, c.s. Both trends study the conditions of electoral behavior, but show a marked contrast in approach, in method and in the type of conclusion arrived at. French electoral sociology explains election results in terms of objective, situational factors, amongs which geographical circumstances are considered to be of importance. Its quantitative analysis is based upon available statistical data and visual comparison of maps and diagrams is used as the main analytical tool. The American electoral sociology prefers the explanation of electoral behavior in terms of socio-psychological variables, collects its data through repeated interviewing of one sample (the panel) and uses more sophisticated techniques of quantitative analysis. After a critical examination of approach and method of both trends is is concluded that, although their greater reliability can be considered as an advantage, the results of the ’voting behavior research' are too naddowly confined to explanation on a functional level, whereas the 'sociologie électorale’ limits itself too much to an explanation of historical nature. Synthesis of approach and method of both trends will prove fruitful for the study of electoral behavior.

title: De aanpassingsproblematiek van de ambtenaren aangesteld bij de organen van Europese samenwerking
abstract: Problems of adaptation of civil service men In European agencies. The author reviews the adaption to the new surroundings and its problems, the uncertainty of the function, the question of promotion and the often unsatisfactory character of the work, that officials of the agencies of European integration experience in thier environment, which is internationally orientated, but which is, on the human level, often very limited. Adaptational difficulties of other members of a famllly very often cause a European career to fall. Indeed there have been developed a number of Initiatives to Improve the social climate in Luxemburg, Strassbourg and Brussels (European school, European parish, a.o.). The author pleads for a more systematic community organisation.

title: De geschiedenis op de tweesprong
authors: Dittrich,Z. R.,   Woude,A. M. van der
abstract: History on the crossroads. While the younger social sciences are flourishing nowadays, history has to cope with a serious internal crisis and finds that its authority and popularity among the laity as well as scholars are still diminishing. Facing this regrettable situation the historians of the traditionalist school usually recommend an Improvement of the literary qualities of the historiographical story-telling as the infallible means to get more readers. The authors of this paper, however, viewing the distressing methodological confusion among historians, emphasize the necessity of emancipation from the literary traditions of the historical work and from the subjectivist, speculative and metaphysical approach of the past, and suggest a full integration of history with the other social sciences.

title: Een onderzoek onder Amsterdamse jongeren
abstract: Social status and leisure time activities of Amsterdam youths. A rather critical review of a sampling study of 400 people between the ages of 15 and 24 done by graduate students of Amsterdam University Sociographic Workshop. Though a daring approach by means of scaling was made towards the analysis of status values in leisure time activities, the authors neither consider adequate the scaling methods used nor do they think these methods sufficient for a complete analysis of the material gathered. All menial cores falling to the students themselves and no mechanical devices being available, this left them with too little time for other possible analyses.

title: Nieuwe gegevens over de waardering van het meergezinshuis door de bewoners
Bijdragen van het Isonevo. Overzicht van de tijdschriften
De leefbaarheid van het platteland
abstract: The livability of rural areas, Article based on the general starting-point that the livability of rural areas will be experienced as insufficient by those people or groups that have iscovered that their level of living does not agree with the level of their aspirations. In historical retrospect it is traced how and when this discrepancy between level of living and pursued standard of living came into being. Processes of individualization and emancipation are discussed. Stress is laid on the influence of marginal groups such as the groups without landed property, and those under tutelage in the patriarchal system, notably the labourers, the women and the youth. Finally some inplications for future development are considered, and topics for further research mentioned.

title: Forensisme als maatschappelijk verschijnsel. Enkele factoren van het forensisme in de Tielerwaard
abstract: Commuting as a social phenomenon. This article tries to analyse the economic, and in particular, the sociological consequences of the increased rate of daily travel for new industrial workers. It is based on a inquiry among 287 commutors in the Tielerwaard, a region where heavy commuting already exists. The daily loss of time by travelling has a big influence on family and community life. One consequence is the danger that the industrial commutor is becoming a "marginal” person, e.g., he is neither present at social events of the factory, nor is he at the meeting of the trade unions in the community where he dwells. On the other hand, he contributes to the urbanization of the country by bringing in new ideas and ways of behaving. This article also tries to analyze the psychological reasons for the industrial commutor’s refusal to move from his rural home area to the industrial center.

title: Problemen van regionaal structuur-onderzoek. Een tweetal kritieken
Maatschappelijk werk en recht
abstract: Social work and the law. At first sight it seems doubtful whether there is a relation between those two: the law is rigid because of its being bound by written rules and by precedents, social work is dynamic and its solutions may differ from case to case. Nevertheless both are engaged in the study of man and society. To get a better insight in the relation between the law and social work it seems useful to confront one with the other by trying to enumerate their points of difference and their points of concurrence. The conclusions of this confrontation are: as to the law: 1) the experience of social work contains material for new legislation; 2) the experience of social work gives an insight in the way in which legal measures work out in reality; as to social work: 1) social work lays open the needs for new legislation; 2) social work shows the limits of the effectivity of the law, as, in the last instance, the integration of man in society is only possible — not by setting him strict rules — but by helping him in his concrete situation of emergency.

title: Sociometrische kennis als groepsdiagnose. Theoretische en praktische beschouwingen bij een uitgebreid onderzoek over het zogenoemde sociale klimaat in een medische instelling.
abstract: Sociometric knowledge as group diagnosis. At one of the investigations made in a medical institution a number of sociometric analysis techniques were used, which are meant to define the so-called social climate. The purpose of these techniques is first to examine the position of the individual in a group in connection with such factors as self confidence, the growth of the personality, the development of life and group-psychological phenomena. The author examines how far sociometric techniques really can make the social climate clear and how great the danger is that the sociometric test might be wrongly interpreted, especially when used for the construction of psycho-groups. Undoubtedly the ordinary tests reflects the existing relations as well as those wished for by the group. This study in a hospital however shows how, with the necessary caution and scientific objectivity, positive results can be reached.

title: Expansie en contractie van klein- en middenbedrijf-branches
abstract: Expansion and contraction of small independent firms. Brief description of one of the theses out of the general theory constructed by the Swiss social economist F. Marbach concerning the economically active middle classes. The thesis says that small independent firms, as a type of business, are not bound to be pushed away by big business, although single small firms might be regularly ousted from the market. This thesis is tested for the Netherlands by means of a study of the development of the amount of small firms during the period 1930—1950.

title: Interne migratie
abstract: lntra-urban migration. Some theoretical conclusions are drawn from a statistical study on intra-urban migration in The Hague, Holland. Stress is laid on geographic relations of urban areas and on the interconnections of social mobility and the process of moving from one area to another.

title: Het sociale leven in al zijn facetten
Bijdragen van het Isonevo. Overzicht van tijdschriften
Stad, stedelijkheid, Stadsgemeente. Een literatuur-onderzoek naar het object der "urban sociology"
abstract: City, urbanity, and the urban community. A critical approach to the object of urban sociology. This essay tries to answer the question, whether a satisfactory solution as to the delimitation of urban sociology can be found by definition of the central concept of the „city”. As many modern development show a lessening relation between the city and those social characteristics by whom the city usually has been defined, this question has to be denied. The solution of a „community sociology”, as posed bij René König, is also disappointing in the end, as several processes in society make probable a decreasing sociological relevance of the geographical factor in social life. A solution of this methodological dilemma might be found in the development of a special sociology of the geographical ties of man and of the processes (e.g. processes of de-geographization) who are to be observed here.

title: Een evaluatie van de planmatigheid in de Noordoostpolder
abstract: An evaluation of planning in the North-Eastern Polder. In this article the author considers a number of recent publications concerning the societal life in the second Zuiderzee-Polder He compares the results of these inplicitly evaluative publications with the forecasts made some 15-20 years ago, delivering the base for the social planning in the new land. His conclusion is, that geographical distance still is an important element in the life of the population notwithstanding the change of scale. The author moreover makes some remarks on the criteria for the evaluation of forecasts.

title: Burencontacten en kennismakingsritueel. (Een onderzoek in enkele oudere, gegoede Utrechtse wijken
abstract: The process of making acquaintance with neighbors in a residence area. An investigation into the ways of making acquaintance with neighbors of newley moved in residents in an upper middle class neighborhood of Utrecht. 60 personal interviews with married couples were held, open end questions being the most extensively used. The sending of visitingcards, prescribed in former days by the rules of etiquette, proved to be thought of as conservative and rather meaningless. People prefer to establish direct personal contacts with neighbors. For many people however the entering into contact is still founded on certain standardized principles („it simply ought to be done”), as is the readiness to give help and mutual assistance. Selective processes as to religion and status prove to arise only in a later phase of residence; they influence the building of more intimate personal relationships.

title: Vriendschapsbanden in het bedrijf en het personeelsverloop. Follow up van een sociometrisch onderzoek
abstract: Interpersonal relations and labour turnover. This study is part of an action-research project in the laundry-industry. According to current personnel-management philosophy, positive interpersonal relations on the job make for stability of the labour force, especially as regards women workers. This hypothesis is operationally checked and invalidated bij computing a rank-correlation of popularity-scores according to a sociometric test and follow-up data on personnel exits in a period of five years after. The experimental group consisted of 27 women workers in a laundry plant. The data suggest an alternative hypothesis: Friendships on the job condition labour turnover in this way, that friends tend to follow each other, either in staying on the job or in resigning.

title: Openbare communicatie beïnvloeding
abstract: The study of communication on Dutch universities. The study of modern mass media and communication is integrated into the university programs under different labels. The author pleads for a more uniform approach on the general platform of „the study of social communicative influence” as a specific branch of sociology.

title: Bijdragen van het Isonevo. Overzicht van tijdschriften
Symbool en samenleving
abstract: Symbols and society. The attention paid by sociologists to the problem of symbolism has thus far been relatively small, as compared with the contributions of philosophers and psychologists. This is an astonishing fact because sign-systems are the principal means by which men enter into mutual relationships, and organize, maintain and stimulate their group-life. Starting from “sign” as the most general concept, the author distinguishes these into natural and conventional signs. Whereas all natural and a part of the conventional signs function as signals, many of the latter have a symbolic function. A sign functions as a signal by indicating or pointing to something located in one’s direct or "possible” field of experience. Symbols refer to something transcending specific experiences, to things ”in absentia”, which confronts their interpretation with peculiar difficulties.

title: Enkele latente politieke functies van het hedendaags Boeddhisme in Z.O.- Azië
abstract: Some latent political functions of Buddhism in S. E. Asia. Although Buddhism is not by nature a political system, it is very much involved in social and political forces of modern South-East-Asia. The revival of Buddhism is partly a consequence of the fact, that it by history and philosophical character can be adapted in different ways to certain political tendencies, and in this way may function as a vehicle of different political systems or ideas. It is mentioned in connection with several kinds of nationalism, pan-asiatic internationalism, marxism and communism. There is no unanimity as to the possibility of dysfunctions resulting from these developments for Buddhism in its original form, but this possibility is acknowledged by Buddhists themselves, which resulted into action in the countries concerned.

title: Muzieksociologische kanttekeningen rond het auteursrecht van de componist
abstract: Musico-sociological remarks on the composer’s copyright. The article describes the development of modern copyright of the composer. The invention of music- printing, and the improvement of this process which made possible mass production in music publishing, at first only led to legal protection of the publisher. Only recently the composer has received this protection for his achievements. The fact that this protection only lasts 50 years after the composer's death is made understandable in the light of social conceptions of law and justice. In passing the article also deals with the sociological impact of music publishing upon the development of style as composers were more or less forced to accommodate to the taste of the buying public.

title: Recreatie in en rond de stad
Bijdragen van het Isonevo. Overzicht van tijdschriften
Het begrip van "onderontwikkeldheid" en de geschiedwetenschap
Antropologie en acculturatie. Enige beschouwingen over de betekenis van de culturele antropologie voor de problematiek der onderontwikkelde gebieden
A psychologist's approach to technological change
Het discontinue wereldbeeld
abstract: The discontinuous conception of life. The author gives illustration to his statement, that the geographical conception people have of their lives is not continuous but discontinuous. He argues that the home is the centre of man’s world. His interest however in what happens outside his home does not decrease regularly in direct relation to the distance. On the one hand he has scattered nuclei of interest in several parts of his country or over the world, on the other hand there seems to be a structured pattern around his home wherein the most striking fact is the existence of a ratified zone between the entity home-family and a far greater entity such as a state or perhaps the world. We are interested intensely in let us say the engagement of our daughter or son, and apart from that in the marriage of princess Margaret or the king of Belgium. We jump from the own family directly to the nation or to the world as a whole. In the article this theory of the ratified zone is supported by data especially from the municipal, provincial and national polls.

title: De toekomst van Heerenveen. Verslag van een gezelschapsspel. Uitgave van het Kerncomité-Heerenveen mei 1960
Het hinderlijk medelijden. Recente bijdragen tot de studie van het vluchtelingenprobleem
Das zweite europäische Seminar über Soziologie des Protestantismus. Bericht und kritische Würdiging
Bijdragen van het Isonevo. Overzicht van tijdschriften
Onderontwikkeldheid, sociologisch gezien
abstract: Underdevelopment from a sociological viewpoint, Up till now the sociological study of the problem of underdevelopment has largely been seen as a residu problem remaining form an economic approach. The author tries to give a pure sociological approach in the form of six propositions. (1) In an underdeveloped territory tendencies of secularization often appear in an acute and pernicious way. (2)  Underdevelopment means incoherence and invariance of forms of social organization. (3) Social differentiation in an underdeveloped territory is not integrated into one whole system. (4) Forms of social control are of rather reduced value. (5) There is no integration of the national organization (state) into the social life of the underdeveloped territory. (6) The systems of communication within an underdeveloped territory and with other territories are fragmentary and erratic.

title: Convergence in the pre-take-off-period
abstract: The Institute of Social Studies, the Hague, organised during the last four years, seminars dealing with selected countries during a selected period. Among others: Turkey under Mustapha Kemal, Egypt under Mohammed Ali, Ceylon and Jamaica between 1880 and 1920. They are to be understood as casestudies in gaining a better insight in the general process of economic development and social change. It was realised that the studies concentrated on the pre-take-off period in the Rostovian sense. The outstanding phenomenon in all cases turned out to be the socalled „contraction” of society. It means that tendencies to centralization, to unification and to isolation from its environment, could be pointed out in the different fields of economics, sociology and of political science.

title: An approach to community development in Partinico
Dahrendorfs "Soziale Klassen und Klassenkonflikt" : een nadere beschouwing
Gezinsvormen in het Caribisch gebied
abstract: Family structures in the Caribbean. In this article the literature on Caribbean family types is used as an illustration of the debate between the „historical” and the „ahistorical" (structural-functional) approach in anthropology. After briefly outlining the historical explanation of Herskovits, Henriques et.al. of the so-called matrifocal family, Raymond Smith’s „functional” explanation of this type of family is critically reviewed. An attempt is made to show that Smith, in trying to understand the matrifocal family type among rural British Guiana Negroes, actually uses a „British” model of society instead of a British Guianese one. References to the British Guiana rural Hindu group and to the Puerto Rican coffee workers (the latter as studied by Steward cs.) are made in order to show to what degree „cultural” („historical”) factors do limit the functional „necessity” of matrifocal family types. It is further stated that the influence of the extra-marital behaviour of the dominant and prestigious whites on the family patterns of the Caribbean Negro groups, is seriously being underestimated.

title: Institutionele aspecten van de arbeidsverhouding
abstract: Institutional aspects of industrial relations. The growing interest in sociological research in the Netherlands has many positive elements, both from a theoretical and a practical angle. There is however a tendency to rely too much on surveys which only probe into subjective matters. It is shown with the help of research into industrial relations that this is only a very onesided approach, which will not be able to take into account all factors that determine this type of social refction. In this context reference is made to various sectors of labour law, collective agreements, this situation on the labour market, etc. Only a combination of the two approaches will ultimately yield results.

title: Emancipation and revaluation of community development principles. With special regard to underdeveloped countries
abstract: The author critically reviews some basic elements of the present community development theory. Some principles, though fundamentally sound, are suffering from an emotional-loaded idealism. A realistic view on community development problems (and those of other technical assistance) is necessary. In part I he points out, that the social sciences are the real base for any community development program, in training as well as in the application in the field — much technical assistance is failling because it neglects the human approach; that more attention should be paid to the people (and the areas) who receive assistance (in this respect he states four conditions for changing people’s attitude). In part II he reviews the person of the community development worker: his background, recruitment, training and his job in the field. In part III he comes to a revaluation of community development in order to promote a new approach.

title: Schelsky's poging tot vernieuwing der godsdienstsociologie
abstract: Schelsky’s endeavour after renewal of the sociology of religion. In this article the author discusses the famous paper of the German sociologist Helmut Schelsky on „Ist die Dauerreflektion institutionalisierbar?” (in Zeitschrift fur evangelische Ethik, 1957). The author assents to Schelsky’s opinion that the theme of the classical sociology of religion (Weber, Troeltsch, Sombart), namely the historical deduction of modern world from Christianity should be changed into the opposite theme: the adaptation of Christianity to modern society. The most important aspect of this process of adaptation concerns the transformation of the consciousness of faith. Schelsky calls this transformation „Dauerreflektion”, i.e. the permanent subjective reflection on the contents of faith. Finally the author investigates to what new researches the study of the sociology of religion is stimulated by Schelsky’s remarkable endeavour.

title: Sociologie van de oecumene
abstract: Sociology of ecumenical phenomena. Gabriel le Bras has become one of the most important pioneers of the sociology of religion and religious groups. In his conception this sociology should also be detached from a restricted preoccupation with one’s own religious creed. So the study of ecumenical phenomena was to be an integral part of sociological research and theory in this branch. The actuality of this topic is underlined; it is shown to be in the centre of scientific and practical interest of clergy and laymen and to bear great importance for future sociological studies. Some research done recently also points in this direction; typical examples are mentioned, one of which has been described somewhat in more detail.

title: Protestantse ethiek en rationeel kapitalisme. Bijdrage tot een oneindige discussie
abstract: Protestant ethic and the rational aspect of capitalism. In an effort to straighten out misunderstandings about Webers famous essay, the author first asks the question why it has become a classic feature of sociology. Some discrepancies in Webers objectives are hinted at. His first chapter was based on a Ph. D. thesis from one of his students, Maftin Offenbacher. This chapter is severely criticised with the help of a new book on Webers essay by the Swedish economic historian Kurt Samuelsson called Economy and Religion. Summaries are given of this book and of Webers argument. Several of Samuelssons remarks appear to be misdirected when he tries to attack Weber on too many levels with the aim only to demonstrate the non-existence of a relation between protestant ethic and the spirit of capitalism. His criticism of inner logic of Webers contribution, however, is thought to be sound. Besides, his book contains a useful compilation of Webers criticism. In his summing up the author states that we can’t give a general judgement on Webers article. Various themes, which Weber was to work out later must already have occupied his thought at that early period. Some of these are to be appreciated, e.g. Webers theory of the innerioorldly asceticism, others on the contrary, were too little developed yet in this essay, e.g. the relation to the capitalist ethos and the general aspects of the social psychology of religion and of his later theories on progressive rationalization. Weber should have stopped before using his idealtypical method in the analysis of the development of capitalist thought. Nowadays, an individualising, rather than generalising approach in historical sociology should be prefered in combination with functional methods.

title: De sociologie van parochie en kerkelijke gemeente
abstract: The sociology of the parish. After a brief description of the parish as a social system (§1), the empirical investigations are divided into two main categories (§2). In the external approach (I) either the relationship between outside variables as age, sex, socio-economic status and the religious behavior of the individual parishioners (A) or the interdependence between the geographic-historical environment and the religious life of the parish (B) is investigated. The internal approach (II) is illustrated by research into the role-relationships within the parish (A), the structure and function of parochial societies (B) and other sub-groups (C). It is argued that best strategy consists in a combination of both approaches, of which the internal one has to furnish the dominating point of view, which will facilitate the proper sociological integration of research findings (§3).

title: De maatschappelijke werking van het recht
abstract: The impact of law upon society. Before and shortly after the war, the author had attempted to analyse in a series of publications the impact of legislation upon society, by stressing its indirect psychological influence on the bulk of the population. At that time his views were largely ignored, both by lawyers and students of the sociology of law. A recent doctoral dissertation by H. J. Pot who, in a critical analysis, drew attention to his views and to those, defended in the past by Jeremy Bentham and more recently by Anders V. Lundstedt, induced the author to develop again the concept of social impact of law, in the light of modern sociological theory. He attempts to reveal the reasons, why lawyers are, in general, opposed to his concept of law as an instrument for social engineering, and forwards a few suggestions for sociological research by combined teams of lawyers and sociologists.

title: De legalisering van de rechtssociologie en het rechtssociologisch onderzoek
abstract: Legalizing the sociology of law. The development of a sociology of law has, in some respects, been hindered by too much discussion on theoretical programs, which were never translated into concrete research. In fact, however, some research on topics, which might be called juridical-sociological but happened not to be called so, has already been done. Mentioned are studies by E. C. Snyder, Jessie Bernard, S. A. Stouffer, K. Lindemann, H. A. Brasz, F. Fiirstenberg, a.o. It might be useful to further a survey of what has been done so far and to systematize topics for further research. Therefore a more intensified collaboration between jurists and sociologists would be quite welcome.

title: Rechtssociologische benadering van de stuwadoorswet
abstract: Sociological approach to the Stevedore’s Act. The annual reports of the government service which executes the Dutch Stevedore’s Act, are analysed as a case-study in the sociology of law. It is found that the protections of the dockworkers, such as regulations of the labour market, the working hours and weekend-work, are stimulated by the Act. This is however done with reference to the difficulties in labour supply, competition with foreign ports and the like. Thus, the execution of the Act is clearly adapted to the peculiarities of the industry concerned. The same conclusion can be reached with reference to the working situation on the docks, where general shortages of workers and shortages of skilled labourers force the government service to a lenient attitude. Indirectly also a certain pressure on extension of the training facilities can be observed. In general the service concerned seems to prefer an indirect pressure in order to reach the objectives of the Act. Often this is done by manipulating the existing means of social control and not by using the relatively unimportant financial sanctions of the Act itself. In general it can be said that over a period of 15 years the policies of the government service are dialectically alternating between orientation towards employer values and orientation towards employee values. In this process pressures from trade unions and employers associations seem to play a certain role, although further forces may also be at work, but these are not mentioned in the reports analysed.

title: Over en rondom rechtssociologie. Enige recente literatuur
Oecumene als seculair sociologisch begrip
abstract: Oecumene as a secular sociological concept. The word oecumene has its origin in the Greek word „oikoumene”. Both words show a variety of meaning. The present usage of the word oecumene is not confined at all to the meaning of „Christian world” and „the church throughout the world”. In human geography oecumene is still common for the oecological concept of the inhabited and inhabitable surface of the earth. In anthropology and sociology the word was used e.g. by Kroeber to indicate an historic culture aggregate of higher civilization and by Redfield to classify the types of cities as before and after the industrial revolution and Western expansion (before and after the „universal oecumene”). Historians talk about the buddhist and moslem oecumenes. The word may also be used to refer to the communist world. Because of its variety of meaning the word oecumene may become a very useful concept in a cultural sociological study of world development. It implies a general historical perspective of cultural growth as well as a perception of the tremendous conflicts in the present situation of the „universal  ecumene”. Its use as a secular concept may stimulate „oecumenical movements” to recognize world-wide problems of human existence as urgent matters for joint action.

title: Sociologie en de studie van acculturatieverschijnselen: convergentie van disciplines
abstract: Sociology and the study of acculturation. This paper tries to show in which ways sociology can contribute to the study of acculturation .In the first section acculturation is briefly compared with other forms of social change. Two definitions of acculturation are distinguished, a limited and a more comprehensive one. Then some sociological concepts are discussed, which may be useful as analytical tools for the study of acculturation. Most prominent among them are Parsons’ „pattern variables”, and the concept of function, anomie, social role, and reference group. In the third  ection some results of empirical studies notably on communication and the introduction of new farm methods, are summarized and their relevance for the study of acculturation is  demonstrated. Finally, an attempt is made to integrate some of the sociological concepts discussed in section II with some of the research findings of section III.

title: In memoriam Alfred Louis Kroeber. Notitie over leven en werk
abstract: The essay is an evaluation of the scientific work of Prof. Kroeber who died last year. Its aim is to show how his studies of the theory of culture are related with the practical aspects of historic approach. The importance of his essay on the „Super-organic” is stressed, which introduced his postulate of the automous reality of all cultural phenomena and his definition of the historic approach which „preserves" its phenomena in their context by „descriptive integration”. In his empiric study of cultural phenomena his two-sided concern with world-wide reconstruction of the history of cultures and with the morphology of culture-patterns is sketched. It is contended that both in his spatial-static and his diachronic-dynamic reconstruction of cultural phenomena his method is similar. He built culture-traits and historic facts into complexes and patterns which he used to prove either a historic relationship between cultures or the profile of a culture pattern. And even where he made use of historic personalities he was not concerned with the accidents and individuals in history as such. The author sees a relation between Kroeber’s characteristic use of the concept of culture in the „Super-organic” and his interest in culture patterns and large-scale historicalrelationship between cultures. Kroeber avoided the manifest dangers of his approach to history by the modesty with which he used his method. He enriched the study of manking by the broad perspectives which he offered to its history.

title: De Surinaamse bevolking en haar districtscommissarissen. Enkele aantekeningen
abstract: Role of the „district-commissioners" of Surinam. This essay is a description of the important position Surinam „districtscommissarissen” (i.e. district-commissioners) have got in Surinam society, in particular outside the Surinam capital, Paramaribo. The author deals with the competencies and responsibilities these local administrators have in accordance with statutory law and governmental instructions, especially in the agrarian sphere. His main object however is to describe what problems and complaints the population is used to submit to the commissioner and his assistents (the „Bestuursopzichters"). His inductive material consists of accounts of what happened on some „audiëntie-morgens” (public audiences on fixed dates) he attended. There was an enormous diversity of matters. Moreover the commissioner himself as well as his assistants are often involved in public and even private festivities as well expected to take part in mischief and trouble. The author’s conclusion is that the present impartial and socially important position these functionaries needs to be maintained by wise policy of the Surinam government.

title: Verkennend onderzoek naar doelstelling en werkwijze van een buurthuis in een nieuwe woonwijk
Enige beschouwingen over de muzieksociologie van Paul Honingsheim
Politieke functies van partijen en belangengroepen
abstract: Political functions of parties and organised groups. This article aims at answering the question, which are the essential differences between political parties and organised interest groups. Historically, interest groups arose earlier than political parties and sometimes developed into them. Structural definitions which try to formulate the differences between both categories meet with three difficulties: they do not recognize structural differences between parties, between interest group, and points of resemblance between both. Generally, political parties and interest groups have the same functions in the political proces: selection of the political elite, communication between elite and other active citizens, participationof the citizens in the political proces, and integration of diverse opinions and interests. The significant distiction, however, lies in the fact that parties are more politically active: they occupy themselves with the whole field of politics, and political activities take a more important place in the whole of their activities. In their functioning parties and interest groups are complementary.

title: Traditionele onkerksheid in Drente. Over het sociologisch onderzoek van kerksheid en onkerksheid
abstract: Traditional non-church-attendance in Drente; on the sociological study of churchattendance. In the first part it is shown that in Dutch sociology of religion, students studying the relation between man and church, tacitly and in some cases erroneously, postulate ubiquitous normative church-attendance. This postulate is probably based on a bias: most sociologists who study these phenomena are themselves deeply involved in churchlife and tend to see non church-attendance as abnormal, as a social problem rather than a sociological one. The result is that research into the causes of non-church-attendance is nearly exclusively centered on the „exceptions” even if these persons, unnoticed by the sociologist, act strictly according to the norms of their own group. This situation implies almost automatically the possibility of ad hoc explanations, because the sociologist is unaware of the fact that a certain cause, held responsible for non-church-attendance, holds equally well for those who go to church. This is escapable only by rigorous comparison between those individuals who attend church and those who do not. Part two gives data based on fieldwork in a Drents rural community where church-attendance is not customary. Individuals who occupy a position in church however are expected to go. These individuals are chosen on a basis of general ability and attend church regularly. After they have filled their term, they do not enter church anymore.

title: De "centres de travaux agricoles" en de ontwikkeling van het Marokkaanse platteland
abstract: The Centrale de Travaux Agricoles (founded 1945) aimed originally at the total modernization of rural Morocco. A choc psychologique was to start this process. Local Centres, working on agriculture as well as health, hygiene and education were created to guide this development. After Independence the activities have been limited to agriculture. Operation Labour, ploughing the farmer’s fields with tractors is the first task. Agricultural extension suffers from lack of trained personnel. As during Protectorate times, the leaders of the C.T.A. have a paternalistic attitude towards the fellah.

title: Strategie van spel en strijd: Nieuwe mogelijkheden voor de conflictsociologie?
De sociale functie van het recht
Het geboorteniveau van de Rooms-Katholieken in het Drostambt Tudderen
abstract: In his study concerning the birth level of the Dutch Roman Catholics (Leiden, 1954), F. van Heek treats the r between religion & birth rate. The religious influence on birth rate is seen as operating in 2 ways: through pure ecclesiastical & socorg'al channels. To demonstrate the diff in influence of each of these components, a soc laboratory or an area where Catholic soc org's are operating without the church is needed. Tudderen, a territory at the Dutch-German frontier near Sittard, placed temporarily under Dutch gov after the war, is such an area. Here the Dutch Roman Catholic clergy has no jurisdiction, but a good many Dutch Catholic soc org's are present. In this area the birth rate rose from 19.5 in 1950 to 25.0 in 1959, while the birth rate in the adjoining German area dropped from 16.3 to 12.9. This may be an indication that the soc-org'al component of the religious influence has a far greater influence than the pure ecclesiastical one. AA.
tags: ROMAN CATHOLIC, IN TUDDEREN, BIRTH RATE OF,

title: Huwelijksadvertenties in India
abstract: The shift from the traditional matchmaker to the matrimonial advertisement, esp among educated Ur circles, is one of the many changes in contemporary India. An investigation of 305 such advertisements from about 50 consecutive issues (JAN 1957) of the Madras daily newspaper The Hindu & of 374 advertisements from consecutive issues (JAN, 1959) of The Hindustan Times Weekly of New Delhi permitted comparison between the customs of south & north. In both areas the advertisements were placed by the fam, not the individual. More daughters than sons were offered for marriage & husbands were most often requested for girls between the ages of 21 & 25, brides for men between 26 & 30. Though officially banned, caste was mentioned in 96% of the southern advertisements & in 83% of the northern. Horoscopes & dowries remained of greater importance in the south than in the north, where 32% stated that no dowry was expected. Qualities sought or offered in a bride were good looks, housekeeping talents, Coll or U educ, musical or cultural abilities & health. Light skin was highly desired in the south but not at all in the north where there was greater emphasis on educ. The professional, soc, & econ position of the man was of 1st consideration, with prefernce for those in gov service, followed by private businessmen, teachers & military officers. The econ value of the professionally trained woman was brought forward in several ads of both north & south. Widowers who placed 8 ads in The Hindu & 3 in The Hindustan Times Weekly stated that they had no objection to widows, but specified unencumbered virgin widows. The stress on independent income points to a breakdown' in the jointfam tradition & to the establishment of individual fam's, to which the educated woman is making ever greater contributions. AA.

title: Arbeid en consumptie
abstract: Labor & consumption have in the past mainly been considered separately. These phenomena seem to have become increasingly interdependent as a result of changes in the org of production consumption. The theory of Hannah Arendt (See A0385) who distinguishes between labor- the activity corresponding to the biological process of the human body & work - the activity providing the 'artificial' world of things is cited. 'Work' processes increasingly adopt the characteristics of 'labor' processes. A labor market was enacted in 19th cent England with hunger as the driving force. Increasing division of labor & the consequent mechanization lead to an increasing demand for unqualified human labor power. Specialization, which is guided by the finished product & which leads to the development of occup's, is replaced by division of labor, directed at simplification of operations. In mass production occup's are replaced by quasioccup's, bearing the characteristics of `labor': repetition & endlessness. Seniority procedures stimulate a demand for unqualified labor. The endlessness of labor processes is guaranteed by the fact that durable goods obtain the character of consumption goods, the rate of use being greatly accelerated. Processes like fashion & design improvement, which are part of the production process, stimulate the wear & tear of technically durable goods. Design development means built-in wastage; the artistic element of production is a laxative in the process of metabolism. Hunger is no longer the driving force to labor, a new hunger applies: the standard of living. Market org changed correspondingly. Retail trade lost its information function, which was taken over by the producer - the demiurge of metabolism. Advertisements are the main source of information, providing goods with individuality & binding consumers to a particular type of product. AA.

title: De agrarische geschiedenis als wetenschap en haar relatie tot de sociologie
abstract: Ru history is an example of a multi-disciplinary field of study to which the sci's of sociol, economics, general history, & others contribute. Its development up until now has been hindered by a very descriptive approach of unrelated elements, by a complex of emotional att's toward Ru society, by the predominating influence of historians who were primarily interested in law, & by a static view of Ru societies. Some modern fields of Ru historical res are discussed, esp macro-econ & micro-econ res. Special attention is paid to the co-operation between Ru historians & Ru sociol'ts at Wageningen Agri'al U, not only in view of special problems, but also in relation to res methods. H. M. Jolles.
tags: SOCIOLOGY, RURAL HISTORY AS A SCIENCE & ITS RELATION TO,

title: Neo-nazisme en -fascisme. Enige sociologische notities
abstract: A study of the structure, ideology & soc signif of 4 internat'l org's, the European Soc Movement, Nordische Sammlung, HIAG & the Fascist Internat'l. These org's cannot be considered as merely remnants of the past for 3 reasons: (a) many persons, owing to their specific situational background, are accessible for rightist authoritarianism (Adorno), (b) many Fascist groups in Europe, because of a lack of European ideology, tend to accept the ideology of the ESM, & (c) neofascism & neonazism may function as a point of polarization in a process of mutually stimulating pol'al leftism & rightism. AA.
tags: FREUD, SIGMUND, -NEO & NEO-FASCISM, SOME SOCIOLOGICAL REMARKS,

title: De samenstelling van de Leuvense studentenbevolking in het licht der democratisering
Verschijningsvormen van de sociologie en het speelveld der sociale wetenschappen
abstract: A sci is not only a body of knowledge; it has a soc & cultural form, including scholars & their personal characteristics, their profession, their Sch's, the structures of sci'fic educ & res, & a wealth of cultural factors, esp language. This should be recognized when the chances of multidisciplinary integration are studied. Every sci tries to reach the highest possible degree of internat'l integration in all respects, ideal & real. It is proposed to call this intergration the 'hardness' of a sci. The hardness of a sci refers to the: (1) consensus about its object matter & its method, (2) org'al unity of its scholars, (3) coherence of its res work, (4) systematization of production, publication & documentation, (5) harmonization of its central issues with important societal values, (6) soc usefulness of its results & of its scholars, (7) harmonization of the desire for a professional language & the wish for more general accessibility, (8) confluence of sci'fic interests & societal needs, & (9) capacity to present a comprehensive coherent view of the world. In the field of the soc sci's there are several nuclei of 'hardness': (1) theological, (2) medical, (3) juridical, (4) econ, & (5) technical. Sociol, then, seems to be a rather 'soft' sci. With no agreement on a central soc value, always equivocating, debunking, unmasking. Sociol shows a strong tendency to give provisional solutions, always has trouble with the purity of its contents, & has, as yet, no clear professional structure. However, this may be an advantage for the usefulness of sociol as a medium of intergration in the field of soc sci. Some conclusions are drawn re the future interdisciplinary integration of theory & res in the soc sci's. AA.
tags: SOCIOLOGY, & THE SOCIAL SCIENCES, FORM OF,

title: In memoriam Prof. Dr. R. van Dijk
tags: SOCIOLOGY, & THE SOCIAL SCIENCES, FORM OF,

title: Italiaanse arbeiders in de Limburgse mijnstreek en in Twente. Aanpassingsproblemen en sociale begeleiding
abstract: An inquiry into the problems of integration of young unmarried M Italians, temporary immigrants, in the Netherlands coal-mining district of Limburg & in the textile industrial region of Twente. If soc change from traditional societies into the highly developed industrial regions is important, 3 types of reactions among immigrants may arise: positive, indifferent, negative. In both Dutch regions the Italian groups acted in a positive way, accepting the functional & structural diff's & taking advantage of them. In both regions econ conditions hardly varied but soc conditions greatly differed. The employers of Limburg mainly dealt with the immigrant workers re the recommendations of the UNESCO conference of Apr 1956. Some favorable results may be attributed to this kind of admin, eg, the influence of trained interpreters & diligent & assiduous soc & religious workers. The process of integration is smoother when the group is not too large & homogeneous, & the site of the boarding-houses, inside the towns or outside, proved to be important in many respects. The employers of the Twente textile district generally limited their care to financial conditions, training & lodging. Public authorities hardly paid attention to promoting integration. This proved to be insufficient & there were riots. Main factors seemed to be lack of knowledge of the language & customs; eg, the long visits the Italians paid to bars & cafes without drinking much, & their manner of courting girls. On the other hand, aggressive young autochtonic people provoked the immigrants' anger. Very few clubs accepted the Italians, but they did not care much for such club memberships anyway. If immigrants, individuals as well as groups, seem to be incapable of sufficient integration (because of lack of educ, lack of ability, egocentrism, or otherwise), the public authorities have to develop a program of integration & apply it as soon as possible, in order to avoid econ & soc troubles. AA.
tags: WORKER, ITALIAN, IN THE NETHERLANDS COAL- MINING DISTRICT,

title: Mens en organisatie in het bedrijf. Een evaluatie van nieuwere literatuur
abstract: What affects the behavior of the individual in the org? Can the objectives of the org be united with those of the individual (Indiv) question A number of authors (among them D. McGregor, C. Argyris, R. Likert, & R. L. Katz) have studied the problem of the Indiv vis-a-vis the org. A general pattern can be recognized in the theories: the Indiv in the org behaves as he does, because he cannot satisfy his fundamental needs in the work situation. The following needs are to be considered as essential for the Indiv: (1) Physiological needs - connected with the maintenance of life; food, drink, rest, shelter, protection from the elements. (2) Safety needs - for protection from danger & the needs for soc security. Under today's conditions, management has provided relatively well for the satisfaction of physiological & safety needs. These needs having ceased to be dominant motives for behavior, other needs are emerging, the importance of which is not sufficiently recognized. These are: (A) Soc needs - the Indiv needs belonging, to give & receive friendship & love. (B) Egoistic needs, of 2 kinds - (i) those that relate to self-esteem (needs for selfrespect, autonomy, achievement, competence, knowledge), & (ii) those that relate to reputation (needs for status, recognition, appreciation, the respect of one's peers). (C) Needs for self-fulfillment - the Indiv needs to realize his own potentialities. The present situation in most org's generally offers little opportunity for expression of the higher-level needs. Consequently, strong feelings of frustration, conflict, & failure arise in the Indiv. To maintain his balance, he will seek a certain adaptation, the most important form of which is the lowering of job performance level & apathy & disinterest. He is `working' in the org, but `living' outside. management has adopted a far more humanitarian set of values, but it is too early to speak of a greater identification of the employee with the enterprise, because management has not fundamentally changed its view of human nature. What is needed is a recognition of the essential human needs & the creation of a situation in which the satisfaction of these needs is possible. According to this concept, the new theories recommend: (a) job-enlargement, (b) sound participation, & (c) good COMM between worker & manag, & careful preparation of supervisory personnel. AA.
tags: ORGANIZATION, BEHAVIOR OF INDIVIDUALS IN THE,

title: Primary and Secondary Group Moral Responsibility Roles
abstract: Sociol'ts often view the norms of primary groups (ie, friends), as opposed to the norms of secondary groups (ie, the larger community). It is proposed that primary groups which support norms from the larger community often mistakenly appear to oppose them because primary group means of implementing moral responsibility are diff from secondary group means. Questionnaire data from Coll S's suggest that a high % feel some moral responsibility in connection with a friend's hypothetical misdeed. A typology of responses distinguishing between primary & secondary means of exercising responsibility for society's norms was developed. The typology was related meaningfully to: (1) the kind of motive imputed to the offender, (2) the tendency toward absolute moral judgments, (3) the seriousness of readjustment anticipated if ego were the offender, (4) the relative ease of facing friends as compared with acquaintances, (5) sex, & religious affiliation. AA.
tags: SECONDARY SCHOOL, & PRIMARY GROUP MORAL RESPONSIBILITIES,

title: Enkele aspecten van de deelname aan het universitair onderwijs in België
abstract: The rising emphasis on educ for Belgium's gifted youth is illustrated by concrete measures taken: (1) the law of Mar 1954, creating a Nat'l Study Fund, & (2) 3 laws of Aug 1960, providing for U subsidization. The rapid increase of students in the post-war era is due not to a parallel increase in the student age group, but rather to increased SM, & to the greater availability of scholarships. Re choice of areas of study, a rapid increase in Literature, Sci, Psychol, & Educ, with a view to teaching, & a decrease of interest in such fields as law & medicine, illustrate the `safe road' attitude created by the student's more limited awareness of the professions open to him. Of the total/sum student pop, 60% is French-speaking. Some reasons for the generally higher participation of the French culture group are: (A) Dutch participation in secondary Sch educ is less; (B) many professors are French-oriented; (C) there is a high concentration of the academic milieu in the French-speaking provinces; & (D) U's tend to recruit local students. A study conducted by the U of Louvain in 1959-1960 revealed that Dutch students generally rank lower in the soc hierarchy. In order to equalize the participation of both culture groups, it is essential to stimulate the talents of those in the Lc 's. A. Chapman.
tags: UNIVERSITY, EDUCATION IN BELGIUM, PARTICIPATION IN,

title: Problemen rond recht en rechtspraak in niet-westerse samenlevingen
abstract: The transition from colonialism to pol'al independence in non-Western communities has brought into focus the dual nature of their law & legal procedure. The formal Western exterior of their legal system belies the actual functioning & interpretation of their indigenous `unwritten law,' which is intimately linked to other cultural phenomena. New Guinea exemplifies the inner legal structure of such communities. Cases are subjected to communal scrutiny & evaluation; `physical force' is replaced by soc pressure, whose psychol'al value is effective in implementing the 'law.' The native legal tradition, though rooted in the past, adapts to changing soc circumstances, & plays an integral role in community life. Judgments are based not on precedents, but on personal insight. An illustration is the Yoruba tribe in West Nigeria, whose `unwritten law' continued despite the advent of British influence in 1900. The Native Courts Ordinance of 1933 established one main court under native jurisdiction, enabling written & unwritten law to co-exist, despite the British 'power of review,' which was rarely enforced. However, the post-war generation of natives wishes to reform its courts & legal system. They have tried to pattern that system after the British one, resulting in much misunderstanding & resentment on the part of the older, uneducated masses. The `educated men' are only beginning to be aware of the essential links between a formalized,Western legal system & the pulse & rhythm of the masses. A. Chapman.
tags: WEST, NON-COMMUNITIES, PROBLEMS OF LAW IN,

title: De suburbanisatie in Nederland als researchvraagstuk
Sociologie in levenden lijve
abstract: Some short remarks are made on the 5th World Congress of Sociology, held from 2-8 Sep, 1962, in Washington, DC. The US contribution was, according to the number of participants (56%0), one of the most conspicuous facts. The Congress was hindered by its own large proportions & by the multitude of papers, partly integrated by common themes, partly treated as separate units. The time available for each unit varied from 25 minutes to one hour, discussion & intervals included. 3 points re the state of affairs in sociol seem relevant: (1) the idea of theoretical convergence, some yrs ago strongly underlined by K. Davis & others, has not been confirmed by this conference's general impressions, (2) the period of theoretical & terminological particularism is still not at its end, & (3) some interesting new fields of sociol'al attention have been treated for the first time, eg, the sociol of law & linguistic sociol. AA.
tags: UNITED STATES, PARTICIPANTS IN 5TH WORLD CONGRESS OF SOCIOLOGY,

title: Farming in Cultural Change
abstract: A discussion of SA 1116-B5282, showing that the influence of modern culture is discernable in the efficiency of farm manag. The inadequacy of Benvenuti's study lies in his 'new type of man' theory rather than in his methodology. His theory prevents him from making full use of the material uncovered by his method. He has succeeded in proving his hyp, but the hyp's do not shed light on the problems which he had posed for himself at the outset. He has also succeeded in his goal of providing material for further res. D. Cooperman.

title: Family Life in the Netherlands
abstract: An evaluation of the doctoral thesis of an Indian sociol'st, K. Ishwaran: FAMILY LIFE IN THE NETHERLANDS. The problem stated was: 'Has the Dutch fam in fact changed in its essentials, during the process of soc change through which Dutch society has been passing since the beginning of this cent?' A sample of Leyden U S's was studied. It was concluded that the Dutch fam has not changed in its essentials during the process of soc change from a preindustrial to an industrial society. A similar study was carried out among S's of the Agri'al U at Wageningen. The problem was diff: 'What progress has individualization made in diff kinds of nuclear fam's & to what extent do they differ re functions & structure ?' Diff's were found between Ur & Ru fam's re individualization, structure & functions. In contrast with Ishwaran's conclusion, it was concluded that because the Ur fam developed from the Ru fam, during the process of individualization & urbanization taking place during the 20th cent, it can be stated that the f am underwent important changes during this time. AA.
tags: SOCIAL CHANGE, & FAMILY LIFE IN THE NETHERLANDS,

title: De suburbanisatie rondom Brussel
abstract: The capital of Belgium suffers from 2 major problems: (1) heavy centralization in & around Brussels; (2) duality of language. Brussels contains 15% of the pop & 25% of the employment possibilities in the country. This diff explains the great immigration to the capital. The subUr area already covers 3 times the surface of the official agglomeration. It is still growing, due to the growing administration & tertiary possibilities of employment in the capital. There is also an important movement from the center to the suburbs. A soc selection which is due to building site speculation arises; only the wellto-do can afford the expensive building sites & house rents in the suburbs. The soc integration of the new districts is obstructed by: (1) insufficient town & country planning, (2) uninformed immigration, & (3) changes whereby the local authorities cannot always effectuate satisfying adaptations. The factor which most obstructs soc integration is the duality of language which includes a soc struggle. Brussels, originally a Flemish town, is now a town where French is predominant. This transition may be explained sociol'ly; the central pol'al & financial powers were French-speaking, the SC's who spoke Dutch were obliged to assimilate. 'Frenchification' is spreading along with the suburbanization, in the surroundings of Brussels, mostly because of building site speculation, which brings about the establishment of well-to-do French-speaking people. The prestige of the French language has promoted acculturation & assimilation in the zone of suburbanization & leads to soc conflicts & double S-cul equipment, where a Dutch intelligentsia is developing. Nat'l solutions of: (1) decentralization, (2) town & country planning, (3) soc district - building & (4) informed immigration, seem to be possible solutions, of decreasing these tensions & promoting S-cul intergration. AA.

title: Sociologische aspecten van de rurale planning
abstract: A report on the 3rd Congress of the European Society for Ru Sociol, Sep 1962, in Austria. Planning in our industrial society pays too little attention to the problems of the Ru countryside. The following questions arise: (1) what are the problems of Ru areas, (2) how far can sociol solve them, & (3) how is res & planning to be improved? H. Kotter (U of Bonn, Germany) defined the various concepts, insisted on freedom of value, judgments & on a planning adapted to the generally accepted norms & values. The 3 topics corresponded with 3 types of Ru regions: (1) planning in regions of concentration (by G. Isbary), (2) planning in agri'al regions (by A. K. Constandse), & (3) planning in underdeveloped areas (by M. Rossi-Doria). The common problem is the backwardness of these types of regions compared to the standards of our urbanized industrial society. To improve this situation, particularly in the regions of concentration, planning implies an increasing intrusion of public bodies into private matters. To avoid arbitrary behavior by both authorities & individuals, a democratic planning needs far reaching res, as Constandse explained, to provide the data for the 'guiding image' of the planner. AA.

title: Opdracht en onderzoek. Enkele opmerkingen naar aanleiding van het rapport "Haarlem"
Korrespondentie en kommentaar. Toch een andere ondernemersfiguur?
Het onderzoek van doeleinden in de wetenschap der politiek. Enkele opmerkingen over Arnold Brechts "Politische Theorie"
Snelle sociale verandering als studie-object van de Wereldraad van Kerken
Marx, Marxisme en recht. (n.a.v. Hans Dahlke: "Karl Marx über das Wesen des Rechts";  1959.)
Beroep en vrije-tijdsbesteding. Een peiling in een grafisch bedrijf
abstract: Foutieve titel bovenaan artikel: Beroep en vrije-tijdsbestijding. The res took place in 1960/1961 re the relations between the nature of occup'al work & the nature of leisure time activities. Interviews were held on the basis of a!? with employees of a Dutch graphics Co (process-engravers & photolithographers) (N= 40). The gauge bore a qualitative character. Among other things, a statement of time budgets was asked & a list of leisure activities was used. A distinction was made between objective & subjective relations, classified in 5 groups varying from decidedly positive (similar activities in spare time & occup) to decidedly negative (compensation &/or escape in spare time). The decidedly positive relations might be seen as canalizations of a certain aptitude of the individual both in spare time & occup. The nature of the individual's educ seems to be related. Decidedly positive relations were found mostly among young people (under 30); decidedly negative relations mostly with the group between 30 & 50 yrs old. With older people (over 50) the relations were less pronounced & the leisure activities were of a more conformistic nature. In case of further investigation it is recommended that a distinction be made between the factors concerning occup & position, in future res. AA.

title: Some Community Development Problems in Partinico, one of the Centres Founded by Danilo Dolci in W. Sicily
Assimilation, Integration and Identity in Pluralist Society
abstract: An exploration of the pressures towards establishing cultural homogeneity, in a culturally heterogeneous society (SY), that operate in the absence of persecution or discrimination. To this end `assimilation' is clearly distinguished from 'integration,' & it is hyp'ed that 'the more integrated a cultural minority into its SY the more precarious will be the preservation of its cultural identity.' The pressures that render the preservation of cultural group identity precarious appear in a spiraling series of 5 interlocking propositions: (1) Integration into a pluralist SY modifies the rejection of defectors who remain fellow citizens. (2) The group's identity is attenuated to the extent to which the transmission of its cultural heritage has to allow for time & energy to prepare for citizenship in SY-at-large (SY-L). (3) The expansion of aspirations beyond the fold of the group to SY-L attenuates group ties further. (4) Aspirations of members of cultural minority groups in SY-L will fragment group leadership & weaken group cohesion. (5) Aspirations for success in SY-L will modify rejection of defectors to the point where it mingles with pride in & identification with the defectors' success in SY-L. A discrepancy may arise between the ways in which the group members define their own identity & such definitions by others. Modified AA.

title: De betekenis van Steinmetz voor de sociografie en de sociologie
abstract: An address delivered on Dec 6, 1962 at the U of Amsterdam, of the centennial of the birth of S. R. Steinmetz, one of the founders of sociography. Steinmetz emphasized that sociography was a concrete sci - (in contrast to sociol, which was abstract) - & that one must build a system out of facts. His followers have complained that Steinmetz left no res techniques & no sociol'al Sch. Since WWII, a tendency in the direction of abstract analysis has begun. Yet Steinmetz' contribution, seen as a phase of preparation, is invaluable. (See also SA 0514-B0919). A. Chapman.
tags: SOCIOLOGY, THE SIGNIFICANCE OF STEINMETZ FOR,

title: Differentiële vruchtbaarheid naar beroep in België
