abstract: Reviewed is the second edition of Van den Doel's Democratie en welvaartstheorie ([Democracy and Prosperity Theory], Alphen aan den Rijn, 1978). The author's aim is threefold: scientific, political, & educational. In the second edition these goals are respectively: the strengthening of Dutch democracy, showing the relationships between prosperity theory & new political economy, & presenting a new field of application for prosperity theory. The problem examined is the growth of the public sector in twentieth century Dutch economy & how to optimize production of collective goods from a democratic public sector. The two original contributions of the second edition are: (1) the integration of several economic decision-making theories using the concept ^political process' as a ^trade channel' between the original producer & the consumer, & (2) the treatment of prosperity theory as a falsifiable theory rather than a normative explanation. It is shown that (1) & (2) contribute little to the problem's solution. A. Orianne.
tags: Dutch economy, Van den Doel's Democracy and Prosperity Theory, second edition, review

title: Van jaar tot jaar: een commentaar op Dronkers en een analyse op interacties (Mens en maatschappij, boekaflevering 1978, p. 116-143)
abstract: In 'Changeable Variables of a School Career,' J. Dronkers proposes an extended path model with 25 variables divided into nine categories so that variables in any category are supposed to influence variables in only the higher categories. There is supposed to be no causal relation inside any category. The criticism of Donkers is: (1) the complete model could be simplified, several causal paths can be eliminatd thereby setting up the possibility for testing comparisons, & (2) mutual influences inside a causal category have not been considered which might give rise to biased path coefficients. In Een korte reactie op het commentaar van Dessens en Jansen, (A Short Reaction to Dessens's and Jansen's Commentary) J. Dronkers argues that the relative value of the expanded or restricted model depends on the investigation's aims. The reduced model is best if an economical predictive model is desired. The latter is also superior in terms of policy decisions since it indicates more restricted (& sometimes more practicable) interventions. 8 Figures. A. Orianne.

title: Zichtbaarheid van gedrag en zichtbaarheid van gedragsopbrengsten. Commentaar op Ester en Leeuw, Mens en maatschappij 1978, no. 1, p. 5-39
abstract: Discussed is P. Ester's & F. Leeuw's sixth hypothesis ('Theoretische sociologie en maatschappelijke vraagstukken; individueel handelen en participatie in de voorziening van collectieve goederen,' [Theoretical Sociology in Social Questions; Individual Behavior and Participation in the Provision of Collective Goods], Mens en Maatschappij, 1978, 53, 5-39): the less conspicously members of a group perceive their contribution to the attainment of a collective good, the less they will contribute to the attainment of that good. This hypothesis runs counter to several phenomena (voting behavior, conservation behavior, individual family planning) & is modified by a further hypothesis: that as the sociometric ties between members of the society increase, members will participate in securing collective goods. This new hypothesis is justified by a shift from conspicuousness of behavior to conspicuouness of behavior consequence. However the hypothesis can only be justified if one takes into account the mediation of social norms: there must exist a social norm requiring individuals to conform their actions to the pursuit of collective good. A. Orianne.

title: Bloei en ondergang van de Hollandse zeventiende-eeuwse landschapsschilderkunst (1620-1670): Artistiek isolement-integratie-creativiteit. Een sociologische beschouwing
abstract: Presented is a study of the bloom & decline of seventeenth century Dutch landscape painting, yielding the following provisional hypotheses: (1) An institutional discontinuity in artists' social structure, with a period of isolation from dominant upper class cultural patterns, stimulates creativity. A firm integration of the group in its own social stratum is conducive to this phenomenon. (2) In such circumstances, artists may, depending upon their personal experience, create original work, detached from the cliches of the past & from the alien cultural patterns of the upper class. HA.

title: De meting en verklaring van woonwaardering
abstract: First, two theoretical problems on household evaluation in various housing situations are considered. It is argued that it is necessary to evaluate the total housing situation as an aggregate of separate feature evaluations rather than as a direct evaluation. Also discussed are the consequences of using magnitude-estimation versus category scaling. Second, an actual housing survey in South Holland & resulting explanation of several evaluations of physico-spatial attributes are described. Finally, the results of several possible composition models are compared. 6 Tables, 8 Figures. HA.
tags: magnitude-estimation vs category scaling, housing survey/physico-spatial attributes

title: A rational reconstruction of Durkheim's thesis concerning the division of labour in society
abstract: I. Lakatos's conception of historiography as rational reconstruction of research programs is briefly sketched & applied in a study of E. Durkheim's De la division du travail social (The Division of Labor in Society). Durkheim opposes (1) contractualism which grounds division of labor in the terms of the original social contract, (2) classical economy which explains division of labor in terms of homo economicus's attempt to maximize the material conditions of his existence, (3) utilitarianism, which extends the marketplace metaphor to all social interactions, & (4) evolutionism adding a historical perspective to the marketplace image (Spencer). Durkheim's account is based (A) on the notion of social solidarity & the relationship between social structure type & solidarity type & (B) on the thesis that differences in states of social solidarity depend on differences in social densities & volumes. Division of labor is defined as second degree specialization, involving qualitatively dissimilar activities. Durkheim's theory asserts that the requirements for increased division of labor (individualism, rationality, social mobility, education) result from increased social density. Social density results from excess birth over death rate, urbanization, & material production. Two anomalous forms of division of labor are examined: anomic (unregulated & uncoordinated), & forced (imposed by superior wealth or political power). A. Orianne.

title: Het Sociaal en Cultureel Rapport 1978
authors: Stouthard,Ph C.,   Swaan,A. de,   Welters,L. A.
abstract: Discussed is the report on Dutch social & cultural life by the Social & Cultural Planning Commission. Ph. C. Stouthard (1) points out the sampling difficulties inherent in this kind of survey, (2) questions the use of factor analysis in generating a well-being index, (3) wonders why the hypothesis that changes originate in the city & spread to the countryside could not be tested, (4) notes that the reporting of analysis results obtained by loglinear transformations is not convincing, & (5) regrets that the results of the Automatic Interaction Detector analysis are not processed further. A. de Swaan points out that the content & organization of the report is geared to the needs of the state bureaucracy; there is a chapter on the penal system but none on the arts & sciences. Three general tendencies of the report are: focusing on large scale social phenomena rather than on important details, hiding behind tables & figures, & emphasizing aspects that have an immediate impact on policy making. L. A. Welters studies the development in the conception of the three reports published to date. It is noted that the reports attach progressively more importance to inter- rather than intrasector phenomena. This development does not merely result from new description methods but reflects a policy change. A. Orianne.

title: Oorzaken van interviewer-variantie in survey-onderzoek
abstract: Interviewer variance, that proportion of response variance that is attributable to different interviewers rather than to different respondents, is a source of error in survey research & deserves investigation. A model of secondary analysis on interviewer variance is offered, distinguishing between three types of factors: characteristics of questions, of interviewers, & of respondents. The usefulness of this model was illustrated on a recent research project on the relative impact of living circumstances & personality on feelings of well-being. Secondary analysis was applied to 296 2-hour interviews performed by 13 interviewers. Interviewer behavior or task orientation appears to have unexpected effects. Results have clear implications for the training & selection of interviewers but should be verified in further research. 7 Tables, 1 Figure, Appendix. Modified HA.

title: Figuratiesociologie als onderzoeksprogramma
abstract: Figuration sociology was inaugurated in 1939 by N. Elias but received little attention until 1969. Since then it has developed into a full-fledged school, particularly in the Netherlands. I. Lakatos's methodology is used to reconstruct & evaluate figuration sociology as it occurs in N. Elias's Ueber den Prozess der Zivilisation. Soziogenetische und psychogenetische Untersuchungen ([The Civilizing Process: Sociogenetic & Psychogenetic Investigations], Basel, 1939). Little progress has been made within the figuration program & the few predictions made were refuted. Nevertheless, further fruitful developments may be expected. It is also noted that figuration sociology may be seen as complementary to other existing programs, eg, Marxism & Freudian psychoanalysis. Figuration sociology provides a new, historically & psychologically oriented, empirical approach to central sociological problems. A. Orianne.

title: De invloed van participeren en structureren op het toeschrijven van leiderschap in een groep
authors: Koomen,W.,   Ouweltjes,J.,   Wester,A.,   Bovenkamp,J. van,   Forma,H.
abstract: In two studies-an experimental (number of cases = 33) & a correlational one (number of cases = 100)-the effects of the rate of participation & organizational-integrative interaction on ratings of leadership in a group were investigated. In the experimental study subjects made their ratings after hearing 1 of 2 tape-recorded discussions between 4 stimulus-persons that showed a different amount of participation & organizational-integrative interaction. In the correlational study members of 20 groups of 5 persons each discussed a problem & rated each other afterwards. Participation & organizational-integrative interaction were measured for each subject by means of an observation scheme. In both studies participation showed a rather strong, positive relationship with leadership-ratings. Organizational-integrative interaction only had an effect in the correlational study. An interpretation of these results is offered. AA.
tags: group leadership ratings, participation rate effects/organizational-integrative interaction

title: Professionaliteit bij artsen en verpleegkundigen: Een vergelijking van en het verband tussen twee soorten beroepskenmerken
abstract: The hypothesis that membership in professional organizations & reading professional journals would be positively related to perceived professionalism was investigated as part of a 1977 survey in 6 general hospitals in the Netherlands. Respondents were 48 physicians & 442 nurses & student nurses. Professionalism was measured using R. Hall's translation scale based on a 5-dimensional model of professionalism. Three dimensions could be measured reliably: sense of calling to the field, belief in public service, & autonomy. From data on membership & journals read it is concluded that physicians are more professional than nurses: they are better organized & they read more. In both occupations, rank is an intervening variable. On the perceived measure, physicians are not overall more professional but are significantly more autonomous & less service-oriented. Significant positive correlations are found between membership in professional organizations, number of journals read, & perceived professionalism for physicians but not for nurses. It was found that the more professionally nurses behave, the less they perceive themselves as professionals. 6 Tables. Modified HA.

title: Kritische bijdragen
abstract: Wil Arts / Sociologie en sociale orde. Bespreking van Gerard de Vries, 'Sociale orde, regels en de sociologie' Boom, Meppel, 1977. p.321-327Menno Wolters / Bespreking van A. E. Bronner en R. de Hoog, 'Politieke Voorkeur: Oordelen en Beslissen', dissertatie, Universiteit van Amsterdam, 1978, p.328-330

title: Oriëntaties van lager geschoolde werkloze en werkende mannelijke jongeren. Een vergelijkend onderzoek
abstract: Investigated was if several aspects of unemployment were experienced differently by unemployed & employed youth of low level education. These aspects were perception of unemployment, labor market orientation, social network, normative system, & perceived influence of the social security system on the extent of unemployment. A semiexperimental designed was used: the two research categories were made homogeneous by pair-wise matching for age, sex, occupation, & level of education (number of cases = 47 matched pairs of male working youth). Both unemployed & employed youth evaluated unemployment negatively. As an advantage of unemployment, the extra amount of leisure time was mentioned by both groups. In comparing this with other research results it was concluded that it is not level of education but age which influences the mentioning of this advantage. Regarding the negative aspects of unemployment, the two samples showed a remarkable difference: 79% of the employed youth saw uselessness as an important disadvantage; however, only 39% of the unemployed felt useless. 3 Tables, Appendix. Modified AA.
tags: male elementary school graduate youths, employed/unemployed

title: Over sociale ongelijkheid. Vooruitgang in het naoorlogse socialistische denken?
abstract: Discussed are the nature & quality of social inequality theories on which politicians depend, & to what extent those of the Dutch Scientific Council for Governmental Policy (WRR) are better. The relationship between politics & science is analyzed within the critical rationalism framework which assumes that all politicians are theoreticians. The 1977 WRR report Over sociale ongelijkheid (On Social Inequality) is discussed within the background of revisionist historical materialism. An explanation of revisionist thinking on social inequality as it developed after World War II is explained, & empirical difficulties which appeared around 1965 are described. New revisionist hypotheses developed after 1965 are presented & their superiority over previous hypotheses examined. Finally, the possibility of combining revisionist hypotheses with other recent sociological theories is examined. A. Orianne.

title: Diefstal door middel van braak. Diachronische analyse van een delict in Amsterdam
abstract: The number of burglaries reported to the police has increased exponentially in the last thirty years. A diachronic analysis of the phenomenon is presented: several possible explanation factors are studied & a model combining their effects developed. Simplifications of the model have been tested for the city of Amsterdam. Among the factors considered are: population size, number of objects, number of burglaries, number of burglaries per burglar, the odds against capture & conviction, & the severity of penalties imposed. 1 Table, 13 Figures. Modified HA.
tags: burglary, Amsterdam, data analysis, thirty-year period

title: Een aanvulling en correctie op 'De meting en verklaring van woonwaardering'
abstract: 'De meting en verklaring van woonwaardering' ([The Measure and Explanation of Housing Evaluation], see SA 28:3/K8293) is amended on the basis of a survey of 578 respondents of southeastern Brabant. The survey's aim was to determine whether observed relationships between various evaluation scales could be reproduced, & whether the assumptions relative to measuring importance were tenable. Results indicate that it is possible through more accurate questioning to obtain a better agreement between categories & length scales. There remain, however, unresolved discrepancies between the model used in south Holland & in southeastern Brabant. 4 Figures. A. Orianne.
tags: housing evaluation, survey, southeastern Brabant, Holland, scale reliability, validity

title: L'Histoire se repete! Een kritische reflectie op de geschiedschrijving van het stratificatie-onderzoek (Mens en maatschappij, boekaflevering 1978)
abstract: Examined is the 1978 book issue of Mens en Maatschappij, edited by J. Peschar & W. Ultee, devoted to social stratification & mobility. Particular attention is paid to Peschar's contribution in the issue's introduction & in 'L'Histoire se repete? Betreft een overzicht van recent buitenlands onderzoek' (History Repeats Itself? An Overview of Recent Foreign Research). Peschar attempts to determine future trends in stratification research based on a three-phase developmental model of stratification research over the last thirty years. The first phase is examplified by the work of D. Glass (Social Mobility in Britain, London, 1954), & the second by P. Blau & O. Duncan (The American Occupational Structure, New York, 1967). The third phase includes two tendencies: one characterized by advanced methodologies, eg, path analysis & little substance, the other more traditional & more concerned with class relation research. Bibliography. A. Orianne.
tags: Mens en Maatschappij, book issue, 1978, J. Peschar & W. Ultee, editors

title: Bespreking van P. van Reenen, 'Overheidsgeweld. Een sociologische studie van de dynamiek van het geweldsmonopolie', Samsom, Alphen aan de Rijn, 1979, 357 pp
Bij de 55e jaargang van een bloeiend tijdschrift
Hoever gaat de onderwijsemancipatie van de vrouw?
abstract: Discussed are changes in women's participation in Dutch general education. These changes tend to follow a pattern. With the help of statistical materials for a period of several decades (1875-1980), a tentative descriptive model is developed-the educational emancipation function. The function is mathematically translated in the Riccati model (an adapted logistic curve) presented by H. Levenbach ('A Generalization of the Logistic Growth Function and Its Estimation,' Statistica Neederlandica, 1973, 27). It is concluded that females have gained a small majority at the modern secondary education level. At the higher advanced education/gymnasium level, they remain a minority. Despite greater participation of females in all types of education, some programs remain typically male or F. Directive policy measures are needed to change this situation. 6 Tables, 5 Figures. Modified HA.

title: Interpretatie als identificatie: de keuze van de hermeneutische traditie
abstract: At least two different types of questions are raised in science: why & what-is questions. The Covering Law model of explanation is a normative theory on answering why questions. One of the model's prescriptions is to prefer deeper theories. This preference implies that scientists should search for new theories which make it possible to explain the successes & failures of existing theories. Because new & deeper theories can involve new interpretations, ie, concept formation, it is wrong to confine interpretation (answering what-is questions) to identification. Identification is the aim of the hermeneutic tradition. This is shown by analyzing the arguments of one of the classics of the hermeneutic tradition, W. Dilthey, & one of the more recent authors, J. Habermas. HA.
tags: Covering Law model, hermeneutical explanatory approaches

title: De verborgen invloed van verkiezingen: symboliek, ritueel, regelmaat en anticiperende effecten
abstract: Voters are aware that their contribution to the political process is insignificant, yet consider the electoral process very important. Hence this importance cannot be explained by the traditional conception of 'free competition for a free vote.' Another interpretation is presented which emphasizes the hidden influence of elections. Elections are essentially a regularly recurring phenomenon that stabilizes democratic politics. This stabilizing effect is related to the symbolic & ritual nature of the event. Moreover, the anticipation of elections affects political actors, pressure groups, & even the bureaucracy in interelectoral periods. It is suggested that elections contribute to political stability regardless of the system's level of democracy. A. Orianne.

title: Commentaar op W. C. Ultee's 'Over sociale ongelijkheid'
abstract: Presented are comments on W. C. Ultee's arguments (see SA 29:1/81L2252). In Is dat nou kritisch-rationalistisch ondersoek? (Is This a Critical-Rationalistic Investigation?) J. Dronkers (Netherlands University, Amsterdam) argues that the eighteen hypotheses Ultee ascribes to revisionist historical-materialism are poorly founded empirically. Some of his hypotheses are more characteristic of Christian democrats, liberals, or enlightened conservatives than of social democrats. Ultee's refutation of some of these hypotheses falls short of its goal. In particular he makes the empirical difficulties faced by the social democrat hypotheses seem exaggerated. Also, Ultee does not have an adequate instrument for measuring progress in postwar socialist thinking. J. Tinbergen argues that more research is necessary on possible national differences & on the limits on social equality due to heredity. He points out several phenomena neglected by Ultee & some unfortunate formulas, eg, degree devaluation. Underutilized instruments of socioeconomic policy are mentioned. H. M. Veld-Langeveld defends Ultee's report. Its goal was not to analyze postwar revisionist socialism. It has contributed at least two major insights by emphasizing: (1) the overlapping of various aspects of unequal distribution from which the existence of a strongly institutionalized social stratification derives, & (2) the importance of the existing division of labor for social inequality. The problem of status inconsistency is briefly discussed. A. Orianne.

title: Universitair beleidsgericht onderzoek in de sociale wetenschappen. Een theoretische beschouwing en enkele organisatorische opmerkingen
authors: Frijling,B. W.,   Hoesel,P. H. M. van,   Leeuw,F. L.
abstract: A discussion of the acceptability of social policy research by the social science faculties of Us. The "policy-research-cycle," a wider variant of the so-called "empirical cycle" defined by the methodologist A. D. De Groot, is introduced. On the basis of this cycle, fourteen types of applied social research with policy-oriented applications are developed. Emphasized is the notion that the more phases of a cycle a given type of research passes through, the more acceptable it will be among U scientists. Also discussed are organizational conditions that must be satisfied for this kind of research to be undertaken successfully within a U structure. 3 Figures. Modified AA.

title: Multi-level onderzoek van samenwerking in het part-time onderwijs
abstract: Factors relating to the cooperation between two part-time educational types (for pupils aged 15-19) are analyzed on three different levels. On the individual level, 2 samples of teachers (N = 314 & 271) responded to a postal questionnaire (closed questions), & members of the schoolboards of almost all of the relevant institutions (N = 163 & 21) were interviewed (closed questions). On the institutional level, these same schoolboard members provided institutional information. Data on the institutional level are used to construct the regions of cooperating institutions. Six variables are then created on the regional level & related to each other & to other variables on the institutional & individual level. The contextual analysis is carried out by computing product-moment correlations & multiple regression. The results indicate that size (on the institutional level) & confession (on the institutional & individual level) are important factors concerning the development of regional cooperation between the two educational types. Cooperation-orientation of teachers is determined mainly by personal relevance of programmatic or structural innovation, but their power orientation is predicted mainly by situational variables. Within each educational type, personal predictors concerning own cooperation-orientation of teachers are better than situational predictors. With regard to the perception of the partner's cooperation-orientation, personal predictors do as well as situational predictors. 3 Tables, 1 Figure. AA.

title: Anomie is niet identiek aan normloosheid bij Durkheim
abstract: Emile Durkheim's concept of anomie (Le Suicide [Suicide], Paris, 1967) has been incorrectly interpreted by several sociologists. It is argued that the interpretation of "anomie"as "normlessness" results in a distortion of Durkheim's explanatory theory of anomic suicide. Not normlessness as such, but normlessness in a specific regard, is the cause of anomic suicide. Strictly speaking, anomie refers to the absence of norms that keep so-called individual desires under restraint. These desires arise, according to Durkheim, in an individual when he reflects on the world in which he lives. By themselves, these desires are limitless; only society is able to put an upper limit to them. When such restraint is absent, the individual will endure feelings of frustration, which may be followed by suicide. Such a situation is called anomie by Durkheim; the suicides invoked here are the anomic ones. A special situation of norm certainty (eg, as in commercial life with its directives of rationality) is shown to provoke suicides of the anomic kind. This would be impossible if one equated anomie with normlessness. AA.
tags: Durkheim, Emile, anomie concept, "normlessness" interpretation critiqued

title: Organisatie Nederlandse gezondheidszorg; overzichtsliteratuur
abstract: A comparison of recent Dutch works in the sociology of medicine, prompted by the publication of H. J. J. Leenen's Structuur en functioneren van de gezondheidszorg ([Structure and Functioning of Health Care] Alplen a/d Rijn: Samson, 1979). Differences in scope & definitions among various works are noted, indicating different focuses: health apparatus inventories, role of governmental instances, health care problems, synthesis of existing research, history of health care service, financial-economic aspects, or adoption of a normative orientation. Contemporary authors sometimes focus on several, but never all, of these perspectives. As a result, books with identical subjects only partially overlap. Furthermore, the adoption of a given focus reflects a particular conception of health care. Focus differences also result in different suggested solutions. The lack of macrolevel health care studies & lack of a centralized research policy are regretted. A. Orianne.

title: Ideologie en maatschappelijke ontwikkeling. George Duby over 'Les trois ordres ou l'imaginaire du féodalisme'
abstract: A discussion of George Duby's Les Trois Ordres ou l'imaginaire du feodalisme ([The Three Orders or the Visionary of Feudalism] Paris, 1978). The ideology of the three orders (nobility, clergy, & third order), widely known during the ancien regime, was formed roughly speaking during the period 1000-1200. The development of form & content of this notion depended, according to Duby, totally on the societal developments of the period; Duby's approach denies any major independent explanatory significance to the ways individuals perceive, interpret, & respond to social conditions. A comparison with Marc Bloch's conception is made; it is suggested that Durkheim & the Annee sociologique served as a common background, & that Duby's book is a typical French product. Modified AA.

title: Op de verkeerde weg: een reactie
Links en rechts. Een empirisch perspectief nader onderzocht
abstract: A critique of R. A. Roe's Links en rechts in een empirisch perspectief. Een onderzoek naar de dimensionaliteit van politieke attituden onder studenten ([Right and Left in an Empirical Perspective. An Investigation into the Dimensionality of Political Attitudes among Students], Amsterdam: Swets en Zeitlinger, 1975). Roe attempts to define the so-called Left-Right dichotomy by means of such ideologies as liberalism, conservatism, & fascism on the Right, & socialism & democracy on the Left. Using cluster analysis on data obtained from 350 psychology students at the U of Amsterdam, Roe attempts to distinguish various ideological attitudes. Objections to Roe's study include: (1) his unfounded definitions & operationalism of the investigated domain; & (2) his faulty analytical techniques, in that the ideological attitudes are not analyzed both separately & in terms of the whole group, & 'subjective' rotation procedures are applied that can neither be repeated nor controlled. This has led to a new investigation using principal components analysis & 'varimaxrotation', leading to a broader insight into the structure of Left-Right attitudes. In Op de Verkeerde weg: een reactie (On the Wrong Track: A Reaction), R. A. Roe argues the tenability & fruitfulness of his research, & considers the offered criticism to be unfounded, since it proceeds from a different research objective -- that of testing a doctrinaire hypothesis against political attitudes. 2 Tables. J. Migdal.

title: E. W. Hofstee: Tussen speculatieve fantasie en empirisch realisme
abstract: A dialogue with E. W. Hofstee, one of the Netherlands' most distinguished social scientists, on the occasion of his seventieth birthday & his retirement as professor of sociology & sociography at the Agricultural U of Wageningen. The following are discussed: (1) his youth; (2) the influence of S. R. Steinmetz (1862-1940); (3) his PhD thesis; & (4) his academic career. Hofstee is renowned as a teacher, as a member of numerous boards, councils, & committees, & as an author of nearly 200 publications. Modified AA.
tags: Hofstee, E. W., Dutch social scientist, life/works/career

title: Meningen over werklozen en arbeidsongeschikten
authors: Goede,M. P. M. de,   Maassen,G. H.
abstract: The majority of the Dutch population (70%) are of the opinion that the Dutch social security system is abused by the unemployed. Except for those unable to work because of mental or physical disabilities, a negative view is taken of the unemployed. Statistical analysis of previously published research reveals that the r between political party preference & views on the unemployed & social security abuse is weak; however, education is an important variable, with the better-educated taking the problem of abuse less seriously & having less negative views of unemployed persons. 19 Tables, 1 Figure. Modified HA.

title: Een model voor een interviewtheorie
abstract: Two models are developed to explain the influence of interviewing conditions on the production of relevant & valid scores, one explaining score validity when relevancy is given, the other explaining score relevancy. Their r is discussed, & suggestions for the models' use in theory development & research are illustrated by analysis of S. Sudman's & N. M. Bradburn's Response Effects in Surveys (Chicago, 1974). 5 Figures. Modified HA.

title: Over sociale ongelijkheid. Een weerwoord op drie commentaren
abstract: A reply to commentaries by J. Dronkers, J. Tinbergen, & H. M. In't Veld-Langeveld (see SA 29:2/81L3881) on W. C. Ultee's article on social inequality (see SA 29:1/81L2252). Dronkers's criticism of the study's empirical background is refuted, as is his negative view of utilizing the theories of the Dutch Scientific Council for Governmental Policy (WRR) to measure social inequality. Tinbergen's commentary is seen as being generally supportive of the stratification theory in question. In't Veld-Langeveld's critique of the WRR's theories & policies regarding social inequality is analyzed & contradicted. E. Nipperus-Jezeer.
tags: Ultee, W. C., social inequality study, J. Dronkers'/J. Tinbergen's/H. M. In't Veld-Langeveld's criticisms refuted

title: Rasdiscriminatie bij het opmaken van kranteberichten: een heranalyse van een onderzoek van Frank Bovenkerk
abstract: A reanalysis of a research project undertaken by Frank Bovenkerk (Omdat zij anders zijn [Because They Are Different], Meppel: Boom, 1978) to determine if the treatment in the Dutch press of two groups of foreign minorities, Turks & Moroccans, & Surinamese, differed from that of native Dutch when reporting crimes. Bovenkerk's data analysis in particular is evaluated, & it is concluded that a blanket statement for the Dutch press as a whole is inaccurate; each newspaper must be examined separately. Three questions formulated by Bovenkerk were investigated in detail: (1) whether crimes involving the minority groups received greater prominence in the newspapers; (2) whether country of origin of a foreign offender was more often made conspicuous; & (3) whether crimes involving the foreign minority groups were played up more heavily than those involving native Dutch. Analysis revealed that 3 of the 6 newspapers examined were treating the minorities unfairly; 1 newspaper was consistently more fair than the others on all 3 points. Some methodological points are raised with respect to homogenizing marginals of contingency tables, exact treatment of Pearson's X2 test, & collapsing of categories & variables in contingency table analysis. 8 Tables, 1 Figure. AA.
tags: racial discrimination, Dutch newspapers' crime reporting, Frank Bovenkerk's investigation reanalyzed

title: Politieke filosofie en sociologie: het probleem van de verdelende rechtvaardigheid
abstract: Collaboration between political philosophers & social scientists might lead to at least partial resolution of the problem of distributive justice. The question is how the empirical theoretical approach of social science might be applied to the normative problem of distributive justice. J. Rawls's approach (A Theory of Justice, Oxford, 1972) is examined; although his image of the reality of society is found to be too simple, & even distorted, his normative justice theory -- based on the principles of the French Revolution, freedom, equality, & brotherhood -- is developed, & ideas from sociology's exchange theory are introduced that should be of help in addressing the following questions: how people experience distributive justice in their daily lives; whether they find the situation fair or unfair; & how they behave in view of their feelings. E. Nipperus-Jezeer.
tags: distributive justice problem resolution, political philosophy/sociology collaboration, J. Rawls's approach

title: Schooltypen in het lager onderwijs en milieuspecifieke leerprestaties
abstract: As part of an ongoing research program on the social determinants of class-specific achievement in elementary schools, curricular data from 188 schools in northern Holland were collected. Interviews were held with the teachers of grades 4, 5, & 6, focusing 15 aspects of the curriculum (eg, autonomy of pupils, modes of teacher control, curricular participation of parents, & kind of teacher motivation). Scaling procedures were applied on each aspect. Correlations between the 15 variables revealed that educational ideology was not differentiated along the 'formal vs informal' dimension. Cluster analysis of the 15 variables suggested 6 curriculum types: 4 mixed, 1 formal, & 1 informal. The dependent variables concerned achievement in mathematics & Dutch of about 5,000 sixth-grade pupils. Wc pupils in schools with a formal-type curriculum scored highest on the tests; however, these schools had a high proportion of Mc pupils. Analysis of variance revealed that schools' SES was responsible for the different achievements of the Wc pupils, not different kinds of curricula. 7 Tables. Modified AA.

title: Antonin Causse. Een oudtestamenticus met sociologische kwaliteiten
abstract: A review of the work of French scholar Antonin Causse (1877-1947) reveals the inspiration he received from French sociologists, especially Emile Durkheim & L. Levy-Bruhl. In analyzing the Israelite religion, he describes the old structure of Israeli society as originally based on strong solidarity, but later undermined by the influence of Canaanite civilization. The prophets & the Deuteronomic movement were spokesmen opposing this influence. During the Babylonian exile, a new community arose -- not political, or even national, but religious -- replacing the collectivism of the old structure with a moral individualism. Although Causse might be criticized for his evolutionistic setting of interdependency, & his use of Levy-Bruhl's theory of primitive mentality & prelogical thinking, his work is an important contribution in terms of the sociology of the Old Testament & ancient Judaism. Modified HA.
tags: Causse, Antonin, sociology of Old Testament/ancient Judaism, important contribution

title: Een markttheoretische benadering van professies
abstract: Traditional sociological reasoning on professions -- eg, E. Greenwood's "attribute" theory ("Attributes of a Profession," Social Work, 1957, 2, 44-55) & B. Barber's "functionalist" theory (see SA 13:3-4/65B6199) -- is considered inadequate. Applying microeconomic price theory, an attempt is made to outline a market theory of professions tested mainly on the basis of historical evidence concerning GB. The rise of professional associations, providing divisible collective goods, can be adequately interpreted by combining a revised economic theory of collective action & the theory of political entrepreneurship. Once in existence, these bodies strive for market control & government regulations. Market control implies: (1) strict delimitation of markets for separate professional services, either by government regulations creating collective property rights, or by actions of qualifying professional associations developing submarkets for competing services by means of product differentiation; & (2) development of a professional market order characterized by limited freedom of price fixing & strict prohibition of competitive behavior. Ordered competition between & within professional associations substitutes for market competition. By raising the cost of deviant behavior, individual professionals are induced to adhere to market rules, thereby submitting individual interests to the interests of the collectivity. A market theory of professions contributes to a specification of the institutional conditions necessary for the development of a professional market order. Such order goes with a specific relationship between providers & consumers of professional services; consumer preferences are influenced by the characteristics of the market order. 24 References. AA.

title: De meting van beroepsstatus met behulp van psychofysische schaaltechnieken
abstract: An attempt is made to show that psychophysical scaling techniques can be used for the scaling of occupational status, & that this technique has important advantages compared to other procedures, eg, the high level of measurement obtained, & the possibility to test the validity & to estimate the reliability of measurements. Another advantage is the possibility to test whether there is consensus in the sample, which should be standard routine. The scaling results for occupation status (a social science variable) are compared with those for a physical stimulus (size of numbers), showing that valid measurements are obtained in both cases, & that the reliabilities are high for most Rs (N not given) for both kinds of stimuli. Thus, this technique can be used for scaling social science variables as well as physical variables. Knowledge about these features obtained from psychophysics is useful for the social sciences. 5 Tables, 3 Figures, 36 References. Modified HA.

title: Bejaardensociologie: een terugblik en een momentopname
abstract: A review of sociological research on the elderly in key fields first noted by Leo Turksma in 1968 (see SA 18:1-2/70E0851) including: aging as a process vs the elderly as a group; loss of roles in old age; typologies of old people; stereotyping the elderly; the old & the young; & local applied research. Problems that have been addressed by research since 1968 include: the future of care for the elderly, problems in homes for the aged, the elderly & the city, satisfaction of the elderly, the cost of care, & widowhood. Suggestions are offered for other research subjects. 70 References. Modified HA.

title: Vragenlijsten met en zonder vragen: een experiment
abstract: Sociologists are often concerned with the statistical treatment of no response or "don't know" answers to questionnaire items. Part of the problem may lie in the overall design of the questionnaire, or in wording that confuses the issue for the R. With these points in mind, a statistical reprocessing is attempted of data collected by J. van Heerden & J. Hoogstraten ("Response Preference as a Function of Instructions in an Unstructured Questionnaire," Perceptual & Motor Skills, 1980, 50, 227-230). It is shown that variables such as type & sequence of questions, degree of homogeneity of the sample, & clarity of instructions are key factors that must be considered in experimental design. 3 Tables, 9 References. M. Meeks.

title: Taboe, macht, maar vooral moraal
abstract: A review essay on Paul Kapteyn's Taboe, macht en moraal in Nederland ([Taboo, Power, and Morality in the Netherlands] publication information not provided [see IRPS No. 29/85a38525]). Key topics include relationships between men & women & between generations, attitudes toward the body, & the role of religion. A historical approach is utilized, tracing social developments to important movements in the development of the Dutch people in the Middle Ages & modern times. M. Meeks.

title: Het sociologisch raadsel van de haviken en de duiven
abstract: Factors influencing the choice of Dutch industrial workers to participate in trade union activities are examined. Variables of worker expectation of success, permission to participate in specific activities, & personal risk incurred with involvement were subjected to analyses involving statistical cross-correlation, the multiplicative power function, the linear additive function, & the single peaked preference function. Little variety was observed in the cross-correlation of data, showing most workers to be either very active in union controversies, ie, "hawks," or very disinterested & quiet, ie, "doves." This dichotomy was especially apparent in worker attitudes toward job security. 9 Tables, 4 Figures, 1 Appendix, 6 References. M. Meeks.

title: Kleine milieucriminaliteit: pleidooi voor poenale voorlichting
abstract: Regular litter control strategies in the Netherlands include an information campaign aimed at voluntary control through consciousness raising, & a system of fines & penalties for offenders. Arguments in favor of abolishing the system of fines show that it would be unrealistic for the government to place all its hopes on the media goodwill campaign. A survey of the literature shows that the fines do exert a restraining influence on potential litterers. 42 References.
tags: litter control, fines' deterrent, impact, Netherlands

title: Een beter schoolloopbaanmodel?
abstract: There has been considerable debate in the Netherlands over reform of the school system, specifically the channeling of students into vocational or U preparatory education from elementary school onwards. The meritocratic approach, which claims that students are chosen for the preparatory track by virtue of their achievement, is shown to be untenable by LISREL data processing. Implications for reform policy are reviewed. In Korte reactie op 'Een beter schoolloopbaan model?' van Dronkers en Saris (Short Reply to "A Better Model for the School System?"), Ton Mooij shows why Dronkers's & Saris's critique is inconsistent & inadequate. 1 Table, 2 Figures, 32 References. M. Meeks.

title: Kritische bijdragen
authors: Godschalk,J. J.,   Mooij,Ton,   Clason,C. E.,   Hoof,J. J. van
abstract: Korte reactie op 'Een beter schoolloopbaan model?' van Dronkers en Saris door Ton MooijVoor een rechtvaardige inkomensverdeling heeft een nutsfunctie weinig nut door J.J. Gotschalk (p.63)A discussion of inter- & intrapersonal ethical judgments inherent in the construction of a social welfare function & in a statistical determination of fair income distribution. Previous studies by J. Tinbergen ("Naar de meetbaarheid van een rechtvaardige verdeling" [On the Measurability of Fair Income Distribution], De Economist, 1973, 121, 2), & by B. M. S. Van Praag, A. Kapteyn, & F. G. Herwaarden ("Individuele welvaartsfuncties en sociale referentiegroepen" [Individual Welfare Functions and Social Reference Groups], ESB, 1979, 31, 1) are criticized for light treatment of these philosophical issues. Further, the type of model they propose is based on a static conception of economic needs & wants. It is shown that just as the economy is subject to fluctuations, so are consumer preferences & attitudes toward material lifestyle. 65 References. M. Meeks.Bespreking van 'Mentale incongruenties - sociale restricties - gedrag. Een onderzoek naam beroepsparticipatie van vrouwelijke academici. F. Tazelaar, disertatie Utrecht , besproken  door C.E.Clason en J.J. van Hoof
tags: fair income distribution, social welfare/use function usefulness critiqued

title: Voortgang en vooruitgang in de sociologie
abstract: A discussion of the extent to which sociologists have succeeded in advancing their discipline. After an examination of how continuity & progress are measured in the science of science & in the sociology of sociology, the analytical techniques of Imre Lakatos's Wetenschapsfilosofie en Wetenschapsgeschiedenis ([The Philosophy and History of Science], Meppel: Boom, 1972) & G. Bohme's, W. van den Daele's, & W. Krohn's "Finalisering in de wetenschap" ([Finalization in Science] in Macht over Wetenschap [Power over Science], Rip, A., & Groenewegen, P. [Eds], Bilthoven: Ambo, 1974) are reviewed. Key evaluative criteria include the enhancement of knowledge, the application of knowledge to solve practical problems, improvement of methods, & activities related to sociology as a social system. Methods have been improved during the 1970s, but more sophistication is needed in showing the limits of the available methods. Sociology has been somewhat hampered by the numerous schools. Some signs of convergence can be detected, however, which should increase when marginals & mainliners engage in practical research problems. 97 References. Modified HA.
tags: sociology field's progress/improvement, The Philosophy and History of Science/Finalization in Science reviewed

title: Voorkeuren en waarderingen 1. Een drietal meetsystemen
abstract: The manner in which individuals form judgments on different qualities of an object is an important topic in sociology. In recent decades, statistical methods have been developed to measure these judgments for microqualities & to evaluate the interactions between them. The design of an experiment is described in which psychophysical, conjunctive, & functional models of measurement are utilized to gauge specific aspects of consumer behavior in the areas of housing & shopping preferences. 3 Tables, 2 Figures, 48 References. M. Meeks.

title: Voorkeuren voor aspecten van het stedelijk leefmilieu
abstract: Since society must live with the results of Ur planning for a long time, a key problem of planning is the conditional prediction of environmental preferences of future residents. Two psychological theories are combined to help explain such preferences: the hierarchical needs theory of A. H. Maslow (Motivation and Personality, New York, 1954) & of F. Herzberg (Work and the Nature of Man, Cleveland, 1966); & D. Berlyne's theory about preferences for complexity ("The Vicissitudes of Aplopathematic and Thelematoscopic Pneumatology or the Hydrography of Hedonism" in Pleasure, Reward, Preference, Berlyne, D. E., & Madsen, R. B. [Eds], New York, 1973). Three central hypotheses (the preference for complexity, the importance of unfulfilled needs, & consensus on the importance of needs) were tested via a pilot questionnaire survey of 109 Dutch adults; these findings, combined with secondary analysis of data from 4 other surveys, appear to support the combined theory of hierarchical needs. 9 Tables, 2 Figures, 58 References. Modified HA.

title: Kritische bijdragen
authors: Teulings,A. W. M.,   Hees,Bert van,   Vroom,Cas,   Lammers,C. J.
abstract: Politisering van de wetenschap als 'sociale wenselijkheid' en wetenschapsdogmatisme door A.W.M. Teulings:To determine attitudes toward the interrelationship of government-sponsored research & the politicization of science in the Netherlands, questionnaire data were collected from doctoral students & degreed specialists in solid state physics (total N = 78) at 4 different institutions. Analysis of the data reveals a positive r between depoliticization & degree of scientific dogmatism; ie, the closer the ties between government & research, the less insistent are researchers on the independent validity of their findings. 3 Tables, 2 References. M. Meeks.Mededeling: Conferentie 'Jeugdcultuur en onderwijs'Bespreking van 'Organizations alike and unlike', 1979 door G.B. van Hees en C.W. VroomRepliek van C.J. Lammers

title: Op zoek naar een kwalitatieve waarnemingsmethode: de patronenanalyse
abstract: Until quite recently, most Dutch studies in educational sociology have focused on selection processes & mechanisms within the school system; comparatively little attention has been given to analysis of student-teacher interaction in everyday classroom situations & its effects on the reproduction of social inequity. Pattern analysis, closely related to Barney G. Glaser's & Anselm L. Strauss's grounded theory (The Discovery of Grounded Theory: Strategies for Qualitative Research, Chicago, 1967) & to P. van der Kley's & F. Webster's symbolic interactionism ("Selectie in het lager onderwijs" [Selection in the Field of Basic Education] in Kansarme groepen en hun onderwijs: Bijdragen tot de onderwijsresearchdagen [Disadvantaged Groups and Education: Contributions to Educational Research], The Hague, 1978), is advanced as a fruitful experimental approach to studying long-term student achievement. The application of path analysis to data from N. A. Flanders's Analyzing Teaching Behavior (Reading, Mass, 1970) reveals a variety of mechanisms often found in instruction, including repetition, division of students into "good" & "troublesome" categories, manipulation of rules, & the handling of incorrect student response. 4 Tables, 2 Figures, 36 References. M. Meeks.
tags: pattern analysis, educational system inequality reproduction applications

title: De perceptie van de woonomgeving bij kinderen: een vergelijking van binnenstad en buitenwijk
abstract: Most previous studies of children's adaptation to their local environments have concentrated on objective factors, eg, available play area, proximity to good schools, & chances for contact with other children; few researchers have interviewed the children themselves to determine their subjective assessments. Questionnaire data obtained from youngsters in Toronto, Ontario (N = 148, aged 14-17) regarding satisfaction with their neighborhoods (400-meter radius of their homes) revealed distinct differences between inner-city & suburban residents, the latter giving more positive appraisals. It is emphasized that adolescent & adult assessments of the same area might differ considerably. 7 Tables, 52 References. M. Meeks.

title: Respondent-rolopvattingen in survey-interviews
abstract: In psychological laboratory research, it has been suggested that different conceptions held by Ss about their tasks may lead to different reactions to the stimuli presented & hence to systematic errors, or bias. A. D. Shulman & H. J. Berman ("Role Expectations about Subjects and Experimenters in Psychological Research," Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 1975, 32, 368-380) investigated naturally occurring expectations of Ss & found three factors, which they labeled faithfulness, apprehensiveness, & suspiciousness. It is hypothesized that similar conceptions of Rs in survey research may also lead to response errors. A questionnaire consisting of 25 Dutch translations of the Shulman & Berman items (eg, honest, nervous, skeptical) was administered to 556 Rs after a face-to-face interview, in which they were asked to rate which of the 25 words described their behavior during the interview. Factor analysis with oblique rotation of data from 313 Rs yielded results remarkably similar to those of Shulman & Berman. LISREL analysis suggested that correlations between factors could be explained by a common "social desirability response set." It is concluded that the influence of R role conception has structural validity; further research is recommended. 1 Table, 1 Figure, 8 References. Modified AA.

title: Voorkeuren en waarderingen 2. De vergelijking van een drietal meetsystemen
abstract: A continuation (see abstract of Part I in this section also) of a contrastive analysis of three types of measurement (economic, functional, & psychophysical). Interview data from Dutch women (N = 18 housewives & 1 career worker) were collected during an experiment of 4-5 hours, in which consumer preferences for housing situations were compared with those for shopping arrangements. Statistical analysis reveals that a multiplicative model is a better integration technique than an additive model. 8 Tables, 2 Figures, 10 References. M. Meeks.

title: Reactie op 'Voor een rechtvaardige inkomensverdeling heeft een nutsfunctie weinig nut'
abstract: A reply to J. J. Godschalk's "Voor een rechtvaardige inkomensverdeling heeft een nutsfunctie weinig nut" (A Utilization Function Is of Little Use for a Just System of Income Distribution [see abstract in this section also]). Godschalk is incorrect in asserting that the theory of comparative utilization has little value when taken from economics & transferred to the social sciences. Utilization theory is of great importance to consumer behavior studies. Similarly, utilization theory can be applied to interpersonal relationships. Admittedly, however, a purely mathematical approach cannot predict all human behavior. M. Meeks.
tags: income distribution, utilization theory applicability, J. J. Godschalk's article critiqued

title: De onvolledigheid van algemene hypothesen: een pleidooi voor verklarende modellen
abstract: The empirical & theoretical sciences make considerable use of general hypotheses, subject to continuous verification, testing, & refinement. Currently, testing methods have become so rigorous that many hypotheses are being rejected prematurely. Social science hypotheses cannot always be verified in the same way as those of the natural sciences, as the former are characterized by greater uncertainty. Suggestions are presented for models of the deductive reasoning used in sociological hypothesis verification. Special attention is given to the historical transformation of ideas on the construction & refinement of such hypotheses. 25 References. M. Meeks.
tags: general hypothesis testing, deductive reasoning model suggestions

title: Dilemma's in internationaal vergelijkend onderzoek. Problemen van validiteit en betrouwbaarheid
abstract: An overview of problems of validity & reliability in international comparative research. Seven key problems are discussed in terms of dilemmas or paradoxes: (1) macro vs micro theories in explaining national differences; (2) standardization of instruments; (3) formal vs functional equivalence; (4) large representative vs small selective samples, & the selection of countries; (5) accumulation of experience; (6) cooperative vs centralized "safari" research; & (7) issues of nonresponse & reliability. It is concluded that in international comparative studies, goals should be specified during the planning stage. Restriction strategies, eg, selective samples, secondary analysis, & application of models with latent variables, are advocated. 66 References. Modified HA.

title: Max Weber en het oudtestamentische renteverbod
abstract: A discussion of the Old Testament prohibition of usury (Exodus 22:24). According to Max Weber (Gesammelte Aufsatze zur Religionssoziologie III. Das antike Judentum [Collected Essays on the Sociology of Religion III: Ancient Judaism], 3rd edition, Tubingen, 1963), the separation of ethics for internal & external social groups in Judaism has remained permanently significant for the religious evaluation of economic activity. This ethic found its most striking expression in the prohibition of usury. Lending money at interest to one's kin was forbidden, but lending to outsiders was acceptable. Weber thought that this ethical dualism meant that the Puritan inner-worldly asceticism cannot be found in Judaism. Moreover, proving oneself economically was not a necessity in the Jewish ethic. Modified HA.
tags: Weber, Max, Old Testament usury prohibition, ancient Jews' ethical dualism, religion's economic activity evaluation

title: Oude wijn, verkeerde zakken
abstract: tevens Naschrift door J. M. M. Amersfoort

title: Drie republieken en een koninkrijk. Vlaamse sociologen congresseren
Gepubliceerde zelfmoorden en verhoging van sterfte door zelfmoord en ongelukken in Nederland 1972-1980
abstract: To investigate the relationship between newspaper suicide coverage & mortality due to suicide & accidents, a partial replication is presented of the analyses by D. P. Phillips (see SA 23:1/75H1402 & SA 27:5/79K2733), using Dutch data from 1972 to 1980. Expected mortality rates were constructed by using Phillips's method & by regressing mortality rates on time & dummy variables for monthly effects. The results were inconclusive. For suicide & traffic accidents, mortality rates tend to rise 3%-8% on a monthly basis (about the same amount as Phillips showed), but this is not significant at conventional levels. No rise of mortality was revealed in the "other accidents" category. 2 Tables, 2 Graphs, 1 Appendix, 5 References. Modified HA.

title: Betrouwbaarheidsbepaling met herhaalde metingen
abstract: An analysis of a method for estimating reliability of data, requiring three subsequent measurements per individual on two measurements & a suitable instrumental variable. As examples, the selection of reliable questions in panel surveys & the correction for attenuation are discussed. For three-wave multiple-indicator data, the model for three measurements by David E. Wiley & James A. Wiley (see SA 18:7/70E5517) can be compared with L. J. Cronbach's alpha model ("Coefficient Alpha and the Internal Structure of Tests," Psychometrika, 1951, 16, 297-334). When using two real-life data sets, the former model produced slightly higher reliabilities, but when applied to two measurements & an instrumental variable, it proved less trustworthy. A method is proposed to select a suitable instrumental variable. 6 Tables, 4 Figures, 2 Appendixes, 28 References. Modified HA.
tags: data reliability estimation method, panel survey question selection/attenuation correction

title: Veranderingen in de Nederlandse beroepenstratificatie. Een verkennend onderzoek naar het verband met culturele factoren
authors: Braam,G. P. A.,   Geurts,P. A. Th M.
abstract: An examination of changes in the stratification of occupational prestige in the Netherlands, based on survey data from 1940, 1948, 1950, 1953, & 1978 (N not given). The hypothesis that prestige changes are related to value changes suggests that, in the assignment of prestige, the value of academic competence has increased over the value of integrity. In general, the data show that the prestige of knowledge-intensive occupations has increased over that of professions associated with personal character. The main exception to these findings is that the prestige of knowledge-intensive occupations in politics & public administration has decreased. 4 Tables, 2 Figures, 37 References. Modified HA.

title: De stijging van de arbeidsongeschiktheid in de jaren zeventig. Beleid en analyse
Non-response bij enquêtes of 'wat niet weet, wat niet deert?'
Het meten van therapeutisch gedrag bij verpleegkundigen. Gedragsobservatie als criterium voor validiteit
abstract: To examine the validity of a questionnaire on therapeutic behavior, the nursing staff (N = 17) of a Dutch hospital was registered by independent observers. The results of the independent analysis were compared with questionnaire data from the nurses' evaluations of their own behavior. A significant correlation was found between self-reported & observed behavior, consistent over the variables of time, place, medical specialization, & observers. Thus, the questionnaire on therapeutic behavior is a valid measure of the nurses' performance. Strong indications were given that patient characteristics exert much influence on therapeutic behavior. 7 Tables, 12 References. Modified HA.

title: Kritische bijdragen
authors: Amersfoort,J. M. M. van,   Gier,Erik de

title: De kool, de geit en de kwaliteit
Klasse, status en inkomensongelijkheid
abstract: Until Erik Olin Wright & Luca Perrone (see SA 25:4/77I7949) introduced the Marxist class variable, the status attainment theory was dominant in quantitative studies of social inequality & stratification. A replication of their study for the Netherlands based on economic data gathered by means of a questionnaire (N = 1,149 Rs) was performed to compare the effects of the Marxist class & occupational status variables on income; occuaptional status was found to better explain income variance. A significant r between SC & education for Ms was found. Significant differences in income returns on education between Ms & Fs were reported, even within SC categories. 4 Tables, 4 Figures. Modified HA.

title: Veranderingen in individuele schoolloopbanen tussen 1959 en 1977 in de stad Groningen
abstract: A comparison of two generations of pupils in Groningen, Netherlands, using a statistical model that includes the extended variables of occupational level of father, educational level of both parents, sex, & family size. These variables are related to nonpromotion, ability test scores, & advice of teacher. The model is tested with LISREL procedures. The following are found: a diminishing effect of sex on ability score, a decrease of the effect of ability score on teacher's advice, & an increase of the effect of sex on advice. This might be due to the fact that Groningen teachers evaluate the scholastic ability of girls as being lower than that of the boys despite their increasingly equal ability test scores. The total effects of the social background variables on educational attainment have not changed between 1959 & 1977. 3 Tables, 2 Figures, 12 References. Modified AA.

title: Het schatten en toetsen van een kruistabel onder loglineaire modelassumpties
abstract: Starting from the saturated multiplicative f model, a review of fundamental commonality in several versions of the loglinear model is presented. Special attention is given to the estimation of frequencies under the restrictions of a model. Consequently, all types of unsaturated models can be presented from one integrating point of view. With polytomous variables, the calculation, testing, & interpretation of parameters is much more complicated than with dichotomies, although there is no difference in objective. In both cases, the estimation of frequencies & testing of models are carried out the same way. The well-known method of the proportional fitting algorithm is reviewed to demonstrate the correspondence between the constraints of a model & the dynamics of the estimating procedure. 3 Tables, 4 Figures. Modified HA.
tags: cross-table appraisal/testing, loglinear models' fundamental commonality

title: De samenhang tussen machteloosheid, kenmerken van de ziekenhuisomgeving en de beleving van patiënten
abstract: Questionnaire data from out- & inpatients (N = 1,808) of Dutch general hospitals were analyzed to test the validity of using J. B. Rotter's locus of control scale ("Some Problems and Misconceptions Related to the Construct of Internal Versus External Control Reinforcement," Journal of Consulting & Clinical Psychology, 1975, 43, 56-57) to measure the satisfaction, medical & hospital knowledge, & emotional welfare of patients. Two measures of powerlessness were used: health anomie & medical skepticism. Powerless patients showed more anxiety & stress, & expressed less positive & more negative feelings. Personal health powerlessness correlated negatively with the amount of patients' knowledge, while medical skepticism was positively correlated with level of satisfaction. Rotter's locus of control scale was not found to be suitable as a predictor of patients' situational well-being. 3 Tables, 47 References. Modified HA.

title: Hamlet in de antropologie?
abstract: A review essay on Edward Evans-Pritchard's A History of Anthropological Thought (New York: Basic Books, 1981) & Mary Douglas's biography of her teacher Evans-Pritchard (Glasgow: Fontana Paperbooks, 1980). A positive appraisal is offered of both works. Special attention is given to the historical relationship between sociology & cultural anthropology. M. Meeks.
tags: Evans-Pritchard, Edward, A History of Anthropological Thought/Mary Douglas's Evans-Pritchard, review essay

title: Veranderingen in de schoolloopbanen tussen 1965 en 1977: ontwikkelingen in de Nederlandse samenleving en in haar onderwijs
abstract: Many sociological studies have been performed on the relationship between Dutch children's SS & their ultimate success in the school system, including the selection process by which some children are encouraged to participate in Coll preparatory or vocational programs. To measure the progress made in advancing equal educational opportunity, results are compared from a 1965 questionnaire survey (N = 11,170 CBS [vocational program] students & 37,065 SMVO [Coll preparatory] students) & a 1977 questionnaire survey (N = 1,948 CBS students & 3,212 SMVO students). Correlation of data on parental occupation, income level, degree of urbanization, family size, & student achievement level shows that some success has been met in helping disadvantaged students advance to the higher level school systems. 5 Tables, 1 Figure, 45 References. M. Meeks.

title: Cultuurdeelname als verwerking van informatie of verwerving van status. Een confrontatie van twee alternatieve verklarende theorieën aan de hand van reeds verricht onderzoek
abstract: A contrastive analysis of two theories explaining differential participation in high-level cultural activities: (1) information theory, which claims that differential participation can be explained by differences in the information processing capacities of people & in the complexity of the information processed; & (2) status theory, which holds that participation is a function of the status that a person wants to have & that the participation rate is tied to the status aspects of cultural events. An overview of Dutch empirical studies shows that while both explanations have some merit, the information theory better accounts for current leisure & cultural consumption patterns. 1 Appendix, 52 References. Modified HA.

title: Beroepsmobiliteit tussen generaties in Nederland in 1954 en 1977
abstract: J. J. M. van Tulder's classical investigation of intergenerational occupational mobility in the Netherlands in 1954 (Sociale stijging en daling in Nederland III, de beroepsmobiliteit in Nederland van 1919 tot 1954: Een sociaal-statistische studie [Social Rise and Fall in the Netherlands, Part III: Profesional Mobility in the Netherlands from 1919 to 1954: A Sociostatistical Study] Leyden: Stenfert-Kroese, 1962) is replicated with 1977 data from the Central Bureau of Statistics. It is shown that: (1) about 50% of the structural mobility can be modeled by a vertical shift parameter; (2) nearly all of the circulation mobility can be modeled by the linear distance parameter; (3) structural mobility was considerably larger in 1977 than in 1954, although its uniform part was almost the same for both years; & (4) circular mobility also grew, in contrast to the well-known results for the US reported by Robert M. Hauser (see SA 30:5/82M5935). 2 Tables, 2 Figures, 22 References. Modified HA

title: Tsjechische sociologie en marxisme-leninisme
abstract: The development of Czech sociology was forcibly interrupted by the Communist coup d'etat of 1948. During the 1950s, the study of sociology, officially branded as a "petit bourgeois pseudoscience," was prohibited. In its place, the Marxist-Leninist doctrine of historical materialism was proclaimed to be the only true social science. Due to a more liberal cultural policy in the 1960s, sociological study again became possible. Most Czech sociologists appeared highly critical, albeit covertly, of dialectical materialism. After the Soviet invasion of 1968, the liberalism came to an end. By 1970, the "ideological purity" of Czech sociology, ie, dialectical materialism, had already been reestablished. The persecution of key sociologists was an essential part of restoring Marxist-Leninist sociology. Modified HA

title: Veranderende onderwijskansen? Een derde voorbeeld en afrondende conclusies
abstract: To determine the extent to which equal opportunity in the Netherlands has been advanced in the area of education, data from previous research projects (see SA 33:4/85Q0231 & 85Q0210) are subjected to secondary analysis. Two aggregate samples of students (N = 5,216 in 1952 & 1,291 in 1977) are examined, the independent variables including father's profession, sex of student, number of siblings, degree of urbanization, parents' educational level, & choice of secondary school. Some improvements can be reported in overall social mobility; neither the optimism of the 1960s nor the pessimism of the 1970s were warranted, according to these findings. 3 Tables, 2 Figures, 34 References. M. Meeks

title: Sociale relaties en eenzaamheid bij ouderen
abstract: Using questionnaire data (N = 2,324) from the Netherlands Central Bureau of Statistics (De leefsituatie van de Nederlandse bevolking van 55 jaar en ouder Deel 1: Kerncijfers [The Living Situation of Dutch Citizens Age 55 and Older, Part I: Basic Data], The Hague, 1977), information on type of shelter, household composition, health, leisure activities, & social contacts were analyzed. Loglinear models are developed to relate these variables to the experience of loneliness. The amount & variety of social contacts are the most important factors, followed by health, degree of urbanization, & marital status. 4 Tables, 13 References. Modified HA

title: Voorkeuren voor verdelingen zoals bepaald door situationele en persoonlijke factoren
abstract: To determine whether man always acts in his own economic self-interest by seeking to maximize his own profits, data were obtained from Dutch adults (N = 132, aged 18+) of leftist, centrist, & right-wing political orientations, by having them play a simulated game in which they were to share some of their money with strangers. The amount of money shared was shown to depend on the number of alternatives, the justification of need, the number of participants, & other factors. Little difference was observed between the various political groups. Profit maximization was not the dominant motivating factor for any of the three groups. 3 Tables, 4 Figures, 17 References. HA Tr & Modified by M. Meeks

title: De rol van ruimtelijke factoren bij maatschappelijke veranderingsprocessen
abstract: Spatial relationships are a key component of integration processes, a special type of social change. As the study of ethnic minorities comes to play an important role in sociology, the importance of spatial studies will continue to grow. Spatial isolation often occurs along with social & cultural isolation. Special attention is given to residential segregation, the separation of minorities by neighborhood. Integration processes are viewed as possible solutions to current problems of social inequality. 27 References. M. Meeks

title: Gadourek en de Nederlandse sociologische traditie
Als de dood voor de dood. Een sociologische belichting van sterven en dood in de hedendaagse samenleving
abstract: Individual & social taboos continue to repress the psychological acceptance of death to the point that the consciousness of death is vanishing. Death is removed from public life into the private sphere. Religion in general & Christianity in particular have lost their dominant influence as general meaning structures in Western society. Without a legitimate, ultimate meaning, death is seen as absurd. Thus, a paradox has developed: on the one hand, death is taboo, while on the other, interest in death is growing. The death process is being redefined, lifting the taboo. Individuals previously bound by the taboo are now able to interpret their own experiences of death through an autonomous choice of meaning structures, religious or otherwise. However, another paradox is seen in that this increased self-determination is lost at the moment of death. 56 References. Modified HA
tags: death consciousness/taboos, modern societies, private vs religious meaning structures

title: Arbeidsongeschiktheidsperceptie en WAO-toetreding
abstract: A theory of (work) disability behavior is proposed & tested. Behavioral differences are studied in the context of the Dutch Disability Social Insurance Program (WAO), which covers all private sector employees for income loss due to a prolonged (more than one year) incapacity to work. Focus is on accounting for the empirical phenomenon that some persons with a given "true" disability status continue to work, whereas others with the same disability status stop working & put in a claim for a disability benefit. Given the "true" state, the claimant's own perception of his or her work capacity is supposed to be the main determinant of this differential work response. Consequently, a probability model of eligibility for a WAO benefit is built, in which self-perceived work capacity acts as the pivotal variable. The model consists of two equations. The first is to assess why people perceive their work capacity differently. It was hypothesized that, apart from their true disability status, work-leisure preferences cause differences in perceptions. The second is to establish which factors directly affect the probability of becoming eligible. Both true & self-perceived disability status, & the extent to which gatekeepers & employers are helpful in realizing the claim are introduced as explanatory factors. The data by which the model is estimated are derived from a survey of 2,808 Dutch workers on sick leave. They & their employers were interviewed; & medical & occupational reports were compiled on all Rs. The sample was then administratively followed until either benefit recipiency or work resumption had taken place. The results are congruent with theoretical expectations. After controlling for true disability, self-perceived work capacity turns out to play a dominant role in the eligibility determination process. Gatekeepers & employers exert only a small influence. The regression on the capacity perceptions shows that work-leisure preferences indeed codetermine self-reported disability. Finally, there appears to be an interaction effect of self-perception with true disability: as true disability increases, the impact of the perception on the probability of eligibility dwindles. 9 Tables, 20 References. Modified AA

title: Een beroepsprestigeschaal voor Nederland in de jaren tachtig
abstract: A new occupational prestige scale, based on 116 occupational titles, is presented for the Netherlands in the 1980s. Questionnaire data from a nationwide adult survey (N = 753) were used to rank the titles according to prestige. Although data were gathered at an ordinal level, the scale itself was adapted to the interval level. For comparative purposes, scale values were also calculated in a way similar to a scale by F. van Heek et al (Sociale stijging en daling in Nederland 1 [Social Mobility in the Netherlands, Part I], Leiden, 1958), which is shown to be unsatisfactory by current standards. A key is presented enabling the researcher to assign prestige scores to all occupations listed by the Dutch Central Bureau of Statistics. Using these methods, data from other types of surveys can be used more intensively. 4 Tables, 36 References. Modified HA

title: Honkbal op klompen. Een theoretisch model van socioculturele integratie
abstract: Each summer in June the American Baseball Foundation of the Hague sponsors a US-style picnic, with a baseball game in which the players wear wooden shoes. To investigate how US & Dutch customs are blended or kept separate by the US community, interview data were collected from US adults (N = 50, 25 each sex). In general, the Americans' reaction to their new environment can be viewed along two dimensions: (1) adoptive/reactive; & (2) voluntary/forced. Three main personality types usually develop: (A) the isolated person, alienated from Dutch language & society, seeking to maximize contact with other Americans; (B) the cosmopolitan type, speaking both languages & maintaining social contact with both Americans & Dutch; & (C) the bicultural type, fully integrated into Dutch society with no plans to return to the US. 2 Figures, 17 References. M. Meeks

title: Artefacten van de geest of de naakte feiten: De Groot en Roskam in debat
abstract: A. D. de Groot's Methodologie ([Methodology], the Hague, 1961) was the standard, generally accepted work on Dutch sociological method until the publication of E. E. Ch. I. Roskam's Metric Analysis of Ordinal Data in Psychology (no city or publisher cited, 1961). For many years, the differences in their approaches continued to grow, especially with respect to theories of operationalization, validity, & a priori techniques. In recent years, however, their conclusions have come closer together, while their fundamental approaches & basic principles have continued to diverge. 9 References. M. Meeks
tags: sociological methodology, Netherlands, A. D. de Groot's vs E. E. Ch. I. Roskam's approaches

title: De relatie leefvorm - eenzaamheid nader geanalyseerd
abstract: To study the nature of objective social isolation & feelings of loneliness, questionnaire data were obtained from a stratified sample of Dutch adults (N = 556) with varying marital status from three different communities. Special attention was given to the Rs' evaluation of their own network of social relationships. The results show that loneliness is significantly related to the absence of a marriage partner. People living alone & parents without partners are usually lonelier than people living with a partner. Other important factors include the degree of intimacy that the Rs found in their most important relationship & the desire for new social contacts. 2 Tables, 15 References. Modified HA
