title: Machtsvorming in een conflict: de mobilisatie van steun aan gematigde en harde vakbondsacties
abstract: Conflicts in labor organizations are often initiated by trade union organizations. The development of a conflict depends on the potential of the parties to use the power at their disposal. Very seldom are all resources utilized. To determine the conditions under which union members are willing to support their union during a conflict, interview data were collected from 108 unionized workers at 2 different points of imminent conflict, before & after union attempts to mobilize support. It is shown that observed costs & profits in the ideological, social, & material spheres accounted for a change toward readiness for support & preferences for certain forms of action. Thus, the ratio of observed costs to profits determines the level of motivation to support the union. 4 Tables, 1 Figure, 7 References. Modified HA

title: Overeenstemming en associatie in sociologisch onderzoek
abstract: "Agreement" refers to the degree to which the content of texts can be constructed in the same way by different researchers. The increase in qualitative methods in sociological research, eg, content analysis & observational techniques, necessitates that there be agreement on how to report reliable conclusions. After the distinction is drawn between "agreement" & "association," attention is focused on models for establishing agreement among qualitative databases. Agreement is shown to be the more valuable of the two concepts for many types of qualitative studies. 4 Tables, 2 Figures, 22 References. M. Meeks
tags: sociological research, qualitative studies, agreement/association concepts

title: Partnerkeuze onder Indiase studenten
abstract: An overview is presented of recent changes in attitudes toward marriage & the role of women among Uc Indian youths. Review of the literature suggests that increasing educational levels of women are leading to subtle moves away from the traditional institutions of the extended family & parental selection of their children's marriage partners. M. Meeks

title: Politiek terrorisme en massamedia: een causaal verband?
Trouwpatronen en de openheid van een samenleving. De samenhang tussen de opleidingsniveaus van (huwelijks) partners in Nederland tussen 1959 en 1977
abstract: In "Beroepsmobiliteit tussen generaties in Nederland in 1954 en 1977" ([Professional Mobility between the Generations of 1954 and 1977 in the Netherlands], see abstract in this section), H. Ganzeboom & P. de Graaf have shown that occupational mobility was considerably larger in 1977 than in 1954. To examine the validity of this conclusion for the openness of Dutch society on the whole, another indicator, selective mating, is examined. Using Ganzeboom's & de Graaf's questionnaire data, the educational levels of spouses (N = 2,923) are analyzed for 1954, 1971, & 1977. If partners with the same or different levels of education are called homogamous & heterogamous, respectively, a loglinear analysis shows that: (1) heterogamy cannot be fully accounted for as "forced" by different educational structures; (2) structural & actual heterogamy were more pronounced in 1954 than in 1977; & (3) there was still some dependence between spouses' educational levels after 1971. 3 Tables, 21 References. Modified HA

title: Bejaardensociologie naast of vanuit de algemene sociologie?
authors: Braam,G. P. A.,   Coolen,J. A. I.,   Naafs,J.

title: Conservatisme in Nederland nader bekeken
abstract: The term "conservative" should be used carefully, since conservatism may be measured on two axes: cultural & economic. Four basic types of personality profiles may be distinguished based on whether one is conservative in terms of these 2 variables. To illustrate such differences, questionnaire data were obtained from Dutch adults (N = 1,007, aged 18-70) about their attitudes on a variety of SE issues. A multidimensional analysis confirms the validity of the hypothesis that one may be conservative in economic thought but liberal on social issues, & vice versa. Thus, no strong r is established between these 2 types of conservatism. 4 Tables, 5 Figures, 19 References. Modified HA

title: De overgang van basisonderwijs naar voortgezet onderwijs in 1977
abstract: Recent studies of the transition from primary to secondary school stress the central role of scholastic achievement in this process. It is generally claimed that other background factors influencing achievement levels in secondary education are almost totally overshadowed by previous scholastic achievement. To examine the validity of several models correlating secondary school achievement with primary school achievement, school records of Dutch students (N = 1,034) entering high school in 1977 were examined. It is concluded that these models lead to little understanding of social inequality in education. 4 Tables, 5 Figures, 19 References. Modified HA

title: Vormen van politieke participatie in Nederland
abstract: A study of the dimensionality of political participation, using Dutch longitudinal survey data (Barnes, S. H., Kaase, M., et al, Political Action: Mass Participation in Five Western Democracies, Beverly Hills, Calif: Sage, 1979). Political participation is defined as the set of activities of private citizens aimed at influencing the preparation, realization, &/or implementation of public policy. Using nonmetric multidimensional scaling, electoral, conventional, & unconventional or protest participation were distinguished. It was shown that both conventional & unconventional participation are cumulative rather than mutually exclusive methods of influencing the policy-making process. The findings indicated a high degree of political stability in the 1970s. 3 Tables, 3 Figures, 27 References. Modified HA

title: Sturing met retorische middelen. Over de nadelen van voorlichting en de voordelen van maatschappelijke discussie
abstract: A contrastive analysis of rhetorical techniques used in dissemination of public information & in discussions of social issues in the Netherlands reveals several unexpected similarities between these two seemingly different spheres of language usage. In both cases, rhetoric is used by the speaker to influence the listener's mind & change his opinion about a certain idea or issue. Although opposing viewpoints or information may be present, the speaker seeks to neutralize their influence while bringing about a specific change of attitude among his audience. M. Meeks

title: Over het intelligentie-onderzoek bij de militaire keuringen vanaf 1925 tot heden
abstract: Since 1925, Dutch military recruits have taken intelligence tests. Analysis of official data from 1925, 1932, 1952, 1962, 1972, & 1982, using r coefficients, shows that as the general educational level of the country has increased, so have the raw scores on the intelligence tests. 11 Figures, 2 Appendixes, 18 References. HA Tr & Modified by M. Meeks

title: De grenzen van de arbeidersklasse: een theoretische kritiek op enkele recente marxistische theorieën
abstract: A key problem of modern Marxist theory is the definition of class structure. The changes in the structure of capitalist society since the nineteenth century have called into question traditional Marxist teachings. Many disputes now exist between orthodox & neo-Marxists concerning the applicability of traditional Marxist class definitions to advanced capitalist economies. A literature survey reveals that although all Marxist authors distinguish between the bourgeoisie & the proletariat, there is wide disagreement as to where to draw the lower boundary of the former & the upper boundary of the latter. Special attention is given to Nicos Poulantzas's Classes in Contemporary Capitalism (London, 1975). M. Meeks
tags: literature survey, Nicos Poulantzas's Classes in Contemporary Capitalism

title: Olson, Lindenberg en reductie in de sociologie
abstract: An analysis is presented of Mancur Olson's hypothesis (The Logic of Collective Action, Cambridge: Harvard U Press, 1965) that the larger the group, the farther it will fall short of providing an optimal amount of a collective good. It turns out that this explanation has exactly the structure of the so-called heterogeneous reduction: two homogeneous steps, ie, an individual & an aggregation step, followed by a heterogeneous step based on transformation rules. A critical reply is given to S. Lindenberg's analysis of the same sample (see SA 33:4/85O9299). The positive results for theoretical sociology are twofold: (1) a number of hidden elements & clarifying refinements of Olson's "logic of collective action" are suggested; & (2) the resulting "utilistic" reduction of Olson's hypothesis is able to function as an ideal type for the reduction of other social-collective regularities. 11 References. Modified HA
tags: Olson, Mancur, The Logic of Collective Action

title: Heeft de rechtssociologie een toegevoegde waarde? Reflecties naar aanleiding van een oratie van Kees Schuyt
abstract: The sociology of law has been greatly affected by various theories of knowledge & learning central to the social sciences. Many legal sociologists are baffled by the increasing cacophony of information addressing the concept of law, but sociologists of law can now take advantage of many new research techniques & sources. In this light, Kees Schuyt's speech, "Ongeregeld heden" ([Contemporary Disorder], unpublished, delivered 11 June 1982) is criticized for its treatment of the sociolegal aspects of the Dutch welfare state. M. Meeks

title: Over de voorspelbaarheid van de hoogte van het ziekteverzuim met behulp van werklooscheidscijfers: een analyse over de periode 1965-1982
abstract: One noticeable trend in Dutch employee behavior is the recent decrease in sick time. To investigate whether the high unemployment rate & concerns over job security are factors in this trend, economic data from 1965 to 1982 are correlated with sick time data. The results show that, although unemployment increased almost continuously from 1965 (0.8%) to 1982 (11.6%), the marked decrease in sick time did not begin until 1979, when the rate stood at 4.2%. Possible reasons for the delayed reaction are discussed. 2 Tables, 1 Figure, 38 References. M. Meeks

title: Het oligarchieprobleem: Michels' ijzeren wet en latere probleemoplossingen
abstract: An outline of the development of the sociopolitical ideas of Robert Michels (Zur Soziologie des Parteiwesens in der modernen Demokratie [The Sociology of Political Parties in Modern Democracy], Stuttgart, 1925). Michels's theory of oligarchical tendencies in democratic organizations is reconstructed. Several classical sociological problems of oligarchies in general are discussed from structural-individualist & other theoretical perspectives. 2 Figures, 39 References. M. Meeks
tags: oligarchical tendencies, democratic organizations, Robert Michel's thought

title: Interactionists do it only symbolically. Een inhoudsanalyse van symbolisch interactionistisch onderzoek
authors: Swanborn,P. G.,   Zijl,P. J. M. van
abstract: One result of the introduction of symbolic interaction studies in sociology has been a decrease in the number of studies based on concrete data. To illustrate this point, a content analysis was performed on journal articles (N = 529) from the 1983 issues of Symbolic Interaction & Studies in Symbolic Interaction. About 38% of the articles have an empirical basis; the majority of the articles use empirical data only to confirm general conceptual models already in existence, not to produce new theories. 6 Tables, 55 References. M. Meeks

title: Empirisch onderzoek naar multilevel uitspraken
abstract: Multilevel propositions deal with two types of logical units while testable propositions deal with only one type. A two-step solution for the multilevel propositions is proposed: (1) a group-specific analysis of the relationship between the individual variables; & (2) the exploration of the relationship between individual values of the coefficients of the first step & the values of higher-level variables. An example illustrating the advantages of this procedure compared to more common procedures is presented. 4 Tables, 3 Graphs, 15 References. Modified HA

title: Verzorgingsstaat en sociologie; economische crisis en macro-sociologisch tekort
abstract: The economic troubles of the Netherlands during the early 1970s were brushed away by many economists as transient problems; however, the steady intensification of these problems into the 1980s brought to light several structural shortcomings of the Dutch welfare state economy. Historical background is presented showing the welfare state's evolution under a confluence of political, economic, & social factors during the more economically prosperous 1950s & 1960s. Current claims that sociologists provided the initial impetus for the creation of the welfare state are incorrect. It remains to be seen how much input sociologists will have in the formation of the post-welfare state. 16 References. M. Meeks

title: Verandering van normen en waarden: een nieuw terrein van studie
abstract: Dutch sociology has focused on post-1964 changes in social attitudes & values. Key features of these studies include: the use of questionnaire data; a longitudinal framework; comparison of the attitudes of the survey group with a larger national sample; research publication dates of 1975 & on; lack of prognostic conclusions; the usage of secondary survey data; & emphasis on quantitative analysis. Important topics in these studies include: the spread of new ideas; cultural vs structural change; an explanation of the current social mood; difficulties with the scale measurement of R attitudes; & problems defining the average individual. 5 References. M. Meeks

title: Vrouwen in mobiliteits- en stratificatieonderzoek
abstract: A review of US, British, & Dutch sociological literature reveals that women are being increasingly studied in works on social mobility & stratification. Some problems in these studies involve sex-specific occupational titles & the unequal distribution of men & women over various function & income levels. Occupational prestige scales should be changed periodically to account for shifts in social values; the status of an occupation changes when the number of women in the occupation grows. Research on the relationship between educational & occupational levels has revealed that the relative position of the educational level is of greater importance than the absolute level, a finding with policy implications for the improvement of women's social position. 1 Table, 1 Appendix, 50 References. Modified HA
tags: female social mobility/stratification, US/British/Dutch sociological research

title: Bespreking van 'Burgerlijk en onburgerlijk Nederland'
abstract: A review article on A. Felling's, J. Peters's, & O. Schreuder's Burgerlijk en onburgerlijk Nederland: Een nationaal onderzoek naar waardenorientaties op de drempel van de jaren tachtig ([Bourgeois and Nonbourgeois Netherlands: A National Study on Value Orientations during the Early 1980s], Deventer: Van Loghum Slaterus, 1983 [see listing in IRPS No. 37]). A positive evaluation of the book is offered, praising the treatment of political, social, & religious attitudes & their underlying value structures. M. Meeks

title: Referenties en Réverences. Onzekerheid, afhankelijkheid en citeernetwerken in the Nederlandse sociologie
abstract: To investigate current trends in Dutch sociology, a content analysis was conducted of 658 articles from Dutch journals of sociology & related fields published 1979-1981. Citation data were analyzed, showing that Dutch sociology is heavily fragmented, addressing a wide variety of Dutch audiences & generally lacking consensus in theory & method. Inasmuch as cited texts are standard symbols, citation patterns & contexts reflect common features in language & scope of interest rather than the shared use of explicit theories or methods. Only a few strong, coherent schools of sociology exist, centered around key journals or U departments. 4 Tables, 8 Figures, 20 References. Modified HA

title: De reputatiemethode in het lokale machtsonderzoek. Een partiële validering met behulp van het additief conjuncte meetmodel
authors: Wassink,J. G. J.,   Braam,G. P. A.
abstract: The value of the reputation method in studies of local political power has long been debated; however, the method is still used because results are easily obtained & because additional information is gained about the community (Booth, D. A., & Adrian, C. R., "Simplifying the Discovery of Elites," The American Behavioral Scientist, 1961, 14-16). An important question with this method is the criteria used by Rs when judging the importance of others in their community. Such judgments can be used as valid measurements if they are determined by: (1) perceptions of power resources; & (2) perceptions of activities in local issues. To examine the validity of the reputation measurement technique, interview data (N = 35 Dutch Rs) are analyzed with the rarely used additive conjunct model; this technique provides the same results as the reputation measurement model, thereby independently confirming the validity of the latter. 1 Table, 1 Figure, 43 References. Modified HA

title: Het meten van beroepsprestige. Einige kanttekeningen bij een beroepsprestigeschaal voor de jaren tachtig
abstract: A review of the validity & reliability of a new occupational prestige scale for the Netherlands developed in the 1980s (see SA 33:5/85Q1898). The following criticisms are presented: (1) the projective character of the main research question introduces vague answers; (2) systematic bias is introduced through the wording of occupational titles; & (3) the utilized scale is akin to outmoded techniques of computation. More systematic research should be performed to obtain more cumulative knowledge about the validity of occupational prestige measurement. 1 Figure, 6 References. Modified HA

title: Continuïteit en vernieuwing in het politie-onderzoek. Bespreking van 'Politie en allochtonen', 'De Warmoesstraat' en 'Control in the Police Organization'
abstract: A review essay on Monique M. J. Aalberts's & Evelien M. Kamminga's Politie en Allochtonen. Verslag van een onderzoek naar de relatie tussen gemeentepolitie en allochtonen in Nederland ([Police and Migrants: A Report of Research on the Relationship between Municipal Police and Migrants in the Netherlands], The Hague: State Publishing House, 1983); M. Punch's De Warmoesstraat. Politiewerk in the binnenstad ([The Warmoesstraat: Police Work in the Inner City], Deventer: Van Loghum Slaterus, 1983); & Control in the Police Organization (Punch, M. [Ed], Cambridge, Mass: MIT Press, 1983 [see listings in IRPS No. 37]). A positive appraisal of the three works shows that the social transformations of the 1960s & 1970s thoroughly changed the nature of law enforcement policies & police agencies. As such, the study of police should be a major topic in sociology, not a minor, peripheral topic. 10 References. M. Meeks

title: The postman rings thrice. Een onderzoek naar twee kenmerken van Dillman's Total Design Method voor postenquêtes
authors: Hox,J. J.,   Leeuw,E. D. de,   Duijx,A. W. M.
abstract: An empirical study of the value of the follow-up questionnaire survey techniques of D. A. Dillman (Mail and Telephone Surveys: The Total Design Method, New York: Wiley, 1978). The effects of personalized cover letters & final reminders by certified mail were investigated with a questionnaire survey of randomly selected Dutch adults (N = 500). Total responses to the questionnaire increased from 141 after the initial mailing to 272 after reception of the final reminder notice, thus confirming the validity of Dillman's techniques. 1 Table, 16 References. M. Meeks
tags: follow-up questionnaire survey, D. A. Dillman's techniques

title: Bureau voor Ontmaskering van Onjuiste Uitspraken
Hoe de staat zijn raison d'être verloor. Staat en revolutie in Frankrijk 1775-1789
abstract: The concept of the state as a negative transfer system points to the importance of fiscal institutions in explaining the weakness of the state during times of crises. The French Revolution of 1789 demonstrates this concept; the financial structure of the state reached its limits as a result of the burden of the expenses connected with the American War of Independence (1776-1783). New taxes, more loans, & reforms were needed, yet these affected property rights so greatly that the financial transactions of the state became a rallying point in mobilizing opposition against the ancien regime. In contrast, it is shown how the British state could finance a war without losing the support of the landowning classes & without overburdening the Lcs. 1 Table, 1 Figure, 42 References. HA

title: De Katholieke intellectuele elite: 1946-1975
abstract: Catholic intellectuals played a major role in the cultural changes that took place within Dutch Catholicism during the years 1946-1975; many of their ideas served as a guideline, especially for Dutch churchleaders, eg, the bishops. A network analysis based on information about the formal & informal relations among intellectuals as well as their "citation-behavior" shows that there existed in the period several social circles within the Catholic intellectual elite. These social circles, ideological homogeneous collectivities consisting of individuals who frequently interacted, formed a necessary structural basis for the radicalization & influence of the intellectuals' ideas. 1 Table, 2 Appendixes, 13 References. AA

title: Actielogica's in processen van technologische innovatie. De introductie van CNC in twee Vlaamse machinebouwondernemingen
abstract: An explanation of "absolutist" models of interpretation, ie, "technological determinism" (work determined by technology itself), & the more recent labor process approach (work determined by the supposedly strict economical &/or political rationality in investment decisions). It is believed that a more relativist approach, in which no apriorisms are stated on the nature of social actors' logics of action, can increase the heuristic value of that model. Data are analyzed from 2 case studies on the introduction of computerized numerical control in Flanders; both were focused on characteristics of the investment decision-making processes & on the impact of technological innovation on quality of work. 2 Tables, 47 References. HA

title: Vergelijkend beleidsonderzoek op het terrein van etnische minderheden. Voetangels en klemmen bij het internationaal onderzoek naar immigratiebeleid
abstract: It is argued that at an intermediate level of abstraction, comparative research may lead to a better understanding of the hidden aims of national government policies. However, the cross-national researcher is faced with a number of methodological pitfalls, including: terminological differences; differences in the nature & accessibility of sources; differences in sociopolitical systems; & differences that result from the effects of previous policies in the same field. These problems are illustrated with examples drawn from recent comparative analyses of immigration policies in several Western European countries. 19 References. HA
tags: immigration policies, ethnic minorities, cross-national research, methodological problems

title: De beroepsperspectieven van sociologen in Nederland
abstract: Results of the latest stage (1978-1981) of a survey completed by Dutch sociologists 4 months after their graduation show that their job prospects have decreased. Between 1974 & 1979, unemployment decreased temporarily due to an extension of part-time employment. Differences between full-time & part-time employees are analyzed; information is given about the branches of the economy that employed them, job requirements, tasks, income, & job security. The unemployed are compared with regard to U of graduation, specialization, place of residence, age, sex, civil state, & job-seeking behavior. 4 Tables, 1 Figure. Modified HA

title: Rechtshulp in ontwikkeling
authors: Veen,Romke van der,   Beek,Ed van de,   Engbersen,Godfried
abstract: The development of legal aid in the Netherlands is described, in particular, the history of the two main organizations, the Citizens' Advice Bureaus & the Legal Advice Bureaus. Focus is on the development of demands for assistance, the causes of the explosive growth of these demands, the organization of assistance, professionalization, & the process of assistance. These issues are examined in relation to the development of the Dutch welfare state. 6 Tables. W. H. Stoddard

title: Onderwijsvernieuwing en de ontwikkeling van studie- en schoolbetrokkenheid. Resultaten van een longitudinaal onderzoek
abstract: How educational innovations have influenced pupils' commitment to school & studying is examined, using longitudinal data collected between 1979 & 1984 from 358 students attending either a traditional or an innovative type of secondary school in Belgium. Results of multiple classification & multiple regression analysis show that both types of commitment decrease with age. School commitment decreases much less among pupils at innovative schools, but there is no such difference for study commitment. Parental encouragement is much more influential on both attitudes in traditional than in innovative schools. Possible explanations for these findings are considered. 8 Tables, 1 Figure, 21 References. Modified HA

title: Randgroepvorming. Marginalisering en etnisering onder Marokkaanse jongeren
abstract: According to P. E. J. Buiks ("Aantekening: etnisch reveil onder Surinaamse jongeren in Nederland" [Notes. Ethnic Consciousness among Surinamese Youth in the Netherlands], Beleid en Maatschappij, 1983, 10, 5), different marginal groups form among Surinamese youth in the Netherlands because of structural rejection, which leads to a revival of ethnic consciousness. The degree to which this explanation also applies to Moroccan youth is examined. The process of marginalization for Moroccan youth in Amsterdam is described on the basis of three typical life histories. The results show, contrary to Buik's findings, that frustration & ethnicity are not the structural conditions for development of a marginal lifestyle among Moroccan youth, & that ingegrated rather than marginal boys are more likely to promote their ethnicity. The marginal lack the social skills, ideology, & symbols to express their ethnic consciousness. 20 References. Modified HA

title: Sociaal milieu en cultuurdeelname. Een nadere toetsing van Ganzebooms informatietheorie
abstract: According to H. B. G. Ganzeboom's theory (see SA 33:4/85O9772), differential participation in high cultural activities can be explained by individual differences in intelligence & cultural training. A structural model is presented, in which participation in high culture depends on age, urbanization, SES, education, occupation, & income; data from the Dutch Life Situation Surveys of 1977 & 1983 are used to test this model. Information theory is largely supported by the results, but some of the relationships are left unexplained. 5 Tables, 1 Figure, 1 Appendix, 13 References. Modified HA

title: Twee vergeten bijdragen van de sociografie
abstract: The long-standing tradition of empirical research in Dutch sociology, best exemplified by the Amsterdam school, has eclipsed certain other achievements in Dutch sociology, such as the two described here. S. Steinmetz recognized the crucial role of cross-cultural comparisons in the social sciences, & advocated the organization of cross-cultural findings into data matrices that would force negative cases to the attention of theorists (Gesammelte Kleinere Schriften zur Ethnologie und Soziologie. Band III [Collected Essays on Ethnology and Sociology. Vol. III], Groningen: Batavia, 1935). J. Krujit, following similar guidelines, tested the Marxist idea that capitalism generates socialist movements that work against religion (De onkerkelijkheid in Nederland. Haar verspreiding en oorzaken [Unecclesiasticality in the Netherlands. Spread and Causes], Amsterdam, 1933), & found that, in the Netherlands, the reverse was true: deconfessionalization was the original source of socialist movements. Krujit also noted that serious SC struggle began in the nineteenth century not in the centers of industry, but in the peripheral agrarian areas of the North. 23 References. Modified HA
tags: Dutch sociography, S. Steinmetz's/J. Krujit's cross-cultural comparisons

title: Interviewstijlen en interviewresultaten
abstract: Variations in interviewer style or behavior may affect the results of social scientific research. Such effects are examined through analysis of findings from a Dutch research project in which 6 interviewers adopted 3 distinct styles of interviewing: formal, empathic, & intimate. Formal styles tend to produce less full answers to questions; on the other hand, intimate styles bias Rs toward agreeing with the interviewer's sentiments. While some rapport is desirable, a certain degree of formality may be preferable to maximum rapport. 7 Tables. Modified HA

title: Analyse van besluitvormingsprocessen bij de overheid. Een toetsingsprocedure voor expertkennis in overheidsbeslissingen
abstract: In the near future, public administration will use computerized systems to aid decision making. Such expert systems incorporate human knowledge about the problem at hand. It is argued that the knowledge stored by administrators in computers should be justifiable in light of the policies followed; however, in many areas of public policy, this stored information is biased with prejudices & personal judgments. Analyzed are (1) the extent to which the decisions of public administrators reflect expert knowledge, & (2) the criteria that possibly influence these decisions, using questionnaire data obtained from Dutch school administrators (N = 28) on how they would allocate funds for textbook purchases. A model of the decision process is integrated with a method for statistical analysis (Woodcock, F., "The Evaluation of Yes/No Forecasts for Scientific and Administrative Purposes," Monthly Weather Review, 1976, 104, 1209-1214). Results show that the improper criterion of prestige unduly influences many decisions made by a local administrative agency. 2 Tables, 5 Figures, 16 References. Modified HA

title: Geschiedenis van de sociologie: een overzicht van thema's en literatuur
abstract: The past few decades have shown an undeniable increase of interest in the history of sociology, as evidenced by the numerous publications of systematic interpretations & reinterpretations of classical authors. Generally, these publications consist of (1) institutional studies & (2) reflexive studies on the presuppositions of sociology. The overall effect has been a lessening of the strict distinction between the systematics & history of sociology. 60 References. Modified HA

title: Beïnvloeding zonder zintuiglijk contact? Empirische toetsing met interventiemodellen
authors: Pol,F. J. R. van de,   Beer,J. A. A. de
abstract: Intervention models can describe how social phenomena might be affected when the outcome of an event is hypothetically altered. To illustrate this point, an experiment was devised to determine the possibility of extrasensory perception playing a role in the current events knowledge of Dutch adults. Analysis of questionnaire data (N = 400) using intervention models successfully allows for the influence of group meditation & prayer to be correlated with statistics on crime & traffic accidents. 12 Tables, 2 Appendixes, 26 References. Modified HA

title: Een schoolloopbaanmodel met IQ-variabelen voor zonen én vaders
authors: Leijten,J. L..,   Ultee,W. C.,   Vroon,P. A.
abstract: Omitting IQ variables from a path model for educational career may result in overestimation of environmental effects. To investigate this phenomenon, questionnaire data on fathers' occupational status, fathers' & sons' educational level, & fathers' & sons' IQ were obtained from Dutch military recruits & their fathers (N = 2,847). The results show that including the sons' IQ in a model for the educational career improves the model by avoiding the overestimation of environmental effects; however, adding the fathers' IQ to the model makes no difference. In Intelligentsie of leerprestatie? (Intelligence or Educational Achievement?), J. Dronkers & J. L. Peschar argue that more attention should be given to environmental influences, particularly within the school, since the quality of education can bring about some change in IQ between first grade & high school graduation. 2 Tables, 8 Figures, 1 Appendix, 14 References. Modified HA

title: Verschillende visies op versnippering? Repliek op J.A. van Rossums 'Over versnippering van sociaal-wetenschappelijk onderzoek in Nederland'
Over versnippering van sociaal-wetenschappelijk onderzoek in Nederland
abstract: A report on the study "Differentiatie in sociaal- en geesteswetenschappelijk onderzoek: een studie naar het denken over en het beleid ten aanzien van 'versnippering', met bijzondere aandacht voor de demografie, de taalwetenschap en de sociale en economische geschiedenis" ([Differentiation in Social Science and Humanities Research: A Study on the Thought on and Policy of 'Fragmentation', with Special Attention Given to Demography, Linguistics, and Social and Economic History], The Hague: Netherlands State Publishing House, 1984). The study presents an approach for distinguishing & evaluating phenomena of differentiation in the social sciences & the humanities. Criticisms are made about the use of the "care of knowledge" concept as a tool for distinguishing between functional & dysfunctional differentiation. In Verschillende visies op versnippering?: Repliek op J. A. van Rossums 'Over versnippering van sociaalwetenschappelijk onderzoek in Nederland' (Different Visions of Fragmentation?: A Reply to J. A. van Rossum's 'On Fragmentation of Social Science Research in the Netherlands'), F. L. Leeuw & A. van Gageldonk offer a more positive evaluation of the original report. 4 References. Modified HA

title: Rectificatie: Actielogica's in processen van technologische innovatie, Mens en Maatschappij 60 (1985) nr. 1, schema's 3 en 4 op p.51
Sociaal kapitaal en bereikte beroepshoogte
abstract: The part played by social networks in the status attainment process is investigated. It is generally assumed that a person with more social capital (derived from his social network & the resources that can be mobilized through his direct contacts) will acquire better living conditions, including a job with higher social prestige. However, research in the Netherlands is described which indicates that making use of informal contacts does not in itself lead to jobs of higher prestige; rather, the contacts result from the job. Persons who have a best friend or father-in-law in a high level job, however, are more successful in getting a higher prestige job themselves; & contact persons with higher prestige jobs help one a little in moving up the social ladder. These findings are compared with the situation in the US & West Germany. 6 Tables, 1 Figure, 27 References. Modified HA

title: Culturele hulpbronnen en schoolloopbanen in het lager onderwijs
abstract: Past research on educational stratification has demonstrated the stability over time of the association between parents' educational & occupational characteristics & children's educational performance. It is argued that an explanation of this association can be found in unequal disposal over cultural resources. An empirical analysis is presented, in which the effect of social background on the development of children's (N = 304) ability in primary schools is intermediated by three indicators of cultural resources: pedagogical family climate, parental status group participation, & parental educational expectations. The results show that most of the association can be explained by these factors. 2 Tables, 6 Figures, 35 References. Modified HA

title: Het gebruik van positieve en negatieve items en de fit in een LISREL-model
abstract: Researchers frequently include both positively & negatively formulated items in a battery of questions (eg, items constituting a Likert-type scale, or a series of semantic differentials), on the assumption that this will keep Rs alert. The effect of such assumptions is examined in a LISREL analysis. An example with real data shows that this type of trivial assumption can turn the scale in favor of a theoretical model that is subjected to a test, in the sense that the model would be rejected without those assumptions. 4 Tables, 1 Figure. Modified HA

title: We zijn veroordeeld altoos te blijven twisten. Een vergelijking van Max Weber en René Girard
abstract: Max Weber's sociological conception of ewiger Kampf (eternal struggle) -- ie, the idea of conflict as an inevitable condition of man -- is examined. Its legitimation in Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft ([Economy and Society], Tubingen, 1972) is considered unsatisfactory. Weber's approach is compared with an alternative conception by Rene Girard (Mensonge romantique et verite romanesque [Romantic Lies and Romanesque Truth], Pluriel, 1968; La violence at le sacre [Violence and the Sacred], Paris, 1972; & Des choses cachees depuis la fondation du monde [Things That Have Been Hidden since the Foundation of the World], Paris, 1978). Girard criticizes Weber for thinking too romantically about man. This is why Weber's arguments about the inevitability of strife fail to convince. 4 References. Modified HA
tags: "ewiger Kampf" (eternal struggle) concept, Max Weber's vs Rene Girard's approach

title: 'Excellente' partijen: een theoretische en empirische exploratie
abstract: The effectiveness of political parties, conceptualized as goal-directed social systems, is analyzed from the theoretical perspective of the sociology of organizations, particularly the contingency model for the assessment of organizational effectiveness. The instrumental goals of seeking electoral success & political power are examined, & several hypotheses based on Kenneth Janda's comparative data (Political Parties, A Cross-National Survey, New York: Free Press, 1980) are tested. The usefulness of the theoretical approach for a comparative study of political parties is discussed. 2 Tables, 4 Figures, 1 Appendix, 55 References. Modified HA
tags: political parties' effectiveness, organizational sociology perspective

title: Max Webers militair-sociologische analyse van het Oude Testament
abstract: Max Weber's study of the military-sociological aspects of ancient Judaism (Gesammelte Aufsatze zur Religionssoziologie, [Selected Essays on the Sociology of Religion: Ancient Judaism], Tubingen, 1963 [1917-1919]) is summarized. Weber shows how a process of demilitarization stimulated by an increasing expense of weapon technology occurred in old Israelite society. Concurrent with the centralization of administration & military power under the kingdom of Israel, a growing part of the population was demilitarized & socially declasse. Weber argued that the religion of Jahwism was connected with these groups in a situation of powerlessness. His interpretation of this religion was developed in a critical dialogue with Karl Marx & Friedrich Nietzsche. 43 References. Modified HA
tags: ancient Judaism, military-sociological aspects, Max Weber's thought

title: Arbeidsmigratie en strategische verwantschap in Andalusië
abstract: The impact of agricultural transformation, labor migration, & tourism on Andalusian Ru social structure & life conditions is discussed, focusing on the village of Arriate. Traditional institutions of protection, eg, patronage & corporate family ties, are reconsidered against the background of changing economic conditions. It is shown that, in a setting of geographical mobility & occupational multiplicity, the strategies of the worker-peasants are based on the resources of their own labor, horizontal bonds of cooperation with fellow laborers in the village, & affinal sets dominated by brothers-in-law. 11 References. Modified HA

title: Onbegonnen werk. De Nederlandse sociologie en haar planmatigheidsidealen: de droom van macht en maakbaarheid
abstract: The social sciences have too often attempted to imitate the natural sciences, seeking public recognition both of the scientific character of their procedures & of the professional competence of interventions based on them. Social planning as a concept illustrates this imitation. The history of this concept in Dutch sociology is traced from the 1920s to the present, focusing on the different forms it has taken. Both technocratic social planning & piecemeal social engineering have by now been undermined. Modified HA

title: Economie en democratie in drie Zuideuropese landen
abstract: A major question in political sociology is why nations have attained varying levels of democracy. It has been argued that economic growth promotes democratization; eg, S. M. Lipset (Political Man: The Social Bases of Politics, expanded edition, Baltimore, 1981) asserts that the democratic breakthroughs in Greece, Portugal, & Spain during the 1970s resulted from economic growth. A description of the economic & political events that preceded these changes suggests that Lipset's view is poorly supported by the evidence. 66 References. Modified HA

title: Een model van het interactiesysteem van de schoolklas
abstract: It is well-known in educational research that aggregate ability scores affect individual achievements. This finding is explained by means of an abstract model of the interaction system of the class. This model fares well in comparison to rival explanations in the literature. By applying the abstract model to specific circumstances, new hypotheses about the effects of homogeneous grouping & declining discipline are derived. Known research results corroborate these hypotheses. 7 Figures, 17 References. HA

title: De rechtspsychologische benadering van rechterlijk beslissingsgedrag: enkele kanttekeningen bij recent Nederlands onderzoek
abstract: A review essay of J. ten Kate's & P. J. van Koppen's dissertation Determinanten van privaatrechterlijke beslissingen ([Determinants of Legal Decisions], Arnhem: Gouda Quint, 1984) on judicial decision-making behavior in the Netherlands. Judicial decision-making behavior cannot adequately be described as individual problem solving. Decisions are made within a social field of infinitely possible variations. An experiment wherein judges, law students, & laymen (N not provided) were asked to decide a number of cases led to such divergent results that ten Kate & van Koppen concluded that, although the psychology of law is a complement of the sociology of law, the traditional mode of research -- the psychological approach -- should be abandoned. Judicial decision making is a social phenomenon & should be treated & researched as such. 24 References. M. Barker

title: Succes als bedreiging. De paradoxale situatie van de sociologie
abstract: The present situation of sociology is analyzed in the manner that the secularization thesis deals with religion. The initial promise of scientific salvation -- shared by both the natural & the social sciences -- is reviewed. While the religious flavor of nineteenth-century science has vanished, the pretention that there is a surplus value in scientific rationality remains. The new situation can be seen as a result of a process of trivialization of sociological content, since the general public became sociologically educated, & no longer recognizes sociological viewpoints as the property of a distinct profession. This process coincides with the process of the politicization of science. Modified HA

title: Lodewijk XIV, plus conquérant que vainqueur. Een sociologische benadering van een historisch probleem
abstract: With the help of a fitting sociological optics viewpoint, W. I. Thomas's "definition of the situation" (Social Behavior and Personality, Contributions of W. I. Thomas to 'Theory and Research', Volker, E. H. [Ed], Westport, Conn, 1981), & historical literature, an attempt is made to clarify the reasons underlying Louis XIV's dawdling, & his resulting failure to take over the Netherlands in 1672. 1 Figure. M. Barker

title: Zelfwaardering van allochtone jongeren en het proces van 'reflected appraisal'
abstract: An examination of differences in general self-esteem between adolescents of ethnic minorities & Dutch adolescents. Attention is focused on the reflected appraisal process. For adolescents of ethnic minorities, there is a significant relation between general self-esteem & the perceived evaluation of family members, however, such a relation does not exist with nonfamily members. For Dutch adolescents, the results are the opposite; ie, self-esteem is affected by the perceived evaluation of nonfamily, rather than family members. These results suggest why adolescents of ethnic minorities do not have lower general self-esteem, despite low status, prejudice, & discrimination. 1 Table, 14 References. Modified HA

title: Werkloosheid en sociale isolatie: een heroriëntatie
abstract: Several theories on the social isolation of the unemployed are compared, in particular, theories of intentional social isolation, ie, that the unemployed avoid contact with others because of feelings of shame, loss of identity, financial loss, etc. As complement to the theory of social isolation of the unemployed, a theory of structural social isolation is proposed, in which social isolation is not due to avoiding interactions but to a lack of potential interaction partners. This latter theory seems better suited to explain the social isolation of the unemployed. 12 Tables, 5 Figures, 26 References. Modified HA

title: Jeugd en jeugdwerklozen in de publieke opinie
abstract: Ministerial statements that unemployed Dutch youth do not exert themselves to find jobs gave rise to research into PO on that issue. The ministerial opinion was supported by only a minority of the Dutch population. The results lead to the conclusion that this opinion has to do less with unemployment than with a negative view of youth in general. It is noted that this negative view is also taken by young people themselves. 3 Tables, 2 Figures. Modified HA
tags: unemployed youth, Netherlands, ministerial vs public opinion

title: Determinanten van aanzien
abstract: One of the well-established facts of social stratification research is a strong correlation between occupational prestige, on the one hand, & education & income, on the other. More recently, research has been done on the relation between occupational prestige & gender. In most cases, the effects of education, income, & gender on occupational prestige are taken for granted. Here, however, a research design manipulating income, education, & gender has been used with 2 random samples in the Netherlands (total N = 100). Both groups were asked to rate 30 occupations according to their place on the social ladder & were given additional information on the education required for each occupation, expected income, & gender of its practitioners. The results show an important effect for income, a statistically significant contribution of education, & no contribution of gender. 4 Tables, 1 Figure, 18 References. Modified HA

title: Het verband tussen onderwijs en beroepshoogte voor vrouwen en mannen in Nederland in 1979
abstract: Analysis of data from the Dutch 1979 Labor Force Survey reveals gender differences in the effects of educational attainment on occupational attainment in the Netherlands: ie, Fs have smaller returns from education than do Ms. These differences persist when work-experience is held constant & when marital status & presence of children are specified. Within occupational groups, no substantial association is found between the % of Fs in an occupational group &: (1) occupational level of Ms; (2) differences in the occupational level of Ms & Fs; or (3) effect of educational attainment on occupational level. 4 Tables, 18 References. Modified HA

title: Interpretatie van effecten in het logit-model. Een bespreking van de 'Ecta'-parametrisering
abstract: In the social sciences the logit model is a powerful tool for analysis of multivariate contingency tables; however, the interpretation of effects in this model is intricate. Discussed here are the interpretation possibilities of effects derived by the deviation contrasts parameterization, as in the Ecta computer program. A five-step method is proposed, including the construction of a condition situation table to facilitate interpretation. The interpretation of logit effects is illustrated by a four-way f table. 5 Tables, 6 References. Modified HA
tags: logit analysis, multivariate contingency tables, effect interpretation methodology

title: Voor en na de mammoet. Vergelijking van individuele schoolloopbanen in het voortgezet onderwijs in Noord-Brabant voor en na de invoering van de Mammoetwet
abstract: Examined here are possibilities of changing the balance between ascription & achievement in educational attainment through educational reform. The educational attainment processes of 2 groups of pupils in the Netherlands are compared: a cohort born around 1940 (N = 2,702), the other around 1965 (N 1,254). It is found that sex & Ur/Ru differences in attendance at secondary schools have disappeared, & social background effects have decreased. Educational achievement has a stronger effect on further educational attainment for the later cohort, which underlines a trend toward achievement during the last decade. 7 Tables, 1 Figure, 1 Appendix, 18 References. Modified HA

title: Zijn er veranderingen in het verband tussen onderwijs en beroepshoogte voor vrouwen en mannen in Nederland tussen 1960 en 1979?
abstract: Continuation of an investigation of gender differences in the effects of education on occupational level. The first part (see SA 35:3/87R5999) found that returns to education in terms of occupational prestige were smaller for women than for men in 1979, even when work experience, marital status, & presence of children variables were specified. For 1960, this was also the case, except for higher educated Fs. Comparison of data for 1960 & 1979 shows that returns to education were smaller in 1979 than in 1960, & that gender differences had increased over time. The different selection of Fs in the labor market in 1969 & 1979 is discussed as an important explanation for the findings. 6 Tables, 32 References. Modified HA

title: Links/rechts, postmaterialisme en stemgedrag
abstract: An empirical evaluation of the hypothesis that (post)materialist orientations influence voting behavior independently of other relevant variables. It is demonstrated that, in the Netherlands, the causal effect of postmaterialism is exceedingly weak. In addition, postmaterialism is shown to be dependent on ideological Left/Right orientations rather than being an independent & rivaling influence on political choice. Also, it appears to be linked differently to social position than most theories postulate. 1 Table, 3 Figures, 32 References. Modified HA

title: Produktiebeheersing: naar een taxonomie van structuren en processen
abstract: A report on the construction of a taxonomy of structures & processes of production control used in work organizations, primarily based on a political perspective of organizations. Production control is the sum of social structures & processes that contribute to the continuity of the production process. The taxonomy is generated by placing the processes -- imposition of production demands, resource allocation, conflict management, & socialization -- on the y-axis of a matrix. The x-axis consists of central regulation of the production process (subdivided into strong automation, strong mechanization, strong regulation, & direct supervision), control of the production output (subdivided into semiautonomous groups, matrix & project structures), & correction after complaints during delivery (subdivided into craft, professional, & collectivist structures). 55 References. Modified HA
tags: production control, work organizations, structures/processes taxonomy

title: De veranderde legitimaties van het Nederlandse ziekenhuisbouwbeleid 1945-1985
abstract: The Dutch political system traditionally has preferred private nonprofit organizations for the implementation of welfare policies. Here, the measures taken & the arguments put forward to justify the constantly increasing government interference in these organizations during 1945-1985 are examined. From 1945 to 1963, reference was made to the exceptional circumstances caused by WWII & postwar reconstruction. Post-1963, the way interventions were prepared provided their justification, which resulted in an unbalanced & unprecedented growth between 1963 & 1973; the too costly output provided grounds for intervention after 1973. This output-oriented legitimation was then replaced in 1981 by reference to external circumstances: the economic crisis & the need to cut back expenditures. None of these arguments deals with health care needs: the arguments put forward to justify a policy are not explanations of that policy. 9 Tables, 17 References. Modified HA
tags: private nonprofit organization welfare policy implementation, post-WWII Netherlands, government interference justification

title: Peiling van publieksvoorkeuren over energiebeleid. Een keuze-enquête met voorafgaande informatiebeoordeling
abstract: In the Netherlands, a proposal to build additional nuclear power plants in the 1970s met with much public protest. In response, a "Societal Discussion on Future (Nuclear) Energy Policy" was organized in 1981 that attempted to systematically inform the public & assess their preferences regarding various possible energy sources. One assessment procedure, the Choice Questionnaire, is critically examined from a decision-theoretic perspective. Although it represents a respectable attempt to improve traditional PO polling procedures, it fails to meet essential decision-theoretic requirements. Results obtained on 1,300 Rs appear to correspond roughly to preference statistics obtained with less demanding assessment procedures. 4 Tables, 10 References. Modified HA

title: Sociaal-emotionele ondersteuning, een vergelijking van twee meetinstrumenten
abstract: A comparison of the summation of support received from individual relationships & global support from the individual's support network as a whole, as measurements of mental & physical well-being. An interview survey of 419 adults (aged 20+) in Purmerend & Haarlemmermeer, the Netherlands, used both measurements. A comparison of the two instruments demonstrated that global assessment corresponds to a greater degree with a summation derived from eight relationships than with one derived from seven or fewer. However, the r was too small to allow the conclusion that both instruments measure the same. Some deviations appeared in the results of global assessment that were closely tied to evaluative factors. This indicates that global assessment of support can lead to confusing social support with loneliness. 1 Appendix, 25 References. Modified HA

title: Over het verzamelen van (houdbare) kennis. Kanttekeningen over de pretentie van de sociale wetenschappen aan de hand van vier boeken over 'Migratie van Minderheden'
Artsen, verplegenden en patiënten in triadisch perspectief
abstract: An examination of how social relationships between & within teams of MDs & nurses influence the person-orientedness of their relationships with hospital patients. Interview data from 142 MDs & nurses & 295 patients in 2 hospitals in the Ranstad area of the Netherlands reveal the existence of a general triadic mechanism -- problem shifting -- whereby problems in cooperation & group atmosphere translate into negative attitudes toward patients, who, in turn, report more problems during their stay in the hospital. 3 Tables, 29 References. Modified HA

title: Het verband tussen opleiding en beroepshoogte voor mannen en vrouwen in 1977 en 1979
Vrienden en vriendinnen. Anders dan andere persoonlijke relaties?
abstract: An examination of whether a theoretically based conceptualization of friends is in accord with what individuals report about their friends. Interview data from Dutch adults aged 30-40 & 65-75 (totalN = 63) reveal that characteristics generally assigned to friends also apply to other types of personal relationships, eg, romantic partners & relatives. Thus, there appears to be a distinction between the concept of "friend," which is a category label, & the concept of "friendship," which applies to the equality of a relationship. Caution is suggested in the use of the label attached to a relationship as the sole indicator of the particular quality of that relationship. 2 Tables, 15 References. Modified HA

title: De sociologie van Margaret Archer
abstract: An examination of the sociology of Margaret Archer, who has been president of the International Sociological Assoc since Aug 1986. She advocates a neo-Weberian sociology, favoring a historical-comparative approach that combines a structure & an actor/action view in a unique way using concepts from Peter Blau's exchange theory (see SA 13:2/65B4829) & applying them to social interest groups. Using complex systems as the unit of analysis, she uses a morphogenetic analytical cycle, following Walter Buckley's systems theory (see SA 16:1/68C8842). Such an approach appears very useful for the study of structure & changes within complex institutions. 33 References. Modified HA
tags: neo-Weberian sociology, historical-comparative approach, Margaret Archer's work

title: Computergestuurde gegevensverzameling
abstract: A description of the ways that computers can enhance the possibilities for data collection & lead to increased efficiency in the data processing stage. New developments have made it possible for computers to generate almost automatic data & questionnaire documentation. Some ways to take maximal advantage of the more complex questionnaire designs that are possible in a computer-assisted environment are suggested. 1 Table, 1 Figure, 32 References. Modified HA

title: Beloningsverschillen tussen vrouwen en mannen in een universitaire organisatie
abstract: The income levels of M & F faculty members in the Netherlands are examined, based on longitudinal data (total N = 726 Ss) & personnel administration data (N = 697 F & 1,273 M faculty members) collected at the Rijks U of Utrecht (the Netherlands). Results show that wage differences between Ms & Fs cannot be completely explained by human capital characteristics. These differences are not caused by wage discrimination in a direct sense, but by the lower access of Fs to the higher-paying ranks, even when their formal qualifications are equal to those of their M colleagues. 9 Tables, 17 References. Modified HA

title: Kunstmatige intelligentie in organisaties. Een simulatiemodel van organisatorische besluitvorming
abstract: Much attention has been paid to the metaphor of garbage-can decision making (Cohen, Michael D., March, James G., & Olsen, Johan P., "A Garbage Can Model of Organizational Choice," Administrative Science Quarterly, 1972, 17, 1-25). A new design of the simulation model, on which the concept was originally based, is developed & exercised, with special emphasis on organizational structure & complex forms of interaction between decisionmakers. The garbage-can mechanism cannot describe decision making in organized structures; it is, however, a fairly general conceptualization of decision making beyond structure. Tests of the new model indicate that decision making in an organized structure behaves like decision making in an organized anarchy, but for partially different reasons. 2 Tables, 6 Figures, 33 References. HA
tags: garbage-can decision making, organizational choice simulation model tested

title: Intergenerationele klassenmobiliteit in Nederland tussen 1970 en 1985
authors: Ganzeboom,H.,   Luijkx,R.,   Dessens,J.,   Graaf,P. de,   Graaf,N. D. de
abstract: Research on occupational mobility usually concentrates on SC & sectoral divisions of society. In the Netherlands, however, mobility tables have been cast in a prestige format. This practice has largely withheld Dutch data from international comparative work. To redress this situation, SC mobility tables based on 10 national Central Bureau of Statistics surveys for the period 1970-1985, referring to Ms aged 21-64, are analyzed, using the SC scheme introduced by R. Erikson, J. H. Goldthorpe, & L. Portocarero (see SA 28:3/80K7643). Comparison of the tables shows a persistent tendency of increase of both absolute & relative mobility. This agrees with the conclusions of earlier research on the development of prestige mobility in the Netherlands between the 1950s & the 1970s. 6 Tables, 42 References. Modified HA

title: Groepseffecten op individuele leerprestaties. Een vergelijking van drie modellen voor multi-level analyse
abstract: A central question of the social sciences is the degree to which individual behavior -- achievement -- is a product of interaction between individual & structural factors. Theoretical aspects of this question are explored, & three multilevel models are compared through secondary analysis of longitudinal data from 364 pupils in 24 school classes: a covariance model, a contextual model, & an endogenous feedback model. Evidence is found for substantial effects of social interaction with classmates on individual achievement. The endogenous feedback model is evaluated as a powerful tool for analysis of contextual effects on individual achievement. 4 Tables, 2 Figures, 42 References. Modified HA

title: De ontwikkeling van de sterfte in Nederland en België
abstract: Since 1950, mortality trends in the Netherlands & Belgium have been very similar: F life expectancy increased sharply, & M life expectancy first declined & then rose slightly. In this period, mortality rates at young ages declined consistently; at middle & old ages they first increased & then dropped abruptly. In both countries there are still large regional, SE, & ethnic differences. In the near future, it is expected that life expectancy will continue to rise, with significant effects on family structure. 2 Tables, 3 Figures, 53 References. Modified HA

title: In Memoriam F. van Heek
authors: Gevers,J. K. M.,   Gadourek,I.,   Ultee,W. C.
abstract: A tribute to the late F. van Heek reviews his life & the importance of his work for contemporary sociologists. In Herinnering (Memories), J. K. M. Gevers reflects on his personal memories of the later life of van Heek. In Van Heek als Socioloog (Van Heek as Sociologist), I. Gadourek discusses the professional career of van Heek, from student to renowned sociologist. In De kansen, risico's en resultaten van een onderzoeksprogramma: Van Heeks meerledige vraagstelling over mobiliteit (Chances, Risks, and Results of a Research Program: Van Heek's Plural Problematics on Mobility), W. C. Ultee examines van Heek's theories on mobility & stratification. 1 Photograph, 11 References. M. Barker

title: Kritische bijdragen
abstract: A critique & comment on H. de Vos's "Een model van het interactiesysteem van de schoolklas" ([A Model of the Interaction System of the School Class] see SA 35:4/87R6129). In "Een alternatief model van het interactiesysteem van de schoolklas" (An Alternative Model of the Interaction System of the School Class), Jeroen Winkels (Sociologisch Instit, Rijks U, Groningen, the Netherlands) criticizes de Vos's lack of specification of the utility functions used to construct the graphic model; he considers this a serious omission in theory formation. In Commentaar op De Vos' model van het interactiesysteem van de schoolklas (Comments on de Vos's Model of the Interaction System of the School Class), Matthijs Kalmijn (Rijks U, Utrecht, the Netherlands) claims that de Vos's application of the model does not justify its findings, because individual achievements are influenced by more variables than indicated in the model. In Repliek aan Winkels en Kalmijn (Reply to Winkels and Kalmijn), H. de Vos (Sociologisch Instit, Rijks U, Groningen, the Netherlands) rebuts Winkels's critique, but accepts Kalmijn's critique as valid. 4 Figures, 4 References. M. Barker

title: De culturele en de economische dimensie van beroepsstatus
abstract: Research on social stratification largely assumes that occupational status is the most important indicator of social position, an assumption often not borne out by empirical data on lifestyles & life chances. The effects of occupational status indicators persistently tend to diminish or vanish once such factors as age, education, & income are controlled for. Proposed here is a new quantification of occupational position, based on Pierre Bourdieu's (Distinction: A Social Critique of the Judgement of Taste, London: Routledge & Kegan Paul, 1984 [see IRPS No. 30/85c00542]) hypothesis that SS can be partitioned in Western societies into cultural & economic dimensions. Measures are proposed for these two dimensions & are applied to the effects of occupation on a number of dependent variables. Results show several cases where cultural & economic dimensions of occupational status have divergent effects. 2 Tables, 1 Figure, 35 References. Modified HA
tags: occupational status, economic/cultural dimensions, measures proposed

title: Nederland het statistisch Jutland van Europa?
De institutionele kernenergielobby. Een netwerkanalyse van de kernenergiesector
abstract: An analysis of the network of advisory boards on Dutch nuclear energy policy. Until the mid-1970s, these were primarily composed of directors from industrial organizations or electricity companies engaged in nuclear activities. However, with growing public concern about nuclear risks, representatives of the antinuclear movement began to assume board positions & replace these industrial representatives. The Ministry of Economic Affairs gained a dominant position in nuclear energy policy making during the severe economic recession of the 1980s, & rejected all policy advice not supportive of its own pronuclear energy position. It is concluded that the democratic structure of these advisory councils has become irrelevant & that the antinuclear energy movement has been outplayed. 4 Tables, 3 Figures, 18 References. Modified HA
tags: nuclear energy policy, advisory boards' network, Netherlands

title: Een wet van niks? Een empirisch onderzoek naar de relatie tussen sekse en beroepsprestige
Evert Willem Hofstee. Westeremden, 15-10-1909 - Wageningen, 11-12-1987. Beknopt levensoverzicht en evaluatie
Ontloken talent. Studenten aan de Universiteit van Amsterdam: de sociale samenstelling (sociale herkomst en sekse) 1965-1985
abstract: The % of students from Wc origins at the U of Amsterdam is relatively low, & did not change during the period 1965-1985. The % of F students, however, has increased, except for those from families of middle-level employees. Social origin & sex influence direction of study, previous education, & age at start of U study. 6 Tables. Modified HA
tags: student sexual/social composition, University of Amsterdam, Netherlands

title: Naar een opleving van de economische sociologie? Recente literatuur over de problematische relatie tussen economie en sociologie
'Alle de aanzienlijken in de regeering'? De maatschappelijke herkomst van Nederlandse ministers (1848-1986)
abstract: Traditionally, public administrative posts in the Netherlands were the privilege of prominent families; in modern times, education has become the prime prerequisite. Analysis of data on the social background & educational level of all Dutch ministers, 1848-1986 (N = 423) reveals that in the nineteenth century, a high social milieu & a high level of education were the norm, though 25% of ministers reached their high office without any formal education whatsoever, via social connections. In the twentieth century, however, 50% of the ministers have been of Mc background, & nearly all have received postsecondary training (primarily academic). The few ministers from the Lc have reached their posts through new channels: unions or political parties. 6 Tables, 10 References. Modified HA

title: Vrouwen aan universiteiten. Een toets van Kanter's tokentheorie
abstract: Rosabeth Moss Kanter's token theory (Men and Women in the Corporation, New York: Basic Books, 1977) is tested via a comparison of the opportunities available for promotion to M & F faculty at Us with more or less than 15% F academics. Analysis of data on 17,840 faculty corroborates the theory. 8 Tables, 29 References. Modified HA
tags: female academics, promotion opportunities, Rosabeth Moss Kanter's token theory tested

title: Keuze-enquête met informatiebeoordeling. Een weerwoord aan Neijens, De Ridder en Saris
abstract: The defense of the scientific qualities of P. C. Neijens's choice questionnaire (The Choice Questionnaire: Design and Evaluation of an Instrument for Collecting Informed Opinions of a Population, Amsterdam: Free U Press, 1987) by P. Neijens, J. A. de Ridder, & W. E. Saris (see SA 36:3/88T5381) is challenged. It is argued that faulty arguments & neglect of relevant facts have overshadowed this positive appraisal. Further experimentation is recommended to clarify several issues & test the validity of crucial assumptions. 3 References. Modified HA

title: Het wetenschappelijk hergebruik van CBS-gegevens; een tussenstand
Openbare en bijzondere lagere scholen vergeleken op de taalvaardigheid van hun zesdeklassers
abstract: Secondary analysis of data from a 1984/85 study involving 107 primary schoolchildren in the Netherlands (Wesdorp, H., et al De haalbaarheid van periodiek peilingsonderzoek. Een voorstudie op het gebeid van het taalonderwijs in de lagere school [The Feasibility of Periodic Appraisal. A Pilot Study of Primary School Language Education], Lisse: Swets & Zeitlinger, 1986) reveals a relationship between denomination & average language ability scores: private school students tend to score higher than do those from public schools. Hypotheses that this difference can be explained by pupil SES or by the educational effectiveness of the schools are not supported by the data. In addition to denomination, 4 factors explain up to 65% of the between-schools variance in language ability: % of migrant students, % of Wc students, % of pupils with delayed school success, & teachers' age & experience. 3 Tables, 1 Figure, 30 References. Modified HA

title: Aanzetten tot een contextuele theorie van het interview
abstract: At present, the social sciences have only fragmented empirical research describing the survey interview, & lack a full-grown theory on this subject. Role & behavior theories have been advanced, but are criticized for being too normative, narrow, & atomistic. A contextual approach is suggested in which attention is placed on the actual conversation occurring in the survey interview & how it is influenced by the social situation of the R, the surrounding society & culture, & the created structure of the interview situation. A model describing this relationship is developed, & suggestions for further research are offered. In Uitwerking en beoordeling van een contextuele theorie van het interview (Elaboration and Evaluation of a Contextual Theory of the Interview), J. van der Zouwen (Vrije U, Amsterdam, the Netherlands) translates these theoretical notions into a set of equations that represent the main variables of this model, then compares it to other attempts to model the cognitive & interactional processes that characterize interviews. It is concluded that the model as a whole is untestable; however, parts of it, or rather, predictions derived from it, can be tested using data from research on interviewing. Thus, while the theory is evaluated positively, its transformation into an empirically tenable model requires additional research. 1 Figure, 38 References. Modified HA

title: Uitwerking en beoordeling van een contextuele theorie van het interview
Maatschappelijke posities van vrouwen en hun emancipatiegezindheid
authors: Voert,M. ter,   Snippenberg,L B. van,   Janssen,J.
abstract: Differences in women's attitudes toward women's liberation are examined using data from a survey of 986 women in the Netherlands. Multiple regression analysis indicates that several background factors, including religious involvement, political preference, age, education, employment, & SES, are related to attitudes toward emancipation, while no effects are found for maternal status or cohabitation. 2 Tables, 1 Appendix, 23 References. Modified HA

title: De verbieden versus niet toelaten asymmetrie. Een stabiel formuleringseffect in survey-onderzoek?
abstract: Previous research from the US & Federal Republic of Germany has suggested that when faced with apparently logically equivalent survey questions concerning whether authorities should forbid or allow something, Rs are more willing to endorse negative statements (not allow/forbid) than positive ones (allow/forbid). Data collected during replications of this research through interviews with a random sample of housewives in Flanders, the Netherlands (N = approximately 300), support the hypothesis that this effect is due to the behavior of indifferent Rs. An extension of the effect to other equivalent pairs is discussed. 7 Tables, 1 Appendix, 16 References. Modified HA

title: Eenouder- en tweeoudergezinnen en schoolloopbanen
abstract: Data from a 1977 national survey of Dutch secondary school students are used to investigate the relationship between growing up in a one-parent family & the school careers of children, with emphasis on F-headed families. Children living in F-headed families were individually matched by sex, age, family size, & SES with children living in two-parent families. Results show a negative effect of the one-parent family on the level of academic achievement. Sex of the child has no effect on this relationship, but children of divorced parents are more at risk than children of widows. Three possible explanations will be compared in further research: income position, labeling & stigma, & parent-child interaction. 7 Tables, 36 References. Modified HA

title: Vestiging van vrouwelijke huisartsen. Een theoretisch model ter verklaring van verschillen in zelfstandige vestiging tussen vrouwen en mannen
authors: Kortenhoeven,D.,   Doorne-Huiskes,A. van,   Groenewegen,P. P.,   Maas,I.
abstract: Several theories of the lesser professional participation of F general practitioners are compared: role theory, rational choice theory, & the labor market theory of statistical discrimination. On the basis of this examination a theoretical model is proposed, which comprises two stages: an explanation of why F general practitioners usually choose to work in less independent forms of practice than men do, & an explanation of why men & women have different levels of success in realizing the kinds of practice they seek. 3 Tables, 16 References. Modified HA
tags: professional participation, female vs male general practitioners

title: Informatiepresentatie in een enquête
authors: Neijens,Peter,   Ridder,Jan A. de,   Saris,Willem E.
abstract: A response is offered to Charles Vlek's critique (see SA 36:2/88T3969) of the Choice Questionnaire developed by Peter Neijens, Jan A. de Ridder, & Willem E. Saris (Keuze-enquete [Choice Questionnaire], Amsterdam: Vrije U, 1983). Vlek argued that the questionnaire has essential deficiencies & that evaluation research failed to answer essential questions about it. These criticisms are based on faulty arguments. Empirical evidence for this claim is presented, & Vlek's proposed alternative to the Choice Questionnaire is critically evaluated. 4 Tables, 11 References. Modified HA

title: Ras en geslacht bij de personeelsselectie
abstract: Theoretical explanations for racial & sexual discrimination in labor markets tend to be divided between those that are based on prejudice & those based on economic rationality. After describing a research method designed to explore the relative importance of different selection criteria for various groups of employers, several hypotheses concerning the importance of sex & race as selection criteria for clerical & sales jobs in the Netherlands are tested. Results indicate that shopkeepers reject persons of color for jobs in which customer contact is important. Public trust organizations & professional personnel officers, on the other hand, demonstrate the least overt discrimination. 2 Tables, 30 References. Modified HA

title: De etnische hiërarchie als sociale representatie van een multi-etnische samenleving
abstract: Research on social distance in the Netherlands is put into the context of theory on social representations, & two aspects of social distance are distinguished: the amount of social distance between the majority & ethnic minorities, & an ethnic hierarchy of minorities in terms of between-group social distance. The meaning of the ethnic hierarchy as a consequence of a social representation of multiethnic Dutch society is explored using data from 1984 & 1986 pilot studies involving high school & U students (N = 595). 3 Tables, 1 Figure, 38 References. Modified HA

title: Onderwijs over de grenzen? Een vergelijkende analyse naar de veranderende rol van onderwijs in de sociale reproduktie in Nederland en Polen
abstract: One of the functions of education is to transmit social reproduction from one generation to the next. Research that compares systems with & without explicit educational reforms designed to reduce social inequality has often concluded that the link between education & occupation is stronger in socialist countries than in Western ones, & thus, the reproduction chain has been effectively influenced by these reforms. It is argued that such research often lacks a temporal dimension or relates only to postrevolution cohorts; thus, no conclusion can be drawn about the consequences of social reforms & the transition to socialism. An attempt is made to clear up this issue via a cohort analysis of household survey data obtained from 7,815 persons in the Netherlands & Poland. Results of multiple regression & loglinear analyses are discussed. 5 Tables, 2 Figures, 22 References. Modified HA

title: Sociale stratificatie en maatschappelijke orientaties
abstract: An investigation of the relationship between social stratification & values. Lower SCs have been characterized by a conformistic orientation, while the higher ones are said to value self-direction. The linear additive model that is basic to most analyses of SS & mobility effects is criticized, & some alternatives are suggested; tests of these alternatives show no significant improvement, however. It is concluded that a model more oriented to the individual can best demonstrate the effect of educational level & SS on personal values. 3 Tables, 3 Figures, 23 References. Modified HA
tags: values, lower vs higher social classes

title: Opvoedingswaarden en statusgroepen. Trends tussen 1972 en 1986
abstract: An analysis of how the socialization values of parents in Groningen, the Netherlands, changed as a function of SES group between 1972 & 1986. Scores on M. L. Kohn's self-direction vs conformity scale (Class and Conformity: A Study in Values, Homewood, 1969) are compared for 1972 & 1986 samples of parents (N = 1,171 & 675, respectively) & reveal a slight shift toward children's self-direction being more valued than conformity.
