While these results match those of several US studies, they contradict some of the findings of the Dutch Bureau of Social & Cultural Planning for 1983-1986. Reanalysis of the data suggests that this trend toward valuing self-direction can be attributed to rising educational levels. When SES groups are compared separately, there is strong indication of a countertrend toward valuing conformity, though this result is only statistically significant in 50% of the 12 SES groups. 3 Tables, 11 References. Modified HA

title: De bijdrage van de groei in onderwijsdeelname aan de economische groei 1960-1980
abstract: An aggregate production function framework was used to examine possible effects of the educational level of the LF on economic output -- labor & capital (the two basic factors of production). Despite the application of several alternatives for educational levels, no evidence of effects of educational level was found. Several explanations of this result are discussed. In Commentaar op J. Dronkers, "De bijdrage van de groei in onderwijsdeelname aan de economische groei 1960-1980" (Comment on J. Dronkers's "Educational Expansion and Economic Output in the Netherlands 1960-1980"), J. M. M. Ritzen (Erasmus U, Rotterdam, the Netherlands) reiterates Dronkers's main hypotheses & basically agrees with his research, but contends that Dronkers was unnecessarily restrictive. 3 Tables, 20 References. M. Barker

title: De betekenis van links-rechts zelfplaatsing en haar effect op stemgedrag
abstract: Empirical data are used to show that leftist-rightist self-identifications in the Netherlands are strongly associated with both dimensions comprising ideological space: SE leftist-rightist & politico-cultural libertarianism/authoritarianism. Since these two dimensions are only slightly related to each other, leftist-rightist self-identification seems to lack unambiguous content validity. Using LISREL procedures in causal modeling, & taking leftist-rightist self-identification as determined by both ideological dimensions, it is shown that the former is only the best predictor of the vote if the parties are ordered along the leftist-rightist dimension; when they are ordered along the libertarian-authoritarian dimension, religion is the best predictor. Moreover, self-identification is itself more strongly determined by religion & by libertarianism-authoritarianism than by SC & SE leftist-rightist ideology. The relative minor importance of materialism-postmaterialism as a determinant of either the leftist-rightist or the libertarian-authoritarian vote is confirmed. 1 Table, 3 Figures, 13 References. Modified HA

title: Coalitietheorie en kabinetsformaties. Een empirische confrontatie van drie nieuwe voorspellingsprincipes met data van kabinetsformaties in vijf Westeuropese landen (1945-1988)
abstract: Two principles for the prediction of coalition formation in simple games are described, & a third principle is introduced. These three principles are applied to data regarding cabinet formations in five Western European countries occurring 1945-1988. Results show that center parties, as represented by game theoretic concepts of the center, play an important role in the formation of cabinets. 1 Table, 34 References. Modified HA

title: Een gevarieerd en uitgebreid relatienetwerk. Vroege determinanten van succesvolle 'coping' met scheiding
abstract: Interview data collected in 1985/86 from divorced men & women (N = 127) in Purmerend & Harlemmemeer, the Netherlands, are used to investigate the effects of the loss of the partner relationship & the loss of support from other relationships on loneliness. It is found that such loss increases loneliness, but that if nonkin relationships are among the strongest remaining supportive relationships, the chance of experiencing loneliness decreases. These results indicate that if marriage is disrupted when an individual has few supportive relationships outside the nuclear family, the chance of severe loneliness is high. It is therefore desirable from the point of view of prevention to stimulate the development & maintenance of a varied relationship network. 3 Tables, 29 References. Modified HA

title: Meting van onderzoeksprestaties van vakgroepen in de antropologie, bestuurskunde en psychologische functieleer. Een empirische benadering
abstract: The quality of scientific performance should be distinguished from scientific activity, productivity, & enlightenment. Here, questionnaire data from scientists (N = 70, 50% Dutch) on the quality of specific research projects are contrasted with bibliographic coverage of the projects. Findings indicate that, while the Social Sciences Citation Index gives reasonable to excellent coverage of core journals in internationally oriented disciplines, the coverage of a locally oriented discipline such as Dutch public administration is dismal. The integration of bibliometric indicators & peer review in evaluation processes of research performance is discussed. 6 Tables, 21 References. Modified HA

title: Sociale kerncijfers
abstract: A study of how Dutch citizens spend their time is presented based on data from the Central Bureau for Statistics (see Overzicht van de tijdbesteding in 1985 [Overview of Time Distribution in 1985], The Hague: State Publishing House, 1987). The distinction is made between necessary time (sleeping, eating, personal grooming), contractual time (professional & educational activity), & compromised time (devoted to child care, volunteerism, or other activities resulting from personal choices & commitments). Comparison with official data from 1962 reveals a decrease in the number of working hours among youth due to increased un- & underemployment. 1 Table, 1 Figure, 6 References. M. Meeks

title: Inter- en intragenerationele beroepsmobiliteit
abstract: It is argued that the overall association within the classical intergenerational occupational mobility table covers mobility processes occurring in very distinct time periods, so that differences between mobility tables sampled at different time points have no straightforward interpretation, & cannot be related to changes in the openness of a society in a specific period. An empirical analysis on a dataset with information on complete occupational careers & exact events of 427 Dutch men suggests an absence of societal changes in the Netherlands. 7 Tables, 2 Figures, 16 References. Modified HA
tags: intergenerational occupational mobility, Dutch men, data analysis issues

title: Komt het licht uit het Oosten?
Op expeditie door de onderwijsdelta (in het voetspoor van Ph.J. Idenburg)
De centrum-periferie theorie. Intra- versus internationale determinanten van inkomensongelijkheid
abstract: Economic development & political democracy have been the variables most frequently analyzed in attempting to explain differences in income inequalities between countries. Most have concluded that economic development is more important than political democracy in explaining these differences. It is shown, however, that the importance of this factor is strongly modified when the center-periphery position of countries is included in the analysis. 2 Tables, 2 Appendixes, 30 References. Modified HA
tags: international income inequalities, center-periphery position influence

title: Beroepsklasse en beroepsprestige als verklaring voor inkomen, ongelijkheidsopvattingen, politiek vertrouwen en politieke apathie
authors: Kraaykamp, G.,   Snippenburg,L. B. van,   Ultee,W. C.
abstract: An attempt is made to determine whether operationalizing occupation as occupational class or as occupational prestige has more predictive power on income, attitudes toward inequality, political confidence, & political apathy. Empirical analyses employing each operationalization are described, indicating that class as well as prestige have unique effects on income. For the other dependent variables, however, class is the more important predictor. 3 Tables, 4 Appendixes, 26 References. Modified HA

title: Verklaringen; theorieën en objectiviteit; enkele recente publikaties van buurmans erf
abstract: A review essay on books by: Dick Ruimschotel, Explanation, Causation and Psychological Theories ([dissertatie] U Amsterdam: z. uitg., 1987); A. Smaling, Methodologische objectiviteit en kwalitatief onderzoek ([Methodological Objectivity and Qualitative Research] Lissie: Swets en Zeitlinger, 1987); & H. A. P. Swart, Explanation in Psychology (Delft: Eburon, 1985 [see listings in IRPS No. 48]). Even though these recent works are mainly oriented toward psychology, they share certain problems & ideas in common with the behavioral & sociocultural sciences. Swart's work contains scientific-theoretic systematic essays on various means of explanation. Ruimschotel's work deals with two psychological explanation theories: the cognitive dissonant theory & a problem solution theory. Smaling coined the "Munchhausen-Objectivity" phrase & elaborates on the many ways the notion of objectivity can be interpreted. M. Barker

title: Inkomen en rechtvaardigheid. Beginselen, oordelen en hun encadrering
abstract: Using 1987 national interview survey data (N = 795) from the Netherlands, the relationship between principles of justice & judgments regarding the justice of the distribution of income is investigated from the perspectives of sociological & social-psychological theories of justice & of the psychology of choice. Analyses indicates that judgments regarding individual incomes & judgments regarding the overall income distribution are independently made, unless a specific framing of the situation to be judged takes place. 2 Tables, 2 Figures, 6 References. Modified HA

title: Economisch stemmen in Nederland
abstract: In an investigation of economic considerations in voting, several LISREL models are tested using longitudinal questionnaire survey data (N = 500 respondents [Rs]) collected in 1986 in the Netherlands via microcomputer terminals in Rs' homes linked to the National Instit of Public Opinion & Market Research's main computer. Results show that voters' evaluation of goverment policy effects on the national economic condition is a more important determinant of their vote than their evaluation of the effects of government policies on their own personal economic condition. Differential models for various social classes were found, but self-reliant individuals had similar voting determinants as compared to those who were "government reliants." The effect of party identification on voting is also discussed. It is concluded that 10-15% of the Dutch vote is determined by perceptions & evaluations of government policies & the national economy. 1 Table, 6 Figures, 28 References. Modified HA

title: Herintredingskansen van werkloze jongeren
abstract: A proportional hazard model to explain reemployment probabilities of unemployed Dutch youth is estimated using data from a 1984 national sample of unemployed youth, under age 27, who were reinterviewed in Nov 1986 to ascertain the efficiency of the Dutch government's policies regarding reemployment schemes, schooling & training programs, & income maintenance. Results show that unemployment benefits & expected earnings had no effect on unemployment duration, but that long-term unemployment was mainly due to lack of schooling, especially among youth who left school prematurely, & to unemployment duration itself. It is suggested that the labor policy should include employment schemes, & the educational policy should be directed at those who leave the system without a completion certificate. Income policy to lower unemployment benefit level is not effective in reducing unemployment. 3 Tables, 1 Appendix, 11 References. Modified HA

title: Sociologen vergeleken. Beschrijving en verklaring van arbeidsmarktposities
abstract: To determine whether an oversupply of Dutch sociologists explains their poor job opportunities, 1985-1987 graduates (N = 1,080) in the fields of sociology, economics, psychology, & law were surveyed. Eight possible explanations for weak job market positions among sociology graduates are tested against the data, but only two are supported: sociology courses are attended by a disproportionate number of students with unfavorable hiring chances; & the courses apply comparatively low standards of selectivity. 13 Tables, 1 Figure, 10 References. Modified HA

title: Inkomensbeleid in een representatieve democratie
abstract: An investigation of the relationship between citizen preferences in a representative democracy & the results of income policy. Using the hypothetical case in which elections only concern income redistribution, a model is examined where voters vote for the party whose program most nearly resembles their weighted preferences. Because policy may be considered a collective good, it is more realistic to assume that voters vote for the party whose ideology most closely resembles their personal ideology. In accordance with P. K. Keizer's Inflatie als Politiek-Economisch Verschijnsel ([Inflation as a Political-Economic Phenomenon] Leiden/Antwerp, 1982), it is hypothesized that the results of policy depend on the ideology of politicians & pressure groups. Official data on the Netherlands confirm the hypothesis. 1 Appendix, 45 References. Modified HA

title: Godsdienstsociologie en zingeving; empirisch onderzoek naar hedendaagse zingevingssystemen
authors: Hilhorst,Henri W. A.,   Hijmans,Ellen J. S.
abstract: Sociological research on meaning has generally focused on religion, historically & currently considered to be the primary source of meaning. Modern sociology of religion has developed new theoretical & methodological perspectives based on a functional definition of religion. Thomas Luckmann's The Invisible Religion: The Problem of Religion in Modern Society (London: Macmillan, 1967) generated research interest in human meaning & in meaning systems used by individuals to make sense of everyday life. A qualitative research strategy in the sociology of religion & meaning is advocated. 40 References. Modified HA

title: Theoretische concepten en alledaagse taal
abstract: Social scientists adhering to the method of facet design in forming concepts point to the fact that the facets must be objective, irrespective of the subject. However, when dealing with subjective experiences & feelings, another approach to the process of conceptualization is needed. Field exploration, eg, open interviews, can be used to elicit the perceptions of those directly involved & arrive at an exact meaning of concepts, but such methods are costly in terms of both time & effort. Here, a more structured method that can aid in conceptualization is explored. The potential of an interactive computer program -- Repertory Grid Techniques (REPGRID) -- is explored, & demonstrated via a series of experiments. 2 Tables, 32 References. Modified HA
tags: concept formation, facet design, methodological issues

title: Regionale aspecten van de arbeidsparticipatie in Nederland
abstract: Regional development of labor force participation in the Netherlands during 1975-1985 is analyzed, focusing on effects of demographic development & real participation changes. Regionally, the most urbanized parts of the country show higher participation levels & larger differences between specific age groups. However, convergence of regional participation levels is observed, due to two developments: a decreasing participation of older men & an increasing participation of younger women, leading to a feminization & rejuvenation of the labor force. 2 Tables, 5 Figures, 6 References. Modified HA
tags: labor force participation, regional development, Netherlands, 1975-1985

title: Prijs 1989 voor het beste wetenschappelijke artikel op het terrein van de sociologie en de antropologie
Het aanbod van zwarte arbeid door werkloze uitkeringsgerechtigden
abstract: Drawing on panel data from the Dutch Bureau of Employment, the determinants of "black" (informal) labor supply of benefits-receiving unemployed workers are examined. Analysis of results using an ordered logit model suggests that unemployment benefits have no effect on black labor supply; the duration of unemployment has only a small negative effect. Black labor supply is mainly determined by the same factors that determine labor supply in the formal labor market. 4 Tables, 11 References. Modified AA

title: Postmaterialisme en stemgedrag
abstract: It is argued that postmaterialism plays an important role in voting behavior in the Netherlands. Analysis of data from various Dutch Parliamentary Election Studies reveals that during the economic recession 1977-1986, socioeconomic Left-Right views more accurately predicted voting behavior than did sociocultural libertarian-authoritarian views. The scarcity hypothesis explains this finding, identifying a tendency toward materialistic voting as a consequence of economic decline. Further analyses reject the socialization hypothesis. 2 Tables, 1 Figure, 14 References. Modified AA

title: De niet geslaagde synthese van De Swaan; enkele kritische kanttekeningen bij De Swaans zorg en de Staat
abstract: It is argued that A. de Swaan's Zorg en de staat; welzijn, onderwijs en gezondheidszorg in Europa en de Vereinigde Staten in de nieuwe tijd ([Care and the State: Welfare, Education, and Health Care in Modern Europe and the United States] Amsterdam: Bert Bakker, 1989), in which he attempts to synthesize historical sociology with welfare economics, thereby avoiding an ecclectic approach, is only partially successful. 13 References. M. Meeks
tags: welfare economics, A. de Swaan's approach critiqued

title: Sociale kerncijfers
abstract: Analysis of mail questionnaire data (N = 116,000 citizens, ages 15-64) collected in 1989 by the Dutch Central Bureau of Statistics reveals a steady increase in the overall size of the working population between 1987 & 1989. About 81.1% of men were employed, & 52.0% of women. Unemployment decreased from 6.4% in 1988 to 5.7% in 1989, yet remained concentrated among the 16-24 age group. 4 Tables, 5 References. M. Meeks

title: De openheid van de Amsterdamse elite tijdens de industrialisatie: loglineaire analyse van carrieremobiliteit, intergenerationele mobiliteit en sociaal netwerk
abstract: The history of mobility research in the Netherlands is traced, & B. Vries's quantitative investigation of the social mobility of the Amsterdam elite in the second half of the nineteenth century (Electoraat en elite. Sociale structuur en sociale mobiliteit in Amsterdam 1850-1895 [The Electorate and the Elite. Social Structure and Social Mobility in Amsterdam 1850-1895], Amsterdam: De Bataafsche Leeuw, 1986) is outlined; her conclusion that the openness of the upper classes in Amsterdam increased during this period is contested. Vries's data are reexamined applying loglinear mobility models in which both tax & occupational data are analyzed across the variables of career & intergenerational mobility & social network. Occupation &/or tax as indicators of social position are discussed, & total & relative tax mobility are distinguished. Results show that total tax mobility increased as Vries reported, but relative tax mobility did not. Both total & relative occupational mobility measures indicate that the openness claimed by Vries did not take place. 10 Tables, 1 Appendix, 19 References. Z. Dubiel

title: Worden werklozen eerder gedagvaard?
abstract: A corpus of 1,001 criminal cases from the public prosecutor's office of the Netherlands was analyzed to determine whether judicial or extrajudicial factors were responsible for the overrepresentation of the unemployed in summonses as compared to dismissals & out-of-court fines, the other two alternatives available to the public prosecutor. Such overrepresentation in courts has been quantitatively demonstrated in several previous studies, which concluded that a selective judicial policy was applied by the public prosecutor's office discriminating against the unemployed. However, comparison of quantitative & % values for battering, property destruction, & theft does not show significant differences in the treatment of the two groups if the analysis takes into account the overall prevalence of cases involving the unemployed that come before the public prosecutor. The variables affecting the prosecutor's decision making with respect to fine vs summons are studied, & it is concluded that there is no biased treatment. High recidivism of unemployed defendants & frequent noncompliance with the transactional offer of paying a fine play an important part in their overrepresentation in court. 6 Tables, 11 References. Z. Dubiel

title: Achterstand van allochtonen in het onderwijs: sociaal milieu en migratie-achtergronden
abstract: Survey data are used to examine differences in the level of school achievement of ethnic minority children (N = 431 Turks, 441 Moroccans, 280 Surinamese, & 124 Antilleans) & their indigenous Dutch peers (N = 189) in the Netherlands. Logistic regression analysis indicates that the differences in educational level between ethnic minority & indigenous Dutch pupils are mainly determined by differences in socioeconomic & migration backgrounds. 5 Tables, 29 References. Modified AA

title: Cultuurdeelname en opleiding: een analyse van statusgroep-effecten met diagonale referentiemodellen
authors: Graaf,Nan Dirk de,   Ganzeboom,Harry B. G.
abstract: An investigation of the impact of an individual's education vs that of spouse's & parents' education, on culture consumption, using Michael E. Sobel's diagonal reference models (see SA 30:3/82M2954). Analysis of data from the Dutch 1977 Life Situation Survey shows that wives, irrespective of duration of marriage, are influenced by their husband's education almost as much as by their own. In the case of young husbands, the wife has a minor influence, but after many years of marriage, the wife's education becomes more important than the husband's. The influence of parents' education is conditional, depending on whether it is more or less extensive than that of the offspring. 7 Tables, 17 References. Modified AA

title: Bronnen van subjectieve belasting van moeders in gezinnen met een gehandicapt kind: de aandoening of het gezin?
authors: Joosten,J.,   Bruyn Ouboter-Kooij,E. de,   Drop,M. J.,   Philipsen,H.
abstract: To investigate stress & problems in families raising a handicapped child, interview & questionnaire data were obtained in Leiden, the Netherlands, from 22 families each in the following situation: (1) having a child with visible serious anatomical defects; (2) having a child with a serious heart defect not noticeable to a casual observer; & (3) having only normal children. The results show a division of family problems, ranging from intrafamily conflicts to struggles with the outside world. Among mothers, intrafamily conflicts are the biggest cause of distress. Associated factors may include the absence of the father due to work situation, low socioeconomic status, financial difficulties, & lack of religious conviction. 5 Tables, 38 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: De dimensies van sociometrische status
authors: Akkerman, W.,   Maassen. G. H.,   Linden,J. L. van der
abstract: U. Bronfenbrenner's two-dimensional model of sociometric status ("A Constant Frame of Reference for Sociometric Research. Part II: Experiment and Inference," Sociometry, 1944, 7, 40-75) has been in common use since 1979. It is contended here that sociometric status does in fact have two dimensions, but that Bronfenbrenner's dimensions -- sympathy & antipathy -- are in fact two poles of one dimension; the other is "visibility" or "impact" of the individual under observation. The low correlation value of the double-ended dimension is explained & found to be related to the asymmetry of the variables. 2 Tables, 1 Figure, 19 References. Modified AA

title: Kritische Bijdragen
abstract: In "Achievement" en "ascription": variaties op een thema ("Achievement" and "Ascription": Variations on a Theme), Frans Kerstholt comments on an article by Harry B. G. Ganzeboom et al ("Intergenerationale klassenmobiliteit in Nederland tussen 1970 en 1985" [Intergenerational Class Mobility in the Netherlands between 1970 and 1985] see SA 35:5/87R9822) & another by Ganzeboom & Paul M. de Graaf, "Intergenerationale opleidingsmobiliteit in Nederland van geboortecohorten 1891-1960" [Intergenerational Educational Mobility in the Netherlands of the Cohorts 1891-1960], Sociale Wetenschappen, 1989), critiquing Ganzeboom's & De Graaf's policy of combining several different surveys into one database, without conducting random tests to assure that the combined surveys are still representative of the cohorts implied. Several methods are proposed to ensure the compatibility of different surveys. In Bestaat het wetenschappelijk forum eigelijk wel (Does the Scientific Forum Really Exist), Peter van Kolverschoten critiques the work of Ganzeboom (eg, Leefstijlen in Nederland [Lifestyles in the Netherlands], Alphen a/d Rijn: Samson, 1988) & of De Graaf (eg, "De invloed van financiele en culturele hulpbronnen in schoolloopbanen" [The Influence of Financial and Cultural Aid in the Educational Career], 1987 dissertation, Rijks U of Utrecht, Netherlands), particularly their survey methods, doubting the reliability & validity of their work. In Reactie op Van Kolverschoten en Kerstholt (Reaction on Van Kolverschoten and Kerstholt) Ganzeboom & De Graaf refute Van Kolverschoten's & Kerstholt's arguments, claiming that their criticisms show elementary ignorance of customary research procedures, & reiterate the most important points of their survey methods & results, pointing out the important historical changes in Dutch society revealed in their work. 19 References. M. Barker

title: Een afwijkend patroon? Een vergelijkend onderzoek naar participatie en segregatie op de arbeidsmarkt in Nederland en de Bondsrepublik Duitsland, 1960-1985
authors: Plantenga,J.,   Schippers, J. J.,   Siegers,J. J.
abstract: Economic data from the Netherlands & the Federal Republic of Germany are used to examine how women's participation in the labor market changed from 1960 to 1985. In 1960 many German women continued to work outside the home after marriage, while Dutch women did not. By 1985 most of these differences between the two countries had disappeared; however, in the Netherlands, inclusion of women in the labor force still lags hehind, & considerable gender discrimination remains. Although both countries show similarities in the scale & nature of women's work, national features are still recognizable. 8 Tables, 2 Graphs, 16 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: De invloed van sociaal en menselijk kapitaal op het inkomen van Nederlandse managers
authors: Boxman,Ed A.W.,   Flap,Hendrik D.,   Graaf,Paul M. de
abstract: Questionnaire data obtained in 1986/87 are used to investigate the relationship between social & human capital in the income attainment process of Dutch business managers (N = 1,359). Results of multivariate analysis indicate that social capital (eg, external work contacts & memberships) has a substantial independent effect on income, apart from human capital (eg, education & experience) & position level (based on number of subordinates). Additionally, human & social capital interact in the income attainment process: eg, in industrial/society, social networks can still play a role comparable in importance to human capital. 3 Tables, 2 Figures, 1 Appendix, 22 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Levensontwerpen van jonge vrouwen en mannen: Resultaten uit een intergenerationeel vergelijkend onderzoek
abstract: To investigate changes in the ideas of Dutch youths regarding employment, partnership, & family, & how these ideas correlate with social class & lifestyles, interview data collected in 1988 (N = 54 males & 66 females, ages 16-20) are compared with data collected from 60 women who came of age in the 1950s. The results show that today's young women are much more likely to expect to pursue a career than were women of their mothers' generation. The two-phase model, by which women ceased outside employment after the birth of the first child, is not popular with the younger generation. The influence of social class is evidenced by the fact that upper class girls more frequently choose to combine a career with motherhood; for young men, however, life plans agree more with traditional standards, irrespective of social class. 3 Tables, 55 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Transities in de opvattingen van demografen
abstract: The declining birthrate in the Netherlands in the 1970s & projections concerning the bourgeois family model of the future are briefly discussed as an introduction to a review of two books edited by G. A. B. Frinking & J. H. M. Nelissen: (1) Ontgroening in Nederland: Achtergronden, Ontwikkelingen en implicaties van een jeugdarme samenleving ([Degreening in the Netherlands: The Background, Developments, and Implications of a Child-Poor Society], Amersfoort: Acco, 1988); & (2) Het kind als keuze: demografische ontwikkelingen in Nederland ([The Child as a Choice: Demographic Developments in the Netherlands] The Hague: SDU Publishers, 1988 [see listings in IRPS No. 53]). The individual contributions to the first book are outlined, & three shortcomings are noted: (A) the looseness of the collection, presenting a rather unsystematic treatment of the causes & consequences of decreasing childbirth; (B) the many questions left unanswered; & (C) sloppy typography & organization of auxiliary material. The second book is a valuable contribution to the discussion of the relationship between the freedom of individuals to have a choice regarding having children & their social solidarity. Z. Dubiel

title: Worden we écht te slim voor ons werk? Drie interpretaties van de onderzoeksresultaten van Huijgen
abstract: Much labor market research has found that the number of highly educated workers increases faster than the number of higher-level jobs, with the result that the labor force is beoming increasingly underutilized. Here, this situation is reviewed from other theoretical viewpoints. It is argued that even a small upgrading of the job structure may lead to a substantially increased demand for higher educated workers. Moreover, an increased number of highly educated workers promotes better job performance & facilitates technological innovation. 1 Table, 2 Figures, 48 References. AA
tags: highly educated workers, job availability, labor market theories

title: Meten van sociale status in de jaren negentig. De sociale status van niet-werkenden nader bepaald
abstract: To investigate the social status of nonworking Dutch adults, questionnaire data were obtained from couples (N = 70,805) as reported in the Dutch Central Statistics Bureau's 1985 labor force survey. A classification of social status is developed that divides the nonworking by their degree of inclusion in the labor market & by their type of activity; these categories are scaled for social distance, & separately for men & women. The scale proposed assumes that certain lifestyles are expected from those wishing to belong to specific social groups, leading to restrictions on social contacts & to highly visible marriage patterns. Different segments of the nonworking population have various levels of social status: eg, disabled & unemployed men & disabled women not seeking employment have low status, while students have a high status. 4 Tables, 26 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Functiestructuurveranderingen als gevolg van automatisering
abstract: Interview data (N = 831 respondents) are used to examine the effects of automation on job structure (JS) in a representative sample of 491 organizations in the Netherlands. Findings reveal few changes in JS, with little evidence of polarization: only in 20% of firms did jobs increase or disappear. It is argued that the (small) variation in JS may be due to features of the automation equipment & not to market conditions, as contingency theory suggests. 5 Tables, 46 References. Modified AA

title: Tussen utopie en mythe: de sociale theorieën van Georges Sorel
abstract: The relevance of Georges Sorel's social conceptions to contemporary sociology is noted, even though this discipline tends to neglect, underestimate, & adopt a biased view of his theories. Sorel's main sociological, ethical-political, & methodological ideas are outlined: critique of utopian models of society, constructivist theory of knowledge, machinism, concrete rationalism, syndicalist reformism, pluralist & dynamic conception of society, populist mythology critique of the Marxist utopia & structural-functionalism, & the defense of local autonomy against state intervention. 13 References. Z. Dubiel
tags: Sorel, Georges, social theories, sociological contributions

title: Beslist de geschiedenis over wetenschappelijke kwaliteit?
abstract: A review of essays & other texts by Tonko Tjarko ten Have (1906-1975), the "founding father" of the academic study of the so-called agogic sciences or andragology in the Netherlands. Historical & metatheoretical analysis of the stipulative definitions ten Have proposed & of his rather implicit philosophy of social sciences reveals the conceptual framework of ten Have's theorizing is poor. Further, debates between him & others are deficient because of incompatible linguistic criteria & philosophical & scientific assumptions. Ten Have wrote within the tradition of psychic monism, established by Dutch philosopher & psychologist Gerard Heymans, & it is presumed that neither ten Have nor his andragological colleagues were aware of the idealistic characteristics of Heymans' epistemology & methodology, a fact that obscures their controversies. In addition, ten Have was epistemologically naive, eg, he was not familiar with the arguments of the hermeneutic tradition about the impossibility of universal judgements in the realm of human sciences. It is argued that this epistemological naivete weakens his conception of andragology. Modified AA
tags: andragology, Netherlands, Tonko Tjarko ten Have's work

title: Het wetenschappelijk onderwijs: egalitair of utilitair? De externe democratisering en verschuivende legitimaties in het beleid
abstract: The educational policy of the Netherlands regarding accessibility to higher education & reduction of inequality of educational opportunities is reviewed, & four distinct periods since WWII are detailed: recovery, expansion, democratization & limits to growth, & restriction. Economic legitimation of policy is prevalent in all periods but one. Data on educational access for students from lower socioeconomic backgrounds reveal no relation to specific policy; however, neither has there been major improvement in comparison with other socioeconomic groups. 4 Tables, 71 References. Adapted from the source document.
tags: educational access inequalities, policy development, post-WWII Netherlands

title: Het schadelijk verlangen van een linkse generatie
Publieke opinies over etnische minderheden in Nederland en West-Duitsland
abstract: To investigate Dutch & German public opinion toward the presence of ethnic minorities, questionnaire data were obtained in 1988 (N = 500 Dutch & 1,027 German respondents). Dutch opinions regarding the Surinamers & the Turks were remarkably similar, & revealed a high degree of tolerance, compassion, nondiscrimination, & personal acceptance. German attitudes toward the Turks differed substantially from Dutch attitudes. A possible explanation might be the strong moralism in public attitudes toward minorities, which some would characterize as Dutch extremism. 5 Tables, 13 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: De WAO en de gemiste kansen
Het bijzondere van Nederland: de landenvergelijking in het Sociaal en Cultureel Rapport
abstract: Despite the enormous expenditures of resources required to conduct international comparative studies, interest in European integration led to a comparative component in the Dutch government's biannual Sociaal en Cultureel Rapport 1990 ([Social and Cultural Report 1990] Rijswijk/Den Haag: Sociaal & Cultureel Planbureau/VUGA, 1990). Overall indicators show that the Netherlands is on the same socioeconomic level as neighboring Western European countries. However, some differences are found with respect to the demographic composition of the population, % engaged in the labor force, & crime rates, with the Netherlands' rate exceeding the European average. The decay of the pillarization system in politics & in society at large accounts for some of these changes. 6 Tables, 1 Figure, 26 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Het schakelingen-perspectief getoetst aan drie voorbeelden uit de koloniale politiek in Indonesië
abstract: Analysis of linkages provides a special type of historical approach focusing attention on the reformulation of policies from one administrative level to another. Here, this perspective is used in three case studies of Dutch colonial politics in Indonesia in the 1800s, with respect to: (1) development of towns; (2) military expansion; & (3) railroad construction. Analysis shows that the theoretical levels do not correspond with groups of interest & that the term "linkage" has a variety of meanings; moreover, historical data are lacking. It is concluded that the linkage perspective offers few advantages over traditional network analysis, although it is helpful in avoiding level reductionism & level determinism. 14 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Hoe de Verlichting haar triomf vierde; bespreking van Niklas Luhmann's Die Wissenschaft der Gesellschaft
abstract: A review essay on Niklas Luhmann's Die Wissenschaft der Gesellschaft ([The Science of Society] 1990 [see listing in IRPS No. 64]). Focus is on Luhmann's definitions of science & society, & on his epistemology & methodology of studying science. Improvements in conceptual clarity are noted over earlier works (eg, Soziale Systeme. Grundrisz einer allgemeinen Theorie ([Social Systems: Sketch of a General Theory], Frankfurt: Suhrkamp, 1984). Advantages of integrating cybernetic & mathematical theories of communication are noted. 19 References. M. Meeks

title: Postmaterialisme en stemgedrag. Enkele kanttekeningen bij de analyse van politieke waarde
abstract: A discussion of three articles previously published in Mens en Maatschappij, by: Paul G. J. Hendriks Vettehen (see SA 38:5/90X0159); C. P. Middendorp (see SA 37:3/89U6075); & B. Niemoller & C. van der Eijk (see SA 35:4/87R7636). All three investigate the impact of postmaterialist values on voting behavior. Niemoller & van der Eijk attempt to answer the question of whether the old Left/Right ideological dimension, being used as an explanation for voting behavior, has been replaced by a new dimension, ie, a postmaterialist dimension. Middendorp also uses Left-Right self-placement as an explanatory variable for Left-Right voting behavior. The argument of Hendriks Vettehen, however, has more serious flaws than do those of the other authors. He uses a trivial & biased operationalization of voting behavior; also, only one item, attitude toward abortion, is used as a variable indicating a postmaterialist value orientation. It is concluded that more theoretically elaborated models are required. 9 References. Modified AA

title: Een kennismaking met de sociale wetenschappen
abstract: A review essay on a book by Ben Schreur, Agressie en geweld. Een kennismaking met de sociale wetenschappen ([An Acquaintance with the Social Sciences] Muiderberg: Coutinho, 1989 [see listing in IRPS No. 63]). Schreur's attempt to integrate various social science concepts leads to several theoretical problems. M. Meeks

title: Interne arbeidsmarkten en beloning bij mannen en vrouwen in Nederland
authors: Gijsel,P. de,   Muysken,J.,   Wolfs,G. L. M.
abstract: Wage differences between male (M) & female (F) Dutch workers are investigated using questionnaire data obtained from 4,000 adults in 1985, reported in Trendrapport ([Trend Report] The Hague: Organization for Strategic Labor Market Research, 1987). Findings show that Ms earn significantly more than Fs, & that workers promoted from within a firm earn more than those hired from outside. Thus, it is possible that Fs earn less because their position within a firm's internal labor market is less secure. 7 Tables, 3 Graphs, 32 References. Adapted from the source document as translated by M. Meeks.

title: Protest in een pacificatie-democratie. De Nederlandse nieuwe sociale bewegingen in internationaal vergelijkend perspectief
abstract: A contrastive analysis is presented of new social movements in France, Germany, & the Netherlands since the 1960s. The closest resemblance is between German & Dutch groups, where the newest groups predominate, having seized the initiative. Dutch groups are characterized by formalized professional social movement associations, fostering nonviolent civil disobedience. Very little violence occurs, due to the pacification of traditional political conflicts, the openness of the electoral system, the tradition of consensus politics, & changes in relations among political parties. 7 Tables, 2 Graphs, 26 References. Adapted from the source document as translated by M. Meeks.

title: Individuen, gezinnen en buurten: sociale determinanten van het onderwijsniveau
abstract: Effects of social status on educational attainment are usually examined among isolated individuals. A new approach is proposed, focusing on sibling research in assessing the importance of family factors on achievement. Analysis of Dutch longitudinal data from R. J. Bosker's, W. H. A. Hofman's, & R. K. W. van der Velden's Een generatie geselecteerd. Deel 1: De loopbanen ([A Selected Generation. Part 1: The Life Courses] Groningen: RION, 1985) reveals that social determinants are not confined to the family; peer networks are also important. However, multilevel techniques used to determine the relative importance of individual, family, peer, & neighborhood factors show that the individual factor is the most important. 3 Tables, 48 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Partners en arbeidsmarktpositie. Een studie naar de samenhang tussen de arbeidsmarktposities van huwelijkspartners
abstract: The relationship between the labor market status of domestic partners is investigated, based on questionnaire data gathered 1985/86 from Dutch adults (N = 22,352) by the Central Bureau of Statistics. Analysis shows that this relationship is due to shared restrictions &/or spousal selection & influence. Also, unemployed & disabled persons often have unemployed or disabled partners. 4 Tables, 2 Figures, 25 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: De keuze van rechtvaardigheidsbeginselen: consensus of dissensus?
abstract: A literature review shows that the key theoretical traditions of macrosociology do not agree on whether to expect either consent or dissent on juridical principles in contemporary societies. To determine which conditions will elicit consent of dissent, solutions must also be sought in microsociology & social psychology. 59 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: De loopbaanontwikkeling van vrouwen en mannen in de rechterlijke macht: beeld en werkelijkheid
authors: Groot-van Leeuwen,L. E. de,   Kester,C. C. M.,   Kester,J. G. C.
abstract: Analysis of official statistical data reveals that, despite a fairly even split in the total number of jobs held by men & women in the Dutch judiciary system, considerable vertical stratification to the advantage of men remains. In general, men reach a higher position with fewer years of experience than women do. The underrepresentation of women is especially noticeable at the middle & upper echelons. 8 Tables, 12 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: De invloed van materiële en immateriële ouderlijke hulpbronnen op het verlaten van het ouderlijk huis
abstract: Questionnaire data obtained from Dutch citizens born in 1961 (N = 583) are used to investigate how & why young adults leave the parental home. Three main reasons are established: (1) to finish school; (2) to live with a partner; & (3) to gain independence. Both timing & reasons for leaving depend on the resources of parents, including material & nonmaterial goods: eg, high levels of transferable resources accelerate the process of leaving home, while high levels of nontransferable resources slow it down. 3 Tables, 3 Figures, 49 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Beloning en allocatie op een informele arbeidsdeelmarkt
abstract: Wage & job competition models from L. C. Thurow's Generating Inequality: Mechanisms of Distribution in the U.S. Economy (New York: Basic Books, 1975) are tested in an informal labor market, using questionnaire date from Dutch baby-sitters (N = 167). Analysis shows that wages & allocation depend not only on productivity of jobs & workers, but also on relation signaling, used to gain trust, avoid problems, increase motivation, & stem turnover. A selection model is presented, showing how rewards help govern the labor relationship: employers with high income offer money to govern the relationship, especially with well-educated sitters; less wealthy employers use other means, eg, homogeneity & social exchange, to retain their sitter. 5 Tables, 36 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Veranderingen in de beroepsoriëntatie van vrouwen: een vergelijking tussen opeenvolgende generaties
abstract: Findings are presented of a study on whether younger women are more job oriented than older women, & how their job orientation & expected future labor market participation are affected by socialization characteristics, educational level, civil status, & present labor market participation. Results of survey data from 800 Dutch women (N = 228 ages 16-31, 260 ages 31-41, & 312 ages 41-61) show that educational level is of significant importance in determining women's job orientation; while there is no direct effect of age, there is a strong indirect age effect, in that younger women are better educated. The more extensive a woman's labor market participation, the greater the job orientation. Single women are less job oriented than married women, while widowed & divorced women are the most job oriented. The stronger the job orientation, the more a woman expects paid labor to play a central role in her future. 6 Tables, 13 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: De drankbestrijding en de inbreng van de alcoholaccijns in de Nederlandse staatshuishouding 1831-1920. Historisch-sociologische notities
abstract: A historical perspective is offered on nineteenth-century antidrinking movements & the proportion of state revenues in the Netherlands derived from the liquor tax. Characteristics of temperance movements in Western societies are described, & two related explanations are given for their popularity. The movements were part of a broader civilizing campaign directed toward the lower working classes by members of the middle class & the vanguards of industrial workers. However, the civilizing thesis coincides with an industrializing thesis: temperance was also promoted by industrial entrepreneurs who needed a sober, trustworthy work force in their increasingly mechanized firms. At the same time, however, the process of state formation in the latter nineteenth century was accelerated by financing through the liquor tax. Therefore, strict antidrinking legislation was not a political possibility at this time, despite the enormous popularity of the temperance movements. 1 Table, 35 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: De ideale sollicitant is een vrouw. Onderzoek naar sekseverschillen in het (personeels)selectieproces
abstract: Three types of research methods used to explore sex differences in the screening of job applicants are shown to differ in how they acknowledge disparate impact & hidden discrimination. The research of A. E. M. van Vianen (Het Selectie-interview. Over de Rol van Seksestereotypen [Selection Interviews. The Role of Sex Stereotyping], Leiden, 1987) is critiqued. Results of a study on the relationship between sex-role stereotypes & requisite management characteristics show that the "ideal candidate is a woman." It is concluded that attention must be paid not only to the stereotyping of characteristics, but also to the extent these characteristics are relevant for selection in the particular company. 7 Tables, 17 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Zullen wij voor de kinderen bij elkaar blijven? De veranderende effecten van eenoudergezinnen op de schoolloopbanen van de kinderen
abstract: Questionnaire data are used to compare educational achievement among Dutch adolescents (N = 15,554) living in 1- vs 2-parent families. Analysis shows that students in 1-parent families have lower grades than their peers from 2-parent families once other background factors are eliminated. However, more significant is the variable of parental educational achievement. Children living alone with their fathers scored worse than children living alone with their mothers. The observed negative effect for families headed by mothers has increased since the 1970s. 5 Tables, 9 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: De verdeling van huishoudelijk en betaald werk in Nederland
abstract: Using data from W. P. Knulst's & P. van Beek's Tijd Komt met de jaren: onderzoek naar tegenstellingen en veranderingen in dagelijkse bezigheden van Nederlanders op basis van tijdbudgetonderzoek ([Time Comes with Years: A Study of Contrasts and Changes in the Daily Pursuits of the Dutch on the Basis of Time-Budget Analysis] The Hague: VUGA, 1990), a discussion is presented of changes in the sexual distribution of labor in the Netherlands, 1950-1990. Most political discourse on women's inclusion in the job market ignores the sharing of household tasks among spouses, expecting that equalization at work will lead to equal distribution of chores at home; however, it is shown that women working outside the home receive only slightly more assistance with chores from their husbands than do those who are homemakers. The inequity is most blatant in the area of child care. To increase women's participation in the paid labor force, new conditions are necessary both at home & at work. 1 Table, 3 Graphs, 13 References. Adapted from the source document as translated by M. Meeks.

title: Een gevecht tegen windmolens?
abstract: When compiling computerized databases from information obtained from interviews, questionnaires, & research Ss, the utmost care should be taken to maintain the confidentiality of the information. Names, addresses, & phone numbers should be deleted from aggregate files. The problem of preserving the anonymity of data in long-term studies involving the recontacting of Rs is examined. Current large-scale projects in Germany & the Netherlands are discussed in this regard. 2 References. M. Meeks

title: Expansie van het voortgezet en hoger onderwijs: effecten van veranderingen op de arbeidsmarkt, in gezinnen en in het onderwijssysteem
abstract: A revised version of SA 39:6/91S25495/ASA/1991/6854. 6 Tables, 29 References.

title: Tijdsregistratie bij huishoudelijk werk: winst en verlies bij vrouwen
abstract: An analytical review of data from G. Thomas's, S. Wyatt's, & I. Miles's Preliminary Analysis of the ESCR 1983/84 Time Budget Data (Economic & Social Research Council, 1985) & other sources yields evidence of changes in the sexual division of labor in UK households over the last twenty-five years. Many sociologists erroneously view women as a homogeneous group. Much discussion centers on the role of time-saving mechanical devices; however, women's class, marital status, number (& age) of children, & extent of their participation in the job market are more important. Although domestic work is secondary to capitalist production, there are ways to achieve equalized distribution of household chores. 2 Tables, 3 Graphs, 16 References. Adapted from the source document as translated by M. Meeks.

title: De ontwikkeling van de godsdienstsociologie in Nederland
abstract: A literature review shows areas of the sociology of religion currently being investigated in the Netherlands, most oriented toward Roman Catholicism & the Dutch Reformed Church. The primary universities & research institutes engaged in this research are identified. A count of social science works involving religion published since 1945 includes 1,200+ titles. As the concept of religion is widened, there is a concomitant increase in the scope of the sociology of religion. 69 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Ontwikkelingen in deelname aan het basisonderwijs: etnische segregatie als gevolg van schoolkeuzeprocessen
abstract: Interview data obtained from 1,135 parents, 13% of whom were minorities, in 3 Dutch villages reveal that changing patterns of parental school choices are leading to segregation between native Dutch & immigrant elementary school children. Parents' perceptions of a particular school are closely tied to the ethnicity, social class, & religion of the students it serves. In general, parental knowledge about curriculum standards is low, yet many are convinced that the presence of minorities negatively impacts the quality of instruction. Implications of the school choice option for the educational & social systems are reviewed. 7 Tables, 1 Figure, 24 References.

title: Techniek, organisatie en arbeid in de bouw
abstract: To investigate the relationship between techniques, worker organization, & types of jobs in the Dutch construction industry, questionnaire data were obtained from 20 private firms. Attention is focused on how the use of different materials & methods of building exerts an effect on the content of individual jobs. Analysis shows that the upsurge in the use of prefabricated components & standardized materials leads to a decrease in workers' qualification level. Additionally, workers have less control on the job site. Increased specialization brings about additional divisions in work organization. It is argued here, however, that the complexities of state-of-the-art architecture necessitate both highly skilled & broadly trained workers. 5 Tables, 2 Figures, 28 References.

title: Links-rechts zelfplaatsing en partijkeuze: een verklaringsmodel
authors: Schmeets,J. J. G.,   Molin,E. J. E.
abstract: Two explanatory models for the political party choice of Dutch voters (N = 1,506) are evaluated via LISREL analysis of data obtained in a 1989 national interview study. Both models consider religion, political values (postmaterialism), Left-Right self-identification, & social values. The model that takes into account short-term characteristics, eg, opinions on politicians, is found to be less successful a predictor of party choice than the model restricted to long-term characteristics. 6 Tables, 1 Chart, 1 Graph, 18 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Heeft het wegen van wetenschappelijke publikaties zin?
abstract: To determine how to evaluate the scientific productivity of universities, research groups, & individual sociologists, an analysis was conducted of 2,456 Dutch publications, 1983-1986. It is shown that the variables of multiple authorship & length of publication are not related to productivity level; however, the quality of publications is a key factor. For research groups & schools, this effect is most pronounced for publications written in Dutch, while for individual authors the effect of weighting for quality is strongest in journal articles. 3 Tables, 2 Appendixes, 20 References. Adapted from the source document as translated by M. Meeks.

title: Het grootste gelijk van de wereld...
Intergenerationele klassenmobiliteit en politieke voorkeur in Nederland tussen 1970 en 1986
abstract: To investigate the relationship between present social class (SC), former SC, & political party preference, questionnaire data from 11 Dutch surveys (total N = 20,700 respondents [Rs]) conducted 1970-1986 were analyzed, using techniques from M. E. Sobel's "Diagonal Mobility Models: A Substantively Motivated Class of Designs for the Analysis of Mobility Effects" (see SA 30:3/82M2954). The results show that the effect of Rs' own SC is identical for both upward & downward mobility. For young Rs, the father's SC may have a stronger impact on mobility than their own SC, but after age 30 the SC of origin is less important. 3 Tables, 30 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Van adelborst tot admiraal. De carrière van marineofficieren en de dynamiek van een interne arbeidsmarkt
abstract: A study of the career patterns & life courses of 515 officers in the Dutch Royal Navy, divided into 3 cohorts by period of service: (1) 1895-1945; (2) 1930-1970; & (3) 1953-1991. The importance of trainability, performance, responsibility, seniority, age at enlistment, & family background is investigated. Although seniority plays a key role, performance is a more important consideration in advancement for the latter part of the career & for the younger cohorts. Developments in naval human resources management during the 1980s are reviewed from the perspective of internal labor market theory. 6 Tables, 46 References. M. Meeks

title: Efficiënte loontheorieën
abstract: A review of the literature in economics reveals weaknesses in the normally accepted neoclassical theory of the labor market, a problem that can be remedied with a new approach presented here, based on efficiency wage theory. The new model is applied to three independent data sets collected in the Netherlands in 1952, 1983, & 1988 (data not defined). In contrast to the neoclassical prediction that wage differentials are determined by supply & demand, efficiency wage theory shows that the nature of the employer is the deciding factor. The relevance of the model for unemployment, discrimination, contractual obligations, & disabilities is discussed. 3 Tables, 18 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Van 'ascription' naar 'achievement'? Trends in statusverwerving in Nederland tussen 1930 en 1980
abstract: To examine patterns in social mobility in the Netherlands, questionnaire data were obtained from 9,548 men, 1970-1987, who entered the labor market 1929-1980. Instead of a standard mobility table, a simple status attainment model is used based on fathers' & sons' educational & job status. A historical analysis reveals why ascription & inheritance models of occupational mobility were transformed during the twentieth century. Various trends & fluctuations are traced to changes on the national scale. It is concluded that the modernization process had a negative impact on ascription processes & a positive impact on achievement processes. 5 Tables, 5 Figures, 24 References.

title: Verwijzingen van huisartsen naar fysiotherapeuten: een verklaring en analyse van verschillen tussen huisartsen
authors: Uunk,W. J. G.,   Groenewegen,P. P.,   Dekker,J.
abstract: To investigate patterns in referrals by general practitioners to physical therapists, questionnaire data involving 15,526 cases were obtained from 141 Dutch doctors (MDs) in 1987/88. Analysis shows a large variation in referral rates among MDs. Rational choice theory is used to construct a theoretical model with set boundary conditions & applications, specifying behavioral choices & goals. The most important factors in making a referral include diagnosis, degree of impairment, & patient's educational level. In general, the model does not fit the data as well as hoped. 4 Tables, 1 Figure, 30 References.

title: Netwerken in Nederland. Een onderzoek naar persoonlijke netwerken van Nederlanders
authors: Tijhuis,M. A. R.,   Flap,H. D.,   Foets,M.,   Groenewegen,P. P.
abstract: Personal networks in the Netherlands are investigated using interview data obtained in a representative national survey (N = 9,850 respondents [Rs]). Three approaches to measure personal networks are presented: (1) social integration, (2) social support, & (3) social networks. Analysis reveals that Rs are well integrated into many kinds of institutions, eg, family, church, & informal & formal group affiliations. Most people receive some social support, often apart from family. A strong correlation was demonstrated between network characteristics & education & urbanism. Future research should address the substitution or accumulation of social relationships. 4 Tables, 35 References. Adapted from the source document.

title: Sociale kerncijfers
abstract: The Dutch Central Bureau of Statistics recently devised a new statistical measure of community urbanness, based primarily on the degree of concentration of social & economic activity in a given area. The degree of intensity of activity is determined by the number of addresses per unit area. The first publication to appear using this new index was C. J. den Dulk's, H. van de Stadt's, & J. M. Vliegen's "Een nieuwe maatstaf voor stedelijkheid: De omgevingsadressendichtheid"([A New Measure of Urbanness: Environmental Address Density] Maandstatistiek van de bevolking, 1992, 40, July, 14-27). 3 Tables, 5 References.
tags: community urbanness, new statistical measure, Dutch Central Bureau of Statistics

title: Het verband tussen de beroepsposities van huwelijkspartners in acht landen van de Europese Gemeenschap, 1975-1989
abstract: Using data from the Eurobarometers, the association between the occupations of spouses is studied for 8 EC-countries at several points in time. Most of the association is attributable to consistency between spouses. The strength of this effect differs sonic-what between the countries, and decreases by about 17% between 1975 and 1989. A cohort-analysis shows this trend towards more openness to be a combined cohort- and age-effect. We also find a relationship between married womens' participation in paid employment and the occupational group in which her husband is working. The strength and pattern of this association differs somewhat between countries, but remains about the same in the period under investigation. title: Opvattingen over etnische minderheden: etnocentrisme en discours-analyse
abstract: Eleven Dutch autochtonous adults living in an old neighbourhood in the centre of the city of Rotterdam discussed in two groups during four evenings the situation in their neighbourhood. Transcripts of the discussions were analysed focussing on the topic of ethnic minorities and inter-ethnic relations. Three dominant interpretative repertoires which the participants used in describing, explaining and justifying their views are identified: own choice, snowed under, and holy cow. They refer to ethnic minorities themselves, the living conditions in the neighbourhood, and the role of authorities and the moral community, respectively. It is argued that these three repertoires provide points of departure in trying to redress these views. title: Sociaal en cultureel rapport 1992 (2)
abstract: This article presents information on the report "Sociaal en cultureel rapport 1992," which deals with the prevailing social and cultural conditions in the Netherlands. The article makes specific reference to the first social and cultural report which was published in 1974 and compares it with the 1992 report. Different chapters of the 1992 report describe events and developments in different areas of social and cultural well-being including health care and social service; labor; social security; lives; education; free time, media and culture; and justice. All these chapters of the report have a common topic of inequality and delay.

title: Zuinig met recht. De Nederlandse rechtscultuur in vergelijking met de Westduitse
abstract: International comparison of legal indicators shows a relatively low level of litigation in the Netherlands. This is quite surprising because legal aid (which is generally seen as improving the access to law) is much more generous than in the continental neighbouring countries. The paradox can be explained by features of legal culture on four levels: - to some degree on the level of positive law - much more so on the level of institutional infrastructure of lawyers, courts and 'alternatives to formal procedures' - behavioural patterns of professionals who deal with legal procedures - and last and least: legal consciousness of professionals as well as the genera/public. The data show that differences in legal behaviour are to be explained not so much on the demand side of the users of law, but rather on the supply side of judicial and quasi-judicial institutions. title: Zwaartepuntvorming in de maatschappijwetenschappen en overheidsbeleid: evaluatie van de TVC-DAS-operatie
abstract: This article describes the results of an evaluation study' of a policy measure aiming at the establishment of Centers of Excellence in the social sciences. The measure was part of the retrenchment operation Task Differentiation and Concentration (TVC). The government provided six million guilders to attain this goal. The Disciplinary Advisory Committee on the Social Sciences (DAS) advised on the distribution of this funding. It turns out that the goal is only partially realized. Explanations are given for this partial goal attainment. title: Adam uit balingschap
abstract: This article discusses various issues related to the notions of nationalism, nationality and social solidarity on sociological agenda. It has been reported that developments in the international arena including the communist system in the East and the German reunification have awoken nationalist feelings and movements. It is reported that the carefully fed myth of national identity and solidarity is political inventions which are typical for modern Europe of eighteenth and the especially nineteenth century. It is highlighted that the economic, political and social aspects of national identity and nationalism do not necessary show the same tendency and do not necessary have the same prevention.

title: Ontvangen publikaties
abstract: This article presents a list of books related to the field of sociology. Some of the books include: "Sociaal vaardig. Praktijkboek voor dienstverleners," by J. Verhulst; "Armoede en sociale uitsluiting," by J. Vranken and D. Geldof; and "Handboek arbeid en gezonheid psychologie," by J.A.M. Winnubst and M.J. Schrabraco.

title: De culturele en economische dimensie van beroepen: een nieuw meetinstrument voor de beroepsstatus van mannen en vrouwen
abstract: This article presents a new occupational status scale for the Netherlands. This new multidimensional scale has been developed in order to improve the predictive power of occupational position in social inequality research. We use the theory of Pierre Bourdieu on occupations and life style, which differentiates between two stratifications: a cultural and an economic one. According to Bourdieu's theory, cultural status is indicated by education and government-employment, whereas economic status can be indicated by income and self-employment or private-sector employment. Data from eleven Dutch national survey data sets on work characteristics were aggregated for 74 occupational categories, distinguishing between male and female versions of these occupations. An aggregated file was constructed containing male and female occupations as cases, and occupational characteristics such as average income level, percentage of higher educated, percentage self-employed and the like as variables. Principal component analysis revealed a two factor structure of occupations which is well interpretable as distinguishing two independent dimensions of occupations: an economic and a cultural dimension. Generally, men's occupations have higher economic positions, while men's and women's occupations appeared to have the same positions on the cultural scale. The tentative application of the new scales to ideological views showed that dimensions in ideological views parallel to great extent the two dimensions in occupational status. title: Investeren in kennis voor een rendabel kunstbeleid
abstract: The primary concern of Dutch arts policy in the nineties is the relationship between art and society. Part of the responsibility for this relationship is delegated to the individual art producers. This article presents a selection of the major publications in the field of arts production and reception within society. A connection is made between these publications and the various contemporary views on Dutch arts policy. It is argued that the latest view indicates a need for theoretical development and new research. Suggested criteria for new theories are: the inclusion of a specific function of art, a network approach and adequate micro-macro transitions. Research should concentrate on the development of specific marketing concepts for the arts, that also serve the collective purpose of arts participation. title: Opkomst bij verkiezingen van vrouwen en mannen: uit balans?
authors: Schmeets,J. J. G.,   Otten,F. W. J.
abstract: On the occasion of the elections of the Second Chamber of Parliament in the Netherlands, held on 6 september 1989, it turned out that of the electoral cohorts 1971-1989 (18-43 years old) more women (83%) than men (64%) gave their ballot. This result is remarkable since women are found to be less interested in politics than men. Voting in the Netherlands occurs on Wednesday (between 8.00 a.m. and 7.00 p.m.). This might be a reason why voters without paid work, of which the majority is female, more often actually did vote than voters with paid work. After controlling for the characteristics 'interest in politics', 'education', 'paid work' and the 'attitude towards religion and politics', the relationship between sex and voting remained. We did not expect this. This might be a sign that either other characteristics should be incorporated into the model or that the operarionalization of the four mentioned variables is inadequate. title: Sociale kerncijfers
abstract: The article focuses on a research conducted in order to determine the changes in income distribution in the Netherlands since 1977. It concerns the changes in the inequality of the partitioning of besteedbare incomes of households and the changes in the inequality in the development of purchasing power of households. It has been discovered that the inequality of besteedbare incomes between 1977 and 1984 remained more or less the same, whereas from 1985 the inequality has increased. The research revealed that upto 1984, the purchasing power development of the lowest income group has been unfavourable as compared to the highest income group. But, after 1985 an opposite picture arose.

title: Het aandeel van mannen in huishoudelijk werk
authors: Lippe,T. van der,   Doorne-Huiskes,A. van,   Siegers,J. J.
abstract: Although the participation of women in the labour force has increased the last decades, the division of tasks at home has hardly changed. In this article we examine the absolute time spent on household labour (including child care) of the husband and his relative share in the total amount of household labour. This is explained by investigating the sex-role ideology of partners, their relative resources, the demand for housework and the husband's available time. Results indicate that men spend more time on household tasks, when there is a young child present. It also appears that if partners have modern norms, the husbands' housework participation is higher. Contrary to expectations, husbands do not spend more hours on household labour, when their wife is working for pay. Husbands' relative share in housework however, increases when their wife is working for pay, but this is mainly due to the fact that women with a paid job are doing less household labour compared to women without a paid job. title: Eén index van consumenten-vertrouwen?
abstract: The authors investigate the dimensionality of the Index of Consumer Confidence using micro-data from the Dutch CBS Consumer Sentiment Survey. This index (with its two sub-indices) is based on Katona's psychological analysis of economic behavior. It is often used as a short term business cycle indicator. On the individual level correlations between the five questions are so low that summation into one scale does not seem to be warranted. Instead three orthogonal indexes are distinguished. On the aggregated level this distinction turns out to make sense. One newly distinguished index predicts consumer behavior better than any of the old (sub)indices. Research design and several findings are described more extensively in Nobel and Winkels (1993). title: Groot onderzoek, klein land
abstract: The article focuses on the views of the author regarding policy for scientific education in the Netherlands. According to the author, by making policy or economy still smaller, the government, the universities and the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO) seems to conspire small, free research. The author opines that it would not be healthy for the Netherlands.

title: Leiding geven in een grootwinkelbedrijf. De kans voor vrouwen en mannen op een leidinggevende functie in de detailhandel
abstract: Differences between women and men in management positions in the retail trade Leadership can be seen as a game which is played better by men than by women because men know the rules better than women. This statement was the starting point for the article. The following question is answered. Are there differences between women and men in management positions in the retail trade? If so, how can these differences be explained? In a large retail store it appears that men more often have management positions than women. To explain the differences,first an elaboration of the human capital theory (Becker, 1957, Mincer, 1974) - the two-career-hypothesis (Roos, 1981) - is tested. This hypothesis is not confirmed: it is found that even in the case women have the same experience as men, have a fulltime job and are married, men still more often have the management positions. Then the 'token'-theory (Kanter, 1977) is tested: members of a minority group have less opportunities to reach a management position. This hypothesis is confirmed for women but it is not confirmed for men. Finally, the two hypotheses are tested in a multi-level-analysis. authors: Stokman,Frans N.,   Missoorten,E. Rudie,   Stokman,Arjo F.

The score is based on the scientific publications in the scientific reports of the Dutch universities. The publication is weighted according to its size and scientific quality of the journal or publisher. In case of multiple authorship, the publication score is equally divided over the authors. title: Rechtvaardigheid van sancties in de sociale zekerheid. Verslag van een vignetonderzoek
abstract: A tension exists between the right to social security and the obligation to work. In this article, it is first shown that - with respect to the unemployed - both principles are accepted by a large majority of the Dutch population. Next, using a factorial survey approach, we analyse judgements concerning the fairness of sanctioning unemployed people by cutting their benefits, when they decline a job offering. This analysis results in four major conclusions. (1) The sanctioning of those who fail to meet the obligation to work, when offered an opportunity, receives wide support. (2) The problem is judged from a perspective of social inequality rather than a perspective of social order. (3) Harsh sanctions are judged less fair when those concerned are more overqualified for the jobs offered, when lower incomes are offered (especially incomes below the level of one's unemployment benefit), and when older unemployed people, who have worked for a longer period, are involved. (4) Harsh sanctions are also judged less fair when married unemployed people are involved - especially when they have children -, since otherwise the partner (and the children) might be harmed. title: Regressieanalyse in opdrachtonderzoek, wat levert het op?
abstract: Examination of 473 research reports shows that regression analysis is still not a frequently used method of analysing data in applied social research. If this method is used, assumptions and measurement problems are dealt with rather carelessly and in the end results are far from substantial. In the equations most of the variables are ordinal in character or dichotomies. Only a minority of the variables meets the usually required interval or ratio level of measurement. Explained variance is in general low, in one third of the equations 5% or less, and too often one is not careful enough in the interpretarion of effects. title: Waarom frauderen alle mensen niet met uitkeringen?
abstract: On the basis of research of fraud with social benefits in a Middletown in the north of Holland, and literature in this field, the question is asked why fraud with social benefits is not a general phenomenon. A review of the literature and the results of this special particular research project suggest that the answer is to be found in the personality of the offender and in the subculture to which he/she belongs. title: Het effect van de Algemene Ouderdomswet op de verdeling van het levensduurinkomen: een nadere analyse via microsimulatie
abstract: This paper looks at the impact of the Dutch General Old Age Pensions Act on the distribution of lifetime wage income, using a dynamic cross-sectional microsimulation model. Both vertical and horizontal redistributional effects are considered. It appears that the lifetime redistribution is considerably smaller than the redistribution measured on the basis of a period approach. The horizontal lifetime redistribution is more important than the vertical one, but this effect also is rather limited, in particular due to the increasing contribution rates and the regressive nature of the contribution levying. title: Het electoraat van de Centrum Partij/Centrum Democraten in de periode 1982-1992
abstract: There are only few studies on the characteristics of the electorate of the Centrum Partij/Centrum Democraten. First, this electorate is described in terms of sociological characteristics, based on accumulated data gathered during the period 1982-1992. Second, fluctuations in this electorate are described over the last decade. Third, several hypotheses derived from two theories concerning the electorate of the former fascist parties are tested. According to the economic interest theory, especially manual laborers and self-employed people are predisposed to vote for extreme right-wing parties. These hypotheses were as yet not falsified. According to the symbolic interest theory, especially socially disintegrated people are predisposed to vote for extreme right-wing parties. These hypotheses were also not falsified. Especially youngsters, people living on social security, unchurched, people living in the big cities of the provinces in the west of the country and people who had previously turned their back on politics appeared to vote for these parties.
